We work daily with the Accounting, Finance, Product, Sales and Operations leadership teams to develop, execute, monitor, and refine initiatives that drive value and quantify that value as it pertains to financial performance. You enjoy working with financial data, generating new reports, and supporting team members

Strong organizational skills; ability to prioritize and handle several projects simultaneously

Work closely with the Accounting, Product, BI and Finance teams to understand reporting needs for new products, revenue streams and expenses
Automate and optimize existing journal entries, where data is obtained from multiple database reports then manually manipulated
Build new financial reports for company’s future use
Analyze, update, and restore existing data and reports
Build complex reports to assist in analyzing financial trends and predicting future results
Troubleshoot existing reports when problems arise
Ad-hoc analysis to support the Finance and Strategy teams
Be the subject matter expert on all things related to the financial tables in the database

Experience with financial report generation and modification
Knowledge of accounting a plus

Position:
Manager, Accounting

Job Description:
The Manager, Accounting will lead areas of the general ledger close and fulfill monthly financial reporting and compliance requirements. This position will oversee the work of lower level accountants and/or accounting managers and resolve escalated research issues. The manager of accounting will build strong working relationships with all levels of finance staff in other locations and supervise/manage a group of senior level and junior level accountants. In addition, this position will be tasked with special projects.

Responsibilities:

• Management of staff - hiring, developing, coaching, training, resource allocation. Talent management, performance management. Provide mentoring and leadership to attract, develop and retain talent.

• Ensure all deadlines related to monthly and quarterly close activities are met.

• Conduct review of journal entries, account reconciliations and financial reporting and analysis completed by General Ledger accounting staff and more junior accounting managers.

• Oversee the research of complex GAAP issues escalated from the staff; provide direction on technical accounting matters.

• Perform due diligence related to mergers/acquisitions, define and manage consolidations as well as all finance related processes, coordinate information exchange and monitor conversion testing. Perform specific merger related accounting tasks in order to ensure purchase transactions/entities are properly accounted for.

• Lead complex special projects related to new processes, issues or changes in structure. Lead internal cross-divisional reporting. Act as liaison for department.

• Provide clean and accurate financial reporting and ensure that all reconciliations are accurate, informative and current.

• Ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley 404 legislation as well as corporate and regional policies and procedures.

• Instill a mindset of continuous process improvement consistent with accounting principles, corporate policies and government regulations.

Qualifications:

• Bachelor's degree in Accounting.
• 6-8 years of related experience and 3+ years of people management experience.
• Strong internal controls, Sarbanes-Oxley and SEC reporting.
• Proven leadership capabilities including the ability to hire and develop strong talent for financial roles.
• Advanced Microsoft Office skills - must be have advanced Excel skills.
• Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills.
• A team player that is a highly motivated self-starter - ability to maintain a cooperative and professional work relationship with internal and external partners.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

• Advanced degree.
• CPA; Public Accounting experience.
• Experience with Oracle ERP Systems and Hyperion.
• International Accounting.
• Experience with Acquisitions.
• Fortune 500 experience.

Position Overview:
Brilliant Earth is hiring a hands-on Accounting Manager. The Accounting Manager is responsible for managing the AP/AR departments. Additionally, this position is responsible for developing and maintaining strong AP/AR practices and procedures, and internal controls in conformity to US GAAP.  
You will also be responsible for communication and implementation of these practices and procedures throughout the organization, and leading key AP/AR process improvement projects.  The Accounting Manager will also support the preparation of monthly and year end close and Financial Statement production, as well as tax and regulatory filings.
The ideal candidate will have a strong track record of making process improvements in the within a rapidly growing finance and accounting team.   The ideal candidate for this role also thrives in fast-paced startup environments and has demonstrated an ability to be effective with finite resources. We are looking for a candidate comfortable operating in a very hands-on fashion, and be comfortable getting into the details of individual accounting and billing transactions.  We have a social and environmental mission at the core of our company and are looking for someone who is enthusiastic about helping us achieve our social goals, as well as our business goals. This position requires on site attendance in our Denver office location. We are not accepting remote applicants at this time.
Key responsibilities include:
Oversee day to day AP/AR operations
Develop and implement internal controls and processes across AP/AR and other accounting functions to drive best practices, improve efficiencies and ensure US GAAP compliance
Manage and develop AP/AR team
Support month-end closing process
Support local, state, and federal government reporting and tax filings
Support and be an active member of project teams
Act as a liaison between the Finance team and Sales, Operations and Marketing regarding accounting processes and procedures 
Respond to inquiries from the VP of Finance & Technology, Controller, Senior Leadership and company managers
Support the preparation of financial statements and financial audits
Support payroll preparation
Specific qualifications:
BS degree in Accounting preferred (CPA a plus)
4+ years’ experience in accounting, including at least 2 years in a managerial capacity
Excellent understanding of accounting principles and experience in applying principles in practice
Experience in closing a general ledger and/or audit, account reconciliation, JE preparation and support       
Experience in driving accounting process improvements
Highest standards of accuracy and precision; highly organized
Intermediate experience with ERP systems, NetSuite a plus
Ability to work across an organization with very good communication skills
Ability to quickly assimilate an understanding of business operations
Experience developing and improving internal controls
Experience with a range of tax and regulatory filings
Experience working with external auditors
Experience with payroll preparation
Retail or e-commerce experience/exposure preferred
Ability to handle long-term projects and urgent tasks seamlessly
Attention to detail
Exceptional time management skills and accountability
Ability to think critically and adapt quickly in a flexible environment
Team player with an ability to work collaboratively
Entrepreneurial spirit  / self-starter
Strong computer skills
Interest in socially and environmentally responsible organizations and products

Workiva's Professional Services team has earned a reputation for providing the highest quality XBRL services in the industry. The success of our accounting professionals is measured by our industry leading satisfaction ratings. This is accomplished through an exceptionally high performing team supported by the best solution for financial reporting professionals (Wdesk - Workiva SEC reporting application).

The Professional Services Manager is an integral position within the organization, working closely internally with Sales, Product Support, Product Management, and Customer Success and externally with Financial Reporting Managers, Directors, and Controllers of public companies. The Professional Services Manager is responsible for customer project management, XBRL data modeling, mapping, tagging and review of customer XBRL projects. A key responsibility is to ensure the highest quality customer XBRL filings.

What You'll Do:
Maintain management responsibility for multiple XBRL professional service engagements
Review financial statements to gain an understanding of the accounting policies to map, model, and tag clients statements for XBRL
Respond in a timely fashion to resolve outstanding customer issues and/or inquiries
Manage issue resolution or assist client as appropriate depending on the type of engagement
Provide supervisor and customer with updates and trend information that impact areas of responsibility
Maintain thorough knowledge of taxonomies, SEC regulations, and US GAAP changes
Provide client training on XBRL and Wdesk application
Work closely with Workiva customer support team members 
What You'll Need:
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Master's in Accounting and CPA preferred
1+ years experience preferred
Project and time management skills
Proven ability to meet critical deadlines
Ability to prioritize multiple and potentially overlapping client requirements
Prevalent sense of customer service
Comprehensive understanding of U.S. GAAP and financial reporting
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills

About Us:
Headquartered in Denver, CO, Ibotta (“I bought a...“) is transforming the shopping experience by making it easy for consumers to earn cash back on everyday purchases through a single smartphone app. The company partners with leading brands and retailers to offer rebates on groceries, electronics, clothing, gifts, home and office supplies, restaurant dining, and more. Ibotta is the premier destination for rewarded shopping on mobile and has paid out $340 million in cash back to its users. Launched in 2012, Ibotta has 28 million downloads and is one of the five most frequently used shopping apps in the United States.

Want to join a talented, creative group of professionals? First Western is hiring an experienced Controller; all from our gorgeous downtown Denver headquarters just steps from Union Station.

This position is a highly visible, key role within our organization. The Controller would lead the Corporate Accounting team in all aspects of preparing financials in compliance with generally accepted accounting principles.  As a Manager of the company’s accounting functions, duties would include corporate accounting & reporting and accounting operations.  This person would be a hands on Leader who brings strength in process improvement, streamlining close cycles and experienced in managing financial reporting according to US GAAP. The Controller would support the CFO in all aspects of accounting and external reporting.
Highlighted Responsibilities:
Guides financial decisions by establishing, monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures.
Directs financial closings and maintains account reconciliations which support the general ledger.
Support FDICIA and SOX compliance and internal control matters.
Train and coach the Accounting team, ensuring the highest standard of performance, teamwork, and service.
Be the US GAAP subject matter expertise to ensure technical issues are well analyzed and reflected in company’s technical memos.
Oversee the corporate tax accounting and tax compliance to ensure all tax treatments and positions are reasonable and defendable. This would include external tax consultants on tax position papers for quarterly review with external auditors.
Establishes and ensures compliance with financial closing schedules (manages closing schedules process improvement in order to provide required financial data in a timely, accurate manner).
Monitors financial trends and provides senior management with detailed reports and analysis; advise on problem matters and recommends courses of action designed to correct or reduce their impact.
Directs the development and implementation of accounting policies and procedures designed to promote compliance with generally accepted accounting principles, promote internal efficiency and address specific problem areas.
Coordinates the activities of external auditors. Manages the audit relationship and the audit activities throughout the year.
Reviews external and internal audit findings. Recommendations and prepares responses to issues raised.
Responsible for the timely and accurate reporting of external filings of the quarterly and yearly SEC and CALL reports.
Maintain current knowledge of and comply with all applicable laws and regulations, policies and procedures.
Other duties as assigned.
Technical Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, or other related field required.
7+ years of experience in a Bank or financial services Accounting role of a public company.
5+ years of supervisory experience.
CPA preferred.
Intermediate-advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office; knowledge of Financial and ERP systems.
Other Requirements:
Strong financial background, with an understanding of overall business operations; proficiency in general accepted accounting principles; understanding of controls related to investing, reporting etc. to ensure accounting team is compliant with SEC rules and regulations including Sarbanes-Oxley; strong analytical skills with the ability to recognize problems, develop and implement solutions; highly motivated with a willingness to assume responsibility and take ownership; must be able to work independently and with a team; must possess a strong sense of urgency to meet deadlines, while maintaining attention to detail and quality of work; ability to respond and prioritize timely and effectively as well as decisive under pressure; ability to develop professional relationships and influence peers and managers.

Accounting Implementation Manager
ServiceTitan is looking for an Accounting Implementation Manager to join our Implementation team. The ideal candidate will have three or more years of professional experience which includes a balanced combination of accounting, analytical skills, and client relationship management. The Accounting Specialist will perform accounting data migrations from our clients’ legacy accounting platform and will assist with configuring our software to accommodate our customers accounting, procurement, and inventory workflows
The person will have three main responsibilities:  1) assist customers with transferring accounting data from various CRM software to QuickBooks or Intacct  platforms, 2) serve as accounting SME and drive internal process improvement efforts, 3) set and manage client expectations. The candidate will be comfortable communicating with personnel at all levels from front line payroll/accounting representatives to Controllers and CFOs.
What you'll do
Perform accounting data conversions from various complex CRM/Accounting software to QuickBooks Online, QuickBooks Desktop, and Intacct
Manage multiple projects at any given time and successfully deliver high quality results.
Act as an QuickBooks/Accounting subject matter expert and contribute to future product development and integration efforts
Be an extremely effective communicator understanding the significance and appropriate use of various communication channels and tone based on circumstances and audience
Serve as the face of the company in front of most impactful clients and skillfully navigate all conversations, from introduction to long term relationship building
Coordinate with cross-functional resources to deliver against defined timelines and client accounting business requirements
Facilitate sessions with client stakeholders to outline scope, goals, deliverables, resource needs and do it all with confidence and a smile
Anticipate project risks and issues, confidently address any and all challenges, mitigate risks and issues and escalate to appropriate parties where required
What you'll need
Four year degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Management (CPA not required)
3-5 years of professional experience which includes at minimum 1-2 years in each of the following areas 1) Accounting  2) Data analysis, 3) Client Management
Knowledge of QuickBooks Online and QuickBooks Desktop preferred but not required
Excellent MS Excel skills, particularly logical and reference functions
Be a problem­-solver who has a demonstrated ability to overcome challenges with creative solutions
Be meticulously detail-­oriented with the ability to multi­task, manage client expectations and align external resources for quality and timely delivery of projects
Natural ability to think several steps ahead of the client and take proactive steps to address roadblocks and issues
A track record of being a team player and leader with strong interpersonal and communications skills
Familiarity with software and agile development is a plus.
Knowledge of accounting workflows that relate to procurement, inventory, job costing, and deferred revenue

About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 5,000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nationâ€™s 20 leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.

Position Summary

The role is responsible for the accounting, managing, and administration of all externally and internally funded grants, royalties, clinical trials, donation funded grants as well as other research and service agreements. It must demonstrate professional leadership and interdepartmental collaboration on multiple organizational levels as well as full knowledge of federal OMB circulars and compliance with appropriate regulations and policies as required by multiple funding agencies, in particular, A-21, A-110, A-133 and new Uniform Guidance. The role has the overall responsibility to ensure that research revenues are appropriately accounted for in the proper period. This includes proactive design of tools and reports that will provide rigor to assist in the identification of issues when they occur in order to provide real time solutions.

The Post Award Manager is a key resource in grant regulations and compliance matters. It not only has post award financial oversight for all grants and contacts, but also overall PeopleSoft financial responsibility including internal and external reporting, audits, billing and cash collection as well as any other grant related financial data. Other responsibilities include the creation and closeout of grants within the PeopleSoft projects module, monitoring budget and expense activity and assisting Research Departments in the fiscal management of their grants. It must work closely with Finance, Research Administration, Graduate School and other administrative offices for developing and implementing grant policy and procedures that ensure compliance with federal/state or donor stipulations, as well as City of Hope policy.

The Post Award Accounting Manger must have the ability to hire, develop, and mentor the cross functional Grant teams within the organization. He/she needs to build an effective team that delivers a highly productive team, optimal customer service which is also accountable for the highest quality of performance.
Manage the day to day operations of the Project Accounting department through an effective team to ensure quality performance of award maintenance, account creation, budget and expense analysis, accounting system updates, expenditure review and approval, including cost transfers, preparation and processing of journal entries, re-budgeting, financial reporting, cash management (including draw downs, projections, billings, receipts, accounting for interest income and collection activities),reconciliation analysis, and proper accountability of all funds to funding agencies and external donors.
Assist in the resolution of complex grant issues and enterprise wide problems.
Overall responsibility for financial governance of extramurally funded grants, clinical trial agreements, discretionary funds, and donation funded grants, PI Projects, and royalties.
Review and approves journal entries affecting grants and other research departments.
Represent Corporate Grant Accounting in cross functional meetings as required.
Develop, implement and maintain of all internal Sponsored Programs Accounting procedures and management information reporting, including reports designed to promote operational efficiency and improved services to user department and post audit and accounting activities.
Publish grants management information that supports compliance with agency, donor and City of Hope policy; improve processes and procedures for proper budgeting, accounting and reporting of research activities in accordance with government regulations and other sponsor requirements, including donors and internal requirements.
Oversees, reviews and interprets grant and contract agreements.
Ensure full technical knowledge of OMB rules and regulations and City of Hope policies and procedures of the entire Grant Accounting Team.
Regularly evaluate and assess the need for updating training material, including recommending changes to existing or implementation of new policies which would provide better control and service or improve efficiency.
Work closely with other COH departments and leadership to ensure regulation compliance and procedure development.
Develop, implement and maintain of all internal Sponsored Programs Accounting procedures and management information reporting, including reports designed to promote operational efficiency and improved services to user department and post audit and accounting activities.
Publish grants management information that supports compliance with agency, donor and City of Hope policy; improve processes and procedures for proper budgeting, accounting and reporting of research activities in accordance with government regulations and other sponsor requirements, including donors and internal requirements.
Oversees, reviews and interprets grant and contract agreements.
Ensure full technical knowledge of OMB rules and regulations and City of Hope policies and procedures of the entire Grant Accounting Team.
Regularly evaluate and assess the need for updating training material, including recommending changes to existing or implementation of new policies which would provide better control and service or improve efficiency.
Work closely with other COH departments and leadership to ensure regulation compliance and procedure development.
Review and approve all Financial Status Reports required by the various funding agencies.
Maintains close communication with internal and external audit groups and outside agencies in settling interpretation and application of regulations, audit concerns, and other issues regarding sponsored accounts.
Re-engineer processes, reporting and system automations to increase productivity so that the team can focus on delivering insights to the business, especially Research department.
Participate in managing the A-133 audit program; meets with the auditors to explain/clarify City of Hope policies and procedures in carrying out their audit assignments; assists with resolving issues with auditors and agency personnel.
Represent Grant Accounting in Fringe Rate Proposal Working Group as well as F&A Rate Proposal Working Group as a Lead Manager.
Work on special projects as needed.

Position Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance.
10 plus years of Accounting and administration including a minimum of 6 years in Grant related accounting.Demonstrated progressive responsibilities, including a minimum of 5 years managing professional staff.

Skills/Abilities
Extensive knowledge of grants management regulations in particular, A-21, A-110, A-133 and new Uniform Guidance.
Prior experience with internal and external audits.
Demonstrated ability to develop and implement policies, procedures and best practices.
Manage multiple concurrent projects.
Strong working knowledge of PeopleSoft contracts, projects, billing and accounts receivable modules.
Clear and effective communicator and proven ability to manage and supervise staff.
Must excel in interpersonal skills, organizational skills, oral and written communication/presentation skills, analytical, as well as critical thinking skills.
Must have expertise in establishing and maintaining positive working relationship.
Must be an active member of a Research Administration organization to keep abreast of current changes in the research community.
Demonstrate ability to work independently, establishing priorities to complete projects on a timely manner and meet urgent demands.

NFL Summer Internship Program participants have the opportunity to contribute to the organization's success while receiving an unmatched, behind-the-scenes learning experience. Though interns work within specific departments, they are able to explore all aspects of the business of professional football through challenging project assignments, speaker presentations, mentoring relationships, and networking opportunities.
Internship Details:
NFL Media oversees the League's online, network, & mobile presence for both studio and remote event based shoots. This internship will support the Production Accounting team which processes the day to day expenses and manages budget tracking for multiple departments and show budgets. The intern will assist in daily accounting tasks, as well as assist with ad hoc projects
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist the Production Accounting team with daily administrative tasks
Generate and reconcile accounts payable reports
Perform budget data input through use of Excel and a custom tool
Support Accounting team in reconciling various reports to compare year over year
Assist in developing ad hoc reports and analyses
Interact with various departments including Production Management, Digital Media, Scheduling, Operations, Human Resources, and Finance
Gain understanding of how the NFL Media environment functions day-to-day
JOB REQUIREMENTS
In pursuit of Accounting, Finance, Business, or Economics
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
The summer program covers a minimum of 9 weeks, from Monday, June 4, 2018 through Friday, August 3rd, 2018. Please note that some departments may require their interns to work past the official end date. If so, this will be communicated to the applicant during the interview process. Interns will be required to work five (5) full days (approximately 40 hours) per week. Interns will be paid an hourly rate for their work.
Due to the high volume of applicants, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. If you are not selected, you will receive an email notification. Please do not contact the NFL regarding the status of your application.

We solve real world problems in the home services industry. We are passionate about bringing innovative and delightful solutions to traditional problems and workflows. Our ambitious team of product managers, designers, and product marketers works closely with our thousands of users to help make their lives easier through technology. We embrace agile development and design thinking to ship hundreds of new features every month. We measure our success based on our customer’s success. We strive for real impact.
Product Manager, Accounting Product
As a Product Manager on the financial products team, you will be an early member of a highly talented and fast-paced team that is responsible for adding new mission critical accounting features to the core product. You will own all aspects of the product feature including go-to-market strategy, roadmap prioritization, full product lifecycle development, and ultimately be responsible for the continuing success of the product feature. Our accounting features are used rigorously and you will have the opportunity to make a large impact for our users and internal teams.
Our approach is both customer-focused and data-driven. So you will need to dig in to deeply understand our customers and their needs, define and analyze experiments, and guide the team to move fast and ship solutions.
What you'll do
Discovery and Ideation: Work closely with users to identify their biggest problems and develop elegant solutions to address their needs.
Product Strategy: Understand and prioritize user needs from customer analytics, user research, and competitive analysis. Develop a roadmap that excites our customers.
Product Ownership: Evangelize the product to our internal teams (support, implementation and success) and customers. Define the success criteria and iterate until you exceed it.
Delivery and Execution: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement and deliver product features on time while adapting to unforeseen events. Define, plan, and communicate key milestones to partners and stakeholders.
Launch: Develop go-to-market strategy with product marketing and external partners. Measure the success of the product and continuously gather feedback from users.
Measure Success: Define the key objectives and ensure KPIs are tracked for measuring success
What you'll need
1-3 years experience in a product management role or 3-5 years experience implementing accounting systems
Strong customer empathy and experience shaping product direction and execution based on customer needs
4-year degree from a top university, MBA or related graduate degree strongly preferred
Domain experience with invoices and/or accounting with strong understanding of accounting principles and workflows
Experience building or implementing modern SaaS applications
Passion for working in fast paced environments and delivering delightful customer experiences

About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 5,000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nationâ€™s 20 leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.

Position Summary

The Department of Shared Services provides a wide range of business and support services to City of Hopeâ€™s vendors, donors, and employees including faculties, nurses, administrative staff and students in high quality, effective and efficient manner across the enterprise for our Clinical, Research, Philanthropy and Administrative Operations. The department provides successful leadership and management of infrastructure functions delivering effective, efficient and value-adding services and processes to the institution that are directly aligned with patient needs.

Reporting directly to the Vice President, Corporate Accounting & Operations, this position will be responsible for building service level agreements and managing resourc­es to ensure support for all City of Hope Medical Center & Affiliates across our main hospital campus, 29 community sites as well as our research, philanthropy, and administrative locations.

The Executive Director, Shared Services is a professional who applies knowledge of the financial system, accounting guidelines and controls, budget management, as well as business practices. The position will work closely with multiple stakeholders including HR, Procurement, Philanthropy, Research, Finance and Accounting on financial close and reporting, policies & procedures, control, and compliance. This role will act as a strategic partner for the Vice President, Corporate Accounting & Operations as well as the Chief Financial Officer as it relates to the identification of system and business process improvements and the right staffing model to support City of Hope & Affiliates. The right candidate will have proven skills and the ability to manage projects from inception to completion.

Essential Functions

This position will oversee three critical financial operation areas with the­ highest level of quality control over all transactions. The operation areas include Employee and Physician Payroll for 6000+ individuals including complex incentive and executive compensation plans; Accounts Payable including assisting with procurement and payment requests as well as enterprise business expense reimbursement; Gift administration responsible for daily processing for all Philanthropy contributions as well as any non-clinical cash processing for the enterprise.

The Executive Director will manage related month-end and year-end close processes, including liaison with internal and external auditors. Prepare and publish timely monthly reporting in support of financial close, management reporting as well as any necessary regulatory and compliance reporting. Develops and enhances accurate and reliable enterprise standardized financial analyses and reports. Ad-hoc reports and business insights are created by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing relevant information including historical and industry trends and performance against established service level agreements. Prepare and present presentations to executive management teams at the finance leadership, enterprise senior leadership as well as any necessary board meetings.

This position needs to develop and document business processes as well as policies and procedures to maintain and strengthen internal controls; research technical financial and accounting issues for compliance including GAAP; manage and comply with local, state, and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings related to these three financial operation areas. It also requires necessary recommended optimization and development changes to ERP and related financial systems. Additionally, the Executive Director will identify opportunities and makes recommendations for productivity improvements, cost savings, and revenue enhancement initiatives that support the organizationâ€™s strategic and financial goals. Gives input for establishing strategic goals and priorities based on organizational needs assessment and partner with functional leads within shared services to identify best practices and operational efficiencies.

Additionally, the Executive Director maintain financial staff by recruiting, orienting, training and mentoring employees which is a key part of the next level leadership talent development and succession planning process in Finance and Accounting.

Goals and objectives
Responsible for setting the direction, establishing strategies, goals, and objectives of the Corporate Accounting Shared Service Team including Payroll, Accounts Payable and Gift Administration.

Organizational design
Establish the optimal organizational design, processes, and procedures to achieve Corporate Accounting Shared Serviceâ€™s objectives.

Customer Service
Responsible for providing timely financial reporting and analysis for all reporting entities.

Corporate Accounting & Finance Leader
Take an active role as a business leader in the Finance organization and support the overall objectives of the business.

External relationships and knowledge
Work jointly with Executive Director, Corporate Controller and Executive Director, Corporate Accounting representing COH with both internal and external auditors. Obtain and maintain necessary healthcare and GAAP related finance and accounting knowledge.

Leadership on cross-functional teams
Provide strong finance and accounting leadership on cross-functional units consisting of key players within the finance leadership organization as well as external stakeholders.

Associate Hire, Training & Development
Lead a strong Shared Service team of 28 for the centralized corporate accounting operations department that supports all COH internal & external entities. Responsible for the hiring, training, development, and coaching of staff by keeping them current on accounting principles and COH competencies. Create an environment that promotes a high performing team atmosphere with motivation to learn and grow.

Financial System Stabilization and Optimization
Collaborate with financial system support team, IT, as well as other Finance departments on opportunities to provide effective and efficient tools utilizing ERP as well as other system automation and enhancements.

Process Improvements
Make recommendation to CFO, VP Corporate Accounting & Operations, as well as key finance leadership members on continuous improvement of established processes and procedures; recommend new processes to ensure that business requirements and needs are met.

Business Continuation Process
Ensure that business continuation process is up to date, in place and can be activated if required to reduce process risk due to possible catastrophic event.

#LI-MA

About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 5,000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nationâ€™s 20 leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.

Position Summary

The Senior Analyst, Corporate Financial Accounting & Reporting will be responsible for the analysis of financial information to determine fair presentation in conformity with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and for developing and maintaining analytical management reports pertaining to assets, liabilities, revenues, expenses and cash flows of the organization. The individual will be required to develop a robust understanding of City of Hope financial reporting structures so as to analyze, prepare and effectively communicate information arising from changes in operations, acquisitions and/or other integration activities.

The individual will partner with Corporate Accountants, Business Analysts and other key stakeholders to implement financial reporting improvements such as enhancing the use of new and existing systems and tools, customizing financial measurement models in PeopleSoft, rationalizing the number and use of cost centers in the system, optimizing accrual and reserve methodologies, improving manual and automated procedures and leading the preparation of external regulatory reports.

The individual will also be accountable for various month-end close activities including preparing a consolidated analysis of financial performance, providing insights into complex accounting transactions, compiling the month end reporting package, coordinating the resolution of inquiries and identifying corrective actions arising from financial review and monitoring timely preparation of balance sheet reconciliations in Blackline. These responsibilities will require continuous assessment of month end close procedures in order to identify opportunities for improvement.

Additionally, the individual will have accountability for developing, maintaining, and monitoring compliance of a governance framework which will be the foundation for a strong internal controls environment within the organization. This framework will form the basis upon which to maintain the GL and ensure standardized use of accounts and application of policies across entities. Success in this area will safeguard the integrity of City of Hope financials and ensure a successful audit.

To this extent, the individual will be required to make recommendations as to how to close current gaps within the control environment. Recommendations should be based on discussions with the manager as well as Internal Audit. Current process opportunities include but are not limited to establishing Segregation of Duty guidelines, standardizing materiality levels, and creating overall best practices on good governance.

Essential Functions
The following framework illustrates essential functions which are required for the success of the role.
Work closely with stakeholders to develop reports needed to perform key processes.
Identify and quantify issues that impact financial data and work with line manager to achieve timely resolution.
Perform analyses of financial performance, forecast and trends and provide insights to management to ensure continued conformance with financial objectives.
Prepare and/or interpret complex or very complex accounting transactions and records. Analyze data in order to initiate/recommend corrective action as needed.
Conduct meetings with Corporate Accounting leadership team to discuss and present reporting solutions.
Conduct periodic meetings with GL Accountants and other stakeholders to analyze variances of actuals vs budget and to understand the enterprise.
Help prepare quarterly presentations for the CFO to Committees and Board of Directors.
Help prepare financial information to external stakeholders.
Provide thorough review of controls & risk assessment for the enterprise. Will include creation, maintenance, and monitoring compliance of an overarching controls document for the City of Hope Corporate Accounting team.
Actively identify (and close) control gaps and various deficiencies. Examples include Segregation of Duty conflicts, gaps in levels of authority matrices, standardization of materiality levels utilized in day to day tasks (including flux analysis), etc.
Support the close process (month and year-end). This will include (but is not limited to) monthly intercompany settlement process, consolidation of City of Hope financial statements, customization of PeopleSoft reports and preparation of various month end reports.
Play a lead role in year-end tasks including preparation of financial statements and footnote disclosures as deemed necessary by line manager.
Ensure integrity of the financial statements by monitoring appropriate use of GL accounts and cost centres and recommending changes such as inactivation of cost centres and GL accounts.
Monitor timeliness of reconciliations in Blackline and publish status reports.
Support line manager in providing an assessment of current GL processes such as request for chart strings, accrual methodologies etc. and provide recommendations.
Provide the necessary interface to internal and external audit teams as required and provide necessary information regarding accounting procedures and data.
Lead in the development and implementation of new systems or enhance existing systems to resolve problems or improve accounting/financial processes.
Follow established City of Hope and department policies, procedures, objectives, performance improvement, attendance, safety, environmental, and infection control guidelines includingadherence to theworkplaceCode of Conduct and Compliance Plan.
Practice a high level of integrity and honesty in maintaining confidentiality.
Embody the team vision.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned.

Position Qualifications
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Accounting/Finance or Business related field. MBA and CPA Preferred.
5+ years preferably in a corporate finance role.
Must have demonstrated financial accounting skills and controls.
Public and Private Accounting experience a plus.

Skills/Abilities
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills are required.
Must be able to influence across organizational functions in achieving the enterpriseâ€™s strategic goals.
Proven ability to translate financial data into information to drive sound business decisions, and deliver messages at the appropriate level for the audience.
Well-developed organization skills to manage multiple projects and priorities.
Ability to make sound decisions with minimal supervision.
Must have innovative mindset in ensuring that the organization is adapting accordingly with the changing environment.

A Better company
It’s hard not to be excited about mortgages when you’re actively upending the conventions of a $13 trillion dollar business that impacts over 200 million Americans.
At Better, we’re building a next-generation mortgage platform from the ground up. We’ve already funded $1 billion in loans, and we’re just getting started. Our team combines leading software engineers from tech giants like Google and Spotify with financial talent from firms like Blackstone and Bridgewater, creating a hybrid institution unlike any other.
Rife with antiquated processes, the home finance industry has remained fundamentally unchanged since the 1970s. As we break down the entrenchments that bar so many from the benefits of homeownership, we adhere to three basic principles:
Humans are better than computers at expressing empathy, understanding individual situations, and creating solutions to help people. Let them.
Computers are more efficient than humans at working with massive data sets, performing complex calculations, and validating thousands of rules. Use them.
The rules of the status quo are broken. Change them.
Join our mortgage revolution.
A Better opportunity
Better is looking for a Finance & Accounting Associate to help establish a solid financial foundation for our fast-growing, fintech company. Our Corporate Finance team runs lean, so you’ll be expected to take ownership of a variety of ongoing projects and special engagements.
We believe in building a meritocracy that rewards great work with greater responsibility; this is an opportunity to make your own path within our organization. We encourage resourcefulness, respect diligence, and are excited to see the impact that your hands-on attitude will have on our organization.
Responsibilities will include:
Designing systems and processes to streamline everything you touch - build yourself out of the job
Collaborating with department heads and leveraging knowledge of financial reporting standards to shape our policies and procedures
Supporting financial planning and budget setting processes
Using your analytical abilities to inform and influence decision makers
Owning and improving the month end close process from bookkeeping activities through consolidation of monthly financial statements across multiple entities
Attributes we value
Command of the principles of accounting and financials analysis
Integrity, grit, and an insatiable desire to understand deeply
Ability to operate autonomously, handle ambiguity and make sound decisions
1-3 years of experience in a finance/accounting role at a management consulting firm, Big 4 accounting firm, or similar institution (you understand capital and Excel might just be your happy place)

Job Description:

BlackRock is one of the world's preeminent asset management firms and a premier provider of global investment management, risk management and advisory services to institutional, intermediary and individual investors around the world. BlackRock offers a range of solutions - from rigorous fundamental and quantitative active management approaches aimed at maximizing outperformance to highly efficient indexing strategies designed to gain broad exposure to the world's capital markets. Our clients can access our investment solutions through a variety of product structures, including individual and institutional separate accounts, mutual funds and other pooled investment vehicles, and the industry-leading iShares® ETFs.

Business Unit Overview:

The Global Compensation Accounting team is responsible for recording all items related to Compensation and Benefits in the financial records of BlackRock, comprising over half of BlackRock's cost base. The Global Compensation Accounting team forms part of the Finance Controllers team and consists of two hubs based in NYC and Edinburgh.

Job Purpose/Background:

This is an Associate position based in NYC. The key responsibility of this role being oversight of accounting pertaining to employee benefits within the US, Canada and Latin America. In addition, the candidate will be responsible for the global accounting relating to employees with mobility between regions a fast and growing area for BlackRock. A key aspect of the role is to work with primary stakeholders to improve the end-to-end process for both US benefit and mobility programs. As such the candidate will be working alongside stakeholders from HR and external tax professionals and providing support to Finance Controllers and internal tax teams. Responsible for coordinating the completion of monthly expense and balance sheet variance analysis reporting packages and reviewed with management. The role reports to the Head of Americas Compensation Accounting.

Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for all benefit and mobility accounting month end close deliverables Responsible for preparing reconciliations and subsequent certification of the balance sheet, in particular hypothetical tax withholding and other mobility related accounts.
Full responsibility for supporting and driving process improvement for all aspects of mobility and benefit accounting
Liaise and build strong working relationships with Payroll, Human Resources and other parts of Finance including legal entity controllers and tax.
Oversight of inter-company journal preparation for internal recharges of mobility related costs
Drive process improvements including automation of Revenue Recognition (IFRS 15) bookings and allocation of benefits to business cost centers

Development Value:
Project management and process improvement experience
Opportunity to make a difference and have high impact on key stakeholders such as BlackRock Finance
Collaboration with internal partners located across the globe within a multinational organization.


Knowledge/Experience:
Experience or working knowledge of general ledger systems, such as Oracle Financials, and the impact of benefit and compensation related transactions
Ability to challenge the status quo in a rapidly changing environment

Job Description:

The accounting operations teams are responsible for ensuring that the financial results of T-Mobile are accurately presented to T-Mobile leadership under both US GAAP and IFRS. There are a variety of teams within accounting operations: corporate accounting, accounting policy, supply chain accounting, equipment sales accounting, revenue accounting and fixed asset accounting, each responsible for diverse areas of accounting, allowing for a variety of opportunities for professional growth and development across the teams.

Manager, Accounting Corporate Accounting

This role is a leadership role specifically responsible for managing the accounting for TMUS' Equity and Payroll transactions and will report to the Senior Manager of Corporate Accounting. This position is responsible for highly visible, externally reported information, so a diligent, hands-on manager is needed to ensure accuracy of results.
This position will manage individual contributor roles and oversee the monthly close process, various projects, and business relationships both inside and outside the company. This position will be responsible for developing and implementing process improvements and integrating various initiatives associated with T-Mobile's growing and highly dynamic business.



Responsibilities:

Responsibilities
Ensure accounting records, monthly accounting close activities, and variance analysis are properly prepared, maintained and explained in a timely manner.
Accountable for identifying and communicating risks and issues impacting financial area of responsibility.
Establish structure and standards to ensure appropriate internal controls are in place and operating effectively.
Understands business drivers and their effect on financial results to ensure business changes are accurately reflected in the financial processes and analysis.
Manage departmental projects and process changes to improve efficiencies in work processes and to reduce work in low value activities.
Responsible for journal entries, complex balance sheet reconciliations and variance analysis in accordance with US GAAP and IFRS.
Deep understanding of the transactional flow through various systems to monitor and ensure accurate financial results.
Work closely with Accounting Policy, External Reporting, Tax, FP&A, Executive Compensation, and other accounting operations teams to ensure deliverables are completed timely and accurately.
Participate in enterprise projects to ensure appropriate requirements are developed based on a solid understanding of the impacted systems and the transactional flow, and ensuring regression testing is performed.
Responsible for driving department goals and vision forward within the team.
Provide review of work of other team members, providing constructive feedback, guidance and coaching to other team members while maintaining positive relationships.
Coach and develop business, system, process and accounting acumen, including awareness of team member's career goals and promoting development of team members.
As a Leader you are focused on strategy and planning while developing and guiding your team. You demonstrate and showcase your leadership abilities by:
SETTING PERFORMANCE DIRECTION: Translating broader business initiatives into clear team objectives and concrete individual goals, aligning appropriately with other groups for efficient, coordinated action.
MOTIVATING OTHERS: Creating a team environment where everyone wants to do their best and deliver results.
DELEGATING: Broadly sharing responsibility and accountability of both routine and important tasks and decisions. Let direct reports finish their own work.
DEVELOPING AND COACHING OTHERS: Having awareness of each person's career goals; hold development discussions; and provide challenging tasks and assignments to promote development.
HOLDING PEOPLE ACCOUNTABLE: Monitoring progress and results; give feedback effectively and make tough decisions when appropriate.


Qualifications:

Experience with accounting for complex equity transactions and payroll compensation arrangements under US GAAP required; experience with IFRS reporting a plus.
Deep understanding of business drivers and their effect on financial results required.
Broad knowledge of accounting with strong leadership and decision-making skills.
Ability to develop goals and the process by which to meet goals based on provided objectives.
Proven professional with advanced understanding of accounting theory, current accounting issues, and accounting systems, with solid understanding of US GAAP and IFRS.
SAP and BPC experience a plus.
Effectively communicates with all levels of management and cross-functional teams.
Ability to interact with peers and team members to gain cooperation amongst the teams to meet objectives.
Ability to develop and conduct presentations of technical information related to financial results, projects or accounting issues.
Strong leadership skills including the ability to build trust and develop strong cross-functional relationships across the organization to achieve common goals.
Strong organizational and time management skills and the ability to successfully manage priorities with excellent attention to detail.
High proficiency in Excel and Word required, and working knowledge of PowerPoint a plus.
Ability to resolve complex problems positively and professionally.
Demonstrated ability to adapt and excel in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.

Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree in Accounting required. CPA preferred.
7+ years relevant accounting experience or 5+ years in public accounting, with at least 2 years managing teams.
Public accounting and/or financial services industry accounting experience preferred.
Large public company experience preferred.

The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in technical and/or operational accounting, the ability to work with large volumes of data, experience with complex Excel models/analysis, and well-versed on assessing accounting impacts to enterprise-wide system integrations/implementations. Manage projects on behalf of the team through testing, deployment, and implementation.
Serve as a resource to support the monthly operations of the team to ensure that the team's area of financial statement responsibility is in accordance with US GAAP and IFRS.

Broad knowledge of accounting with strong leadership and decision-making skills.

Effectively communicates with all levels of management and cross-functional teams.
Ability to interact with peers and team members to gain cooperation amongst the teams to meet objectives.
Ability to develop and conduct presentations of technical information related to projects or accounting issues.
Strong organizational and time management skills and the ability to balance a large group of diverse projects simultaneously with excellent attention to detail.

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance. CPA preferred. Masters preferred.
7+ years relevant accounting experience or 5+ years of public accounting experience with a regional or Big Four accounting firm.

Wireless industry accounting experience preferred.

External Description
The Financial Analyst, Payroll & Benefits analyzes and reconciles all aspects of the payroll and benefits functions. This position also participates in corporate pension and financial audits.
Requirements
Required Education/Experience:
- Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business Administration, or related field.
- Minimum five years of payroll and accounting experience.

Preferred:
- Nonprofit organization experience.
- Healthcare experience.
- CPA and public accounting experience.
- Experience with accounts receivable, external audits, and tax reporting.
- Proficiency with large accounting systems (i.e., Lawson).

Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

Attractions of the Job

We are seeking an experienced Senior Accountant who is excited to take ownership of one of F5's more complex accounting and operational processes. Recent changes in accounting guidance focused on sales commissions will provide the chance for immediate impact. Broader experience is also accessible through the understanding of the Company's various sales plans and sales organization structure through collaboration with our Sales Operations team. In this role, you will gain the experience with some of our accounting and budgeting software tools such as IBM Incentive Compensation Management (ICM) and Salesforce. As a member of the accounting team, there will be opportunities to receive added responsibilities to further growth potential.

What will you do?

You will be responsible for performing and coordinating the accounting for our sales commissions. You will report to the Accounting Manager and will function as a segment of our accounting team. The role demands inter-departmental partnership with the our international accounting teams and the Sales Operations team.

Your Day-To-Day
Maintain process flow documents across all business locations for accounting for sales commissions through collaboration with multiple Company departments including IT, Sales Operations, Legal and Finance.
Apply sound professional judgement to understand and identify process risks and their potential impact on financial statement line items.
Design and implement SOX controls to address material risks related to all relevant management assertions surrounding the process.
Calculate and book monthly and quarterly commission accruals ensuring the entries are accurately calculated and appropriately supported.
Summarize and present monthly and quarterly accrual results to the international accounting teams, the Corporate Controller, and Finance.
Coordinate with Sales Operations and Finance to ensure completeness of data used to calculate sales commission earnings and accruals.
Administer quarterly sales plan approvals for the entire sales team to support the accuracy of sales plan data.
Perform monthly reconciliations to support the completeness and accuracy of commission liability and asset balances.
Process monthly commission payments and review for accuracy by utilizing criteria to identify specific individuals and sales plans that are at greater risk of error; submit results to payroll for processing.
Work with Sales Operations and IT to test updates and changes to ICM software. This includes identifying all risks associated with the change and designing procedures and controls to address these risks.
Work with Sales Operations and Finance to understand sales commission plans and commission plan changes to identify impacts on current accounting processes in consideration of workload, efficiency, and current accounting guidance.
Prepare audit deliverables on a timely basis and participate in process walkthroughs with both internal and external auditors clearly communicating process risks and controls.
Provide valuable insight for continuous improvement of company processes.
Performs other related duties as assigned.


Bring These Skills with You
You posses strong analytical and quantitative skills with a high attention to detail, good judgment showing logic-based decision-making, and a hands-on approach.
Demonstrate proficient written and interpersonal communication skills, to work effectively across multi-department teams, domestically and globally.
Highly focused & self-motivated - drive tasks from start to finish with efficiency.
Utilize your strong collaboration skills, you will manage multiple tasks and work effectively in a team environment.
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information.
Strong skills in Excel/Microsoft Office required. Experience with Oracle eBS, Blackline, SalesForce, or IBM Incentive Compensation Management a plus.
Strong planning and organization abilities; can multi-task effectively and front loads work to meet key close deadlines.
Flexible and open to new ideas and processes.
Show us your sound judgments or solve problems independently, knowing when to bring situations to the attention of management.
Flexible with overtime, if necessary, during the quarter-end and year-end close and reporting cycle.


Required Qualifications
You have 5+ years of total relevant-accounting experience working in public or private accounting positions.
A Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance, or equivalent related work experience.


Preferred Qualifications
Big 4 public accounting is highly preferred.
Having your CPA is a plus.
Background and knowledge working with Oracle EBS or a related ERP system


Physical Demands and Work Environment
Sometimes, we might need you to be on call and have you work outside your normal work hours (evenings and weekends). Occasional travel by car or airplane may be needed.
Job may be performed on-site at a customer facility or data center, or in an office environment sitting at a desk or computer table.
Job requires the ability to lift up to 50 lbs.

What We Do:

It is an exciting time to join F5's small but ever growing tax department. Internally, F5 Network's is going through the transformation from a hardware-centric technology company to a cloud-based nimble operation. This means that there are a lot of cutting edge tax issues that you will get the opportunity to research, analyze, communicate and just plain geek out on. Externally, with the largest US tax reform in a generation and the OECD's BEPS initiatives taking shape, we get to operate in a dynamically evolving tax landscape.

Why is this job cool?

We offer opportunities to be exposed to all aspects of international tax - planning, transactions, US and foreign tax analyses, business mentorship, and everything in between. If you want to take care of intellectually meaningful issues in a broad array of areas and grow as a well-rounded international tax professional, this is the place.

Here's What You'll Do:
Partner with tax leadership in quantifying the financial impacts of tax laws and business initiatives by developing and maintaining complex models.
Research, document, and provide recommendations on various tax issues.
Support international tax and transfer pricing audits by analyzing data and drafting responses.
Efficiently lead multiple time-sensitive projects.
You will proactive in Dedicatedly developing and handling milestones and communication plans for long-term projects.
Act as the primary tax department contact for international tax compliance matters, including regular communication with regional accounting teams and outside service providers in multiple countries, coordination of foreign income tax return compliance with accounting and legal teams, and final review of returns
Improve and develop processes where needed


How you Qualify For The Position:
5 to 7 years of corporate income tax experience with at least 3 years of international tax focus
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting / Taxation or equivalent related experience.


Your Talent Toolbox will Include:
Secondary University Degree in Tax or Law Degree desired
Certified Public Accountant or equivalent preferred
Big 4 accounting firm experience preferred
Working knowledge of transactional taxes
Knowledge of cross-border income taxation laws
Knowledge of accounting for income taxes under US GAAP, IFRS, or equivalent
Strong inter-personal and project management skills
Strong Microsoft Excel skills
Experience with Oracle financial applications helpful

The Financial Planning & Analysis team oversees our investments in headcount, operating expenses and capital investment. Your responsibilities will include the creation, tracking, reporting and analysis of investments in headcount, operating expenses and capital expenditures for Facebook Reality Labs as our business grows. You will gain invaluable experience in a position that offers significant responsibility and interaction with business partners as well as considerable opportunity to have a large impact within a growing Finance organization. Drive process improvements by partnering with up-stream process owners and enhance current tools/systems related to financial management
Develop forecasting models in a dynamic research and development environment

Experience with PowerPoint, Oracle and Hyperion

At HUB International, we are a team of entrepreneurs. We believe in empowering our clients, and we do so by protecting businesses and individuals in our local communities. We help businesses evaluate their risks and develop solutions tailored to their needs. We believe in empowering our employees. As a global firm, we offer employees resources in both technology and industry expertise, but we still maintain the local flavor of our offices. Our structure enables our teams to maintain their own unique, regional culture.

HUB is the 7th largest global insurance and employee benefits broker, providing a broad array of property, casualty, risk management, life and health, employee benefits, investment and wealth management products and services. With over 10,000 employees in 450 offices throughout North America, HUB has grown substantially, in part due to our industry leading success in mergers and acquisitions.

Here's Where You Come In

We are currently seeking an Agency Bill Specialist to join our growing Commercial Insurance team. You'll be invoicing all agency bill items for the Northwest, review account set up to ensure accuracy, and work with the central accounting team to ensure payments are made on accounts. Other tasks include completing finance agreement transactions, review and update all commissions for the carrier, producer and agency, and maintaining accurate billing info in our agency management system (EPIC).

You're Great At

Ideally you'll be well versed in customer service, with excellent verbal and written communications. You should also have at least 2 years accounting experience and if you have worked with EPIC before that is a plus. Working with Microsoft Office products is a daily occurrence and strong knowledge in these applications will help.

Here's What We Can Offer:

At HUB we are committed to providing a diverse and challenging work environment encouraging critical thinking, problem-solving and project management. Our teams thrive on a collaborative environment while embracing and celebrating individual achievements.

We offer competitive pay and an excellent benefits package, including medical, dental, vision and 401k with employer matching. We all strive for a healthy work life balance so we offer paid holidays and a generous paid time off policy.

Still Interested?

Take the first step towards a rewarding career and future with HUB, we want to hear from you! Apply today!

Job Description:

Sr Capital Markets Manager

The Sr. Capital Markets Manager will play a critical role to optimize T-Mobile's capital structure and liquidity, which is a key activity for the company given approximately $30B debt outstanding. This role will execute financing strategies and transactions, including debt, equity and alternative financing structures. The ideal candidate will strategically analyze the pros and cons of various financing strategies and make recommendations to the Assistant Treasurer and Treasurer to support the achievement of company financial objectives. There will be regular interface with other functional areas of Treasury, Corporate Accounting, Tax, FP&A, and Legal.



Responsibilities:

More specifically, this role will assume the following responsibilities:
Play a key role in executing bond offerings, capital lease transactions, credit facilities , equity and equity-linked, and other alternative financing structures.
Ensure compliance with debt covenants in various debt agreements.
Develop pricing, terms and conditions of transactions with financial institutions. Responsible for financial contract drafting for financial products.
Design and run credit rating models to support senior management business decisions.
Create and update debt investor and rating agency presentations.
Prepare economic and financial analyses of markets, industry, and peers for Treasurer's presentations to the Board of Directors. Make recommendations as appropriate.
Support preparation of monthly and quarterly closings and SEC filings including 10Q and 10K filing, communicating with other departments to ensure consistency and accuracy of information.
Build solid business relationships across cross-functional teams, including Treasury, Corporate Accounting, Tax, FP&A, and Legal to help achieve enterprise-wide objectives.


Qualifications:

Candidates should have a minimum of 7+ years total experience, out of which at least 4 years should be in a related capital markets background at a frequent issuing corporation and/or a financial institution. Requirements include having a pattern of an accelerated understanding of Capital Markets, SEC regulations, Option Price Modelling along with examples of successful deliveries and outcomes within strict compliance guidelines.
7+ years total experience, out of which at least 4 years specific capital markets experience at a public corporation or an investment bank
Possess strong financial modeling skills
Ability to gather and analyze feasibility of financial data, and prepare financial reports, statements and projections
Strong background in bank negotiations, debt compliance and credit rating agency models is required
Sound and proven Knowledge of finance, legal, accounting, budgeting, and cost control principles including Generally Accepted Accounting Principles
Excellent collaboration, verbal and written communication skills
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or related field is required; a Master's degree is preferred.
CTP/CCM and CFA designation are a plus
Confident expertise of Bloomberg is a must.
Experience in the wireless, utility, or financial industries is preferred
PERSONAL
CHARACTERISTICS: The successful candidate will possess the following attributes:
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to turn findings into executable plans
High level of intelligence, with a keen analytical mind and clear intellectual curiosity
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
Demonstrated ability to build trust and strong cross-functional relationships
Results-oriented, efficiently proactive, and self-motivated; can take initiative and make decisions
Impeccable integrity, reliability and consistency
Ability to think innovatively and see the big picture, yet still tend to the details
Deals effectively with ambiguity and conflict
Engages in an open-door policy and constant collaboration with others
Agile and capable of delivering on an aggressive and fast-paced schedule
Flexible in work schedule and availability to accommodate upcoming critical milestone dates.

Position Summary:

This is an experienced level position, responsible for being the primary administrator to the Concur Travel and Expense Tool. Additional responsibilities are regular KPI reporting, keeping compliant with internal controls, and providing support for Corporate Card programs. The Expense System Administrator I also plays a key role in the Accounting close process, in generating accruals for month/quarter end close, and providing additional reports for management as needed.

Attractions of the Job:

The Expense System Administrator I will have primary responsibility for expense reimbursement and the Concur Expense tool. This role will have direct influence into improving processes and policies, with a goal of operating a best-in-class program. Expense and Card programs have high visibility in the company, affecting the majority of our employee base. This provides opportunities to build strong partnerships with staff in global business units. Substantial opportunity exists to return significant value back to the company, through improvements in user experience as well as overall cost savings.

Primary Responsibilities:

Management of Concur Expense tool
Operate as the Concur Expense administrator, including auditing expense rules, managing account coding assignments, and navigating third-party data streams (employee records, Standard Accounting Extract).
Review employee expense reports to receipts, and manager approval, verifying that amounts claimed are correct and reimbursable per F5 policy and internal control guidelines
Contact employees or managers as needed to resolve discrepancies
Review Concur's Standard Accounting Extract to ensure information is correct and matching with daily ACH report.
Troubleshoot and resolve Concur Intelligence reporting tool issues
Troubleshoot & resolve data integration with Concur, Ceridian employee records, Concur Extract file
Understand and explain features and benefits of the product line as it relates to customer needs.
Meet or exceed customer expectations by anticipating and resolving their issues.
Routinely update the client, following SLA guidelines, on active issues to gain additional information or to advise of status
Act as an escalation point and advocate for critical customer issues, collaborating with other departments as needed.


Monthly and Quarterly reporting
Generate month end accruals for CWT airfare and CTE outstanding expenses
Run scheduled reports for KPIs, for communication to management

Additional Responsibilities
Corporate Card program support, as needed
Contact management support for expense and corporate card programs
Performs other related duties as assigned.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Minimum two or more years in Technical Support role interfacing with customers
Minimum two or more years of troubleshooting software/hardware issues
Minimum two or more years of experience using/support agency automation software
Financial systems experience a plus
Oracle JE knowledge required, running requests, reconciling account balances.
Accounting experience preferred
Intermediate MS Excel, including mail merge, data manipulation, pivot tables & graphs
Intermediate Word and Outlook experience preferred
Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external parties and resolve issues diplomatically

An Associate degree or equivalent experience required
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Solid organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks

Confidential, discrete and professional
