POSITION OVERVIEW

Applications accepted from: ALL PERSON INTERESTED

Posting Number: PN# 19778
Division: MANAGEMENT SUPPORT BRANCH
Section: INTERNAL REVIEW
Reporting Location: 611 Walker
Workdays & Hours: 8 am- 5pm; M - F
Subject to change

DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Reviews the Department's operations to ensure conformance with appropriate City policies and procedures and applicable State and Federal laws and regulations. Conducts and leads preliminary surveys to determine areas to be audited for conformance to policy, procedure, and internal controls. Compiles and prepares work papers containing relevant evidentiary materials used to support all findings, conclusions and recommendations. Develops, plans and coordinates implementation of specialized or non-standard audits. Selects audit methods, level and aspects of analysis, and investigative procedures. Conducts special investigative audits regarding alleged illegal or improper activities, e.g. attempted bribery, employee drug usage/theft, etc. Submits reports, findings and recommendations to supervisor. Develops recommendations and remedial actions for areas of weakness. Prepares written reports of findings and results. Presents reports to appropriate management staff. Recommends areas for future audits. May evaluate assets, depreciation rate methods, cost accounting systems and reports, determining appropriate methodologies for department utilization. May conduct legal and title research. Prepares various internal and federal reports. Performs various special projects as requested.

WORKING CONDITIONS
This position is physically comfortable; the individual has discretion about walking, standing, etc.

This is a Department of Houston Public Works position at the Tier 3 Level.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS
Requires a Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business Administration, or a closely related field such as Finance, with a minimum of 18 hours in accounting.

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
Four years of professional accounting/auditing experience is required.

LICENSE REQUIREMENTS
Valid Texas Driver's License and compliance with the City of Houston's policy on driving (AP 2-2).

PREFERENCES

Preference will be given to those who are proficient in Microsoft applications, specifically those with advanced MS Excel experience and experience performing data analysis.

Preference shall be given to eligible veteran applications provided such persons posses the qualifications necessary for competent discharge of the duties involved in the position applied for, such persons are among the most qualified candidates for the position, and all other factors in accordance with Executive Order 1-6

GENERAL INFORMATION

SELECTION/SKILLS TESTS REQUIRED: None
However, the department may administer a skills assessment evaluation.

SAFETY IMPACT POSITION: Yes
If yes, this position is subject to random drug testing and if a promotional position, candidate must pass an assignment drug test.

SALARY INFORMATION
Factors used in determining the salary offered include the candidate's qualifications as well as the pay rates of other employees in this classification.

Pay Grade 21

Position Description

CarMax has been a Fortune "100 Best Companies to Work For since 2005", awarded a Top Workplaces honor by The Atlanta Journal Constitution since 2016 and ranked one of Atlanta's top 25 large companies, and Training magazine's "Top 125 Training Companies" since 2008. Our culture is built upon the values of respect, integrity and transparency, and we live these values every day in how we treat our Customers and our Associates.

SUMMARY:
Under limited supervision, responsible for assisting the Team Manager in obtaining department goals by providing associate training, monitoring, motivating associates, auditing associate work product, providing support, while providing a high level of customer service.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Be visible in the department to motivate and answer associate questions
• Perform monthly balance sheet account reconciliations and follow up with associates on resolution of open items.
• Assist in facilitating effective department meetings and planning sessions
• Training of new associates and cross training of existing associates.
• Review and update process documentation for team processes.
• Conduct account audits and monitors, provide feedback to associates, and document trends
• Assist in analyzing and recommending process changes as well as providing valuable input to new processes.
• Maintain CAF Accounting email requests, delegating and following up with associates.
• Assist associates, stores, vendors, banks and other departments with elevated issues and reconciliation items.

Position Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Demonstrated leadership among peers
• Execute strong analytical skills.
• Work effectively under minimum supervision
• Effectively manage stressful interactions.
• Multi-task in a high energy and fast-pace work environment.
• Interact competently with CarMax Auto Finance business partners.
• Understand and adhere to company policies and procedures.
• Complete CarMax provided training as required.
• Proven ability to consistently meet deadlines.


EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
• Associate degree or equivalent related experience/ training.
• Strong working knowledge of MS Word and Excel.
• Basic understanding of Accounting Principles.
• Basic typing skills including minimum speed and accuracy requirements.
• Intermediate math skills.

Position Description

CarMax has been a Fortune "100 Best Companies to Work For since 2005", was awarded a Top Workplaces honor by The Atlanta Journal Constitution and ranked one of Atlanta's top 25 large companies since 2016, and Training magazine's "Top 125 Training Companies" since 2008. Our culture is built upon the values of respect, integrity and transparency, and we live these values every day in how we treat our Customers and our Associates.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:
• Great work-life balance, community involvement, team engagement events, on-site gym...etc.
• Not a suit & tie environment, think jeans and sneakers.
• Flexible work hours with shifts that include days, evenings, and weekends.

SUMMARY:
Under limited supervision, responsible for processing accounts receivable and accounts payable payments for CarMax Auto Finance.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
•Process electronic customer payments ensuring accuracy and timeliness by pulling electronic files, validating data integrity, posting payments and transmitting files to appropriate banks.
•Process customer check payments by auditing checks and keying check information into company systems.
•Process customer account adjustments as requested.
•Review and process vendor invoices for payment.
•Review supporting documentation against payment requests and/or invoice batches.
•Review payables control group registers (data entry/interfaced into Peoplesoft Payables).
•Review, validate and process CarMax customer refund payments.
•Process reversals for returned customer payments by keying the appropriate transactions to the customer's account.
•Understand and adhere to company policies and procedures.
•Work with other departments/personnel where necessary to resolve customer issues.

Position Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Multi-task in a high energy and fast-pace work environment.
• Execute effective time management skills.
• Execute strong accuracy and attention to detail.
• Execute basic data entry skills.
• Complete CarMax provided training as required.
• Understand and adhere to company policies and procedures.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
• High School diploma/GED.
• Three months related experience/training.
• Perform typing and 10-key skills including minimum speed and accuracy requirements.
• Basic working knowledge of MS Word and MS Excel.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:
•The position requires basic math skills.

Overview

The Lease Accounting team supports Chick-fil-A and its franchisees by managing the financial obligations of Chick-fil-A, Inc. leases. This includes ensuring lease financial obligations are met, accounting for lease expenses on Chick-fil-A, Inc.'s financials per US GAAP and IFRS, providing valuable reports and data, and maintaining proper accounting as lessor to Chick-fil-A Restaurant franchisees and other third parties.

As a Lease Accountant, you will be entrusted with financial oversight of real estate leases and equipment leases covering Chick-fil-A Restaurants and Corporate properties. You will be a trusted partner across the organization by adding value to business decisions in other departments.

Lease accounting experience is not necessary. The Lease Accounting Team is looking for someone who enjoys leading work independently, is analytical, a natural problem-solver, coachable, and seeks continuous process improvement.

The Financial Services Department Will Provide You with Opportunities to:
Contribute to Chick-fil-A through challenging and meaningful work
Develop personally and professionally in a learning centered culture
Cultivate positive professional relationships with Franchisees and accounting colleagues
Collaborate in a team-oriented environment
Receive unparalleled coaching, mentoring and development experiences


Responsibilities

Responsible for accounting on all Chick-fil-A, Inc. lease agreements, amendments, extensions and other financial agreements covering our restaurant sites and corporate properties
Partner with Real Estate, Restaurant Development and Legal Operations to ensure rental obligations are met based on lease critical dates
Maintain data integrity within lease management system to provide accurate and timely reporting for internal parties
Perform lease classification testing and implement proper lease accounting, consulting in-house Technical Accountant as needed
Create Rent Calculation Report for lease/sublease to Chick-fil-A Restaurant franchisees and communicate all associated pass-through charges pursuant to Franchise Agreement
Ensure proper accounting entries and accruals are made on both Chick-fil-A, Inc. financial statements and Restaurant Franchisee Fee Calculation Reports
Assist with transition to new FASB lease accounting standard ASC 842
Develop relationships across the business to be a trusted resource for lease information
Perform ad-hoc projects and analysis to help support certain decisions and issues and to assist in other groups' goals and tasks


Minimum Qualifications

Analytical and detail-oriented
Ability to manage multiple outstanding issues and deadlines at a given time
Self-starter that demonstrates eagerness to learn and assume responsibility
Excellent interpersonal & written communication skills
Ability to work well independently and with others in teams
Aptitude for problem solving and innovation
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Must pass Chick-fil-A Accounting Test


Preferred Qualifications

2+ years accounting experience
Experience reading, interpreting, and applying lease language
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel
Proficient in applying GAAP lease accounting principles per FASB ASC 840 and FASB ASC 842
Experience in similar role working with retail leases
Previous experience with Oracle Fusion and/or IBM TRIRIGA
CPA License (awarded or in process)

Responsibilities

AR/Accounting ad-hoc projects as required, including audit requests

Effective communication, team management and negotiation skills
Ability to accurately process numerical data
Highly organized, process-oriented, and possesses great attention to detail
Strong time management skills and ability to prioritize responsibilities of self and the AR team
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Business preferred

Overview
DHG is a top 20 certified public accounting and advisory firm that delivers innovative advisory, accounting, tax, and specialized services. DHG combines deep industry experience, comprehensive accounting and advisory services and a strong commitment to professional growth. DHG consistently ranks in the top ten best CPA firms to work with. We have over 2000 professionals located throughout the U.S. located in 30+ offices.

Responsibilities
The IT Audit Senior Consultant participates in multiple client engagement teams and other related activities. Engagements focus on the assessment and/or evaluation of Information Technology (IT) systems and the mitigation of IT-related business risks. Engagements may be either assurance (attestation) and/or risk advisory in nature, and vary considerably in size and complexity. All of our IT Risk & Assurance services, whether assurance or advisory in nature, are designed for the dual purpose of strengthening internal controls and, in so doing, help to improve IT and business performance. In addition to assurance-related engagements such as financial attestation and Service Organizational Control engagements, our IT risk advisory services focus on IT governance and effectiveness; IT program management and assurance; security and controls of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) implementations; and business intelligence and information analysis.
Responsibilities:
Assist clients in employing proper information systems, resources, and controls to maximize efficiencies and minimize risk
Collaborate with other members of the engagement team to plan the engagement and develop work program timelines, risk assessments, and other planning documents
Work with the engagement team to document the business processes dependent on information technology
Demonstrate and apply strong project management skills, inspire teamwork and responsibility with engagement team members, and use current technology and tools to enhance the effectiveness of deliverables and services
Perform tests of general IT controls to verify and validate findings
Work with internal audit departments
Support external audits
Perform SOC1 and SOC2 projects
Proficient knowledge in MS Office applications
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Intellectual curiosity, with a desire to learn new things and tackle challenges
Ability to work closely and effectively with all levels of management with a high degree of professionalism

#LI-HM

Qualifications

BA or BS in Accounting or related field required
Masters degree in Information Systems preferred
3+ years of audit experience in a public accounting firm required
Strong background in IT risk assessment and auditing, including assessment of risks for IT operations, business processes, Sarbanes Oxley, and related SOX control testing required
Privacy and security experience preferred
Experience in Management information systems terminology, concepts and practices required
CPA and/or CISA certification or candidate required
Strong data analytics experience highly preferred
Experience with Blackline balance sheet reconciliation software preferred
Knowledge of Accounting Software Systems preferred (i.e., SAP, Oracle)
Willingness to travel required

Overview

We partner with entrepreneurs to run their own Chick-fil-A franchises. These Franchisees are our clients and the Financial Consulting team supports Franchisees with consulting services. In this role, you will consult directly with 150 individual restaurant owners as part of a larger team that includes consultants from other functional areas. The position is based at the Chick-fil-A home office in Atlanta, Georgia, and involves 8-9 days of travel over the course of a month.

Responsibilities

To be successful in this role, you will need to be able to:
Consult with restaurant Owner/Operators to help them meet their financial goals, including implementation of financial systems.
Exhibit strong restaurant knowledge and comfort in the restaurant environment.
Coach, appropriately challenge and encourage individual Operators and Operator Teams in Financial Return.
Analyze data, provide insights, and develop strategy for the consulting team to improve regional performance
Contribute in team initiatives to improve team performance.
Engage and lead departmental and interdepartmental projects.
Develop and implement annual professional development plans.

How we do it:

As a Financial Consultant, you will have the opportunity to implement and continually elevate Chick-fil-A's personable consulting service. In our approach to consulting:
We seek to understand each Franchisee's unique background and financial goals within the restaurant.
We roll up our sleeves and take a hands-on approach to analyze restaurant activity and trends.
We believe in great conversations and the power of a handshake with our clients. We will regularly travel to meet with restaurant owners.
We translate complex data into understandable and actionable strategies.
We partner to influence results and anticipate future needs.

The Asset Manager will be responsible for higher level property/portfolio needs (e.g., special situations, budget review, central databases, valuations, etc.), applicable communication and creation/oversight of asset repositioning efforts

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

Execute the Repositioning Plan (Recent Apartment Acquisitions):
Lead the facilitation of ownership transition
Clarify and further refine repositioning plan indicating scope, responsibilities and timing for cap ex, operational, legal, offsite, etc. issues for Fund assets, as identified
Create monthly performance reports and facilitate monthly asset team calls (with Ops and Investment VP) on new acquisitions (or once c.o. delivered on development JVs) until stabilized (6-12 months)
Ensure that repositioning plan is completed and post-closing issues are done. Update the proforma to indicate actual returns compared to underwriting upon stabilization


Cap Ex Design Review and Approval:
Create a standard program/pallet of design specifications for exterior paint colors, clubhouse upgrades and/or interior apartment renovations (with the construction group)
Review and approve cap ex work related to design issues for items above and confirm correct application was executed in a timely manner
Approve cap ex work for assets that have cash flow issues or where the capital budget would create a cash flow issue
Approve unbudgeted work or new projects that will exceed budget by $10,000 or 10%


Operating Performance/ Budget Review - Apartments Only
Attend monthly financial review calls. Flag any unusual concerns (see special situations below)
Review cash flow management / capital call needs as part of the monthly/quarterly distributions (with accounting)
Provide annual budget expectations and review if significantly different from projections, as needed Follow-up with Investment VP if significantly different than proforma or market research projections
Identify unusual issues to maximize NOI e.g., adding garages, new cable contracts, etc. (with Ops)
Reconcile capital structures to ensure fundings and reserves are being handled properly (with accounting)
Prepare format for tax appeal assessments and evaluations. Expand consultant list by market


Portfolio Summary:
Create and maintain a centralized property database of relevant property attributes and investment metrics
Refine debt portfolio summary, evaluate loan maturities and compliance needs (with support from accounting
Summarize portfolio characteristics and performance e.g., distribution by geography, investment vehicle and year acquired and respond to surveys, questionnaires, investors, etc.


Reporting and External Communication:
Refine valuation process/models and update semi-annual FMV/return projections (with CIO and Investment VPs)
Prepare fund reports (with support from accounting and investor relations)
Send communication to institutional investors regarding asset/partnership performance and transaction updates, as needed.
Report information to RCA and summarize transaction trends, as needed.


Special Situations (with support from Investment VP and Commercial, as needed):
Follow-up on "troubled asset/ priority property" list from the monthly financial review meetings
Follow-up on unusual compliance needs e.g., bond, ground lease, title/lien concern, etc.
Assist with selection and implementation of branding Legacy assets, as needed


Apartment Dispositions:
Based on external market trends and property performance, recommend Bell/HNW Fund majority owned assets for dispositions (refinancing is done by Investment VPs)
Lead disposition support for DRA assets, as requested. Note: disposition process for other Bell-owned assets is led by Investment VPs


Market Research and Underwriting:
Using information from the Bell portfolio and third-party data, summarize performance trends by market each quarter
Update third-party rent projections every 4-6 months
Update exit cap rate guidance every 6-12 months
Create underwriting standards for NOI e.g., economic vacancy, cap ex reserves, etc.


Additional Functions and Responsibilities:
Assists with other tasks and projects as required


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Demonstrate a high level of motivation and intelligence (a "thinker and a "doer");
Embrace and foster the company culture of hard work, accountability and positive financial results
Demonstrate financial acumen and analytical skills; strong problem solving skills and quantitative abilities; must be able to absorb large amounts of data quickly and be capable of reaching sound business decisions after reviewing available information;
Demonstrate solid research skills;
Must be resourceful, possess excellent organizational skills (i.e. handling multiple priorities and coordinating large teams) and strong written/oral communication skills;
Demonstrate solid interpersonal skills (the ability to motivate and work with difficult individuals as well as get the deal done without offending team members or buyers/sellers); Must work effectively with vendors, peers, investors and Bell Partners associates
Help develop and maintain strong customer service relationships
Must display a professional demeanor at all times
Flexibility in working hours and travel as required to accomplish the work


Education and Background:
BA/BS in business or related field and at least 3 years of work experience in a relevant field or MBA with 1 year relevant work experience
Strong working knowledge of multi-family financial processes/analysis
Strong working knowledge of MS Office Suite to include Excel

Description: Supply Chain Management Governance is seeking a Regulatory Compliance Analyst Senior to join our team. As a Compliance Analyst Senior, you will serve as a subject-matter-expert on various aspects of the purchasing system and will have rewarding opportunities to make an impact on the Supply Chain Management organization.

This role performs pre-award compliance reviews on purchase orders equal to or greater than $500,000 and provides real time feedback to affected procurement personnel.

Conducts periodic post-award reviews on purchase orders below $500,000.

Provides up-front support to procurement personnel in translating regulatory and contractual requirements into acquisition strategies that maintain the integrity of the purchasing system and support quicker downstream turns of compliance reviews.

Supports audits performed by various agencies. Audit support responsibilities include coordinating and communicating audit requirements with SCM leadership and affected personnel, as well as communicating audit status. The position will interact with DCMA (Defense Contract Management Agency), DCAA (Defense Contract Audit Agency), LM Corporate Internal-Audit, and LM Aero Internal Controls and Audit. Audits include Contractor Purchasing System Reviews, AS9100 Certifications, Subcontractor Billing Systems, Subcontractor Property Control Systems, and many others.

May implement or modify Supply Chain Management policies and procedures to ensure compliance with applicable Government statutes and regulations, prime contract and company-level requirements.

Develops and coordinates process improvements, trainings, policies, and procedures to achieve greater operational efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

Develops and conducts training for Supply Chain Management personnel.

Performs special assignments covering a variety of topics as requested by management.

Secondary responsibilities includes cross-training in all functions performed by the group.
MUST BE A US CITIZEN. POSITION REQUIRES A SECRET CLEARANCE.
Desired Skills: Prior Supply Chain Management experience.

Ability to skillfully apply knowledge to strengthen purchasing system processes and compliance.

A self-starter who is willing to tackle any assignment and with the ability to work effectively under deadlines and pressure.

Capable of building effective relationships with peers, customers and leadership.

Ability to communicate complex subject matter in simple and understandable ways, and to write clear instructions that contribute significantly to standard work and repeatable processes.

Effective in training Supply Chain Management SCM professionals with varying levels of knowledge, skills and experience.

Ability to effectively work both independently and in a team environment

Knowledge and experience with the requirements of the Six Key Business Systems as defined in DFARs: Purchasing, Material Management and Accounting, Property Management, Estimating, Earned-Value, and Accounting

Experience in supporting audits performed by various audit agencies (Defense Contract Audit Agency DCAA, Defense Contract Management Agency DCMA, Inspector General's Office, General Accounting Office GAO, Federal Aviation Administration FAA) and internal audit functions.

Knowledgeable of international procurements laws and regulations

A background in continuous improvement tools and techniques.

Working knowledge of SAP

Experience drafting and writing business processes and procedures

Basic understanding of Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) and DFAR (Defense Federal Acquisition Regulations)
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelors degree required.
• Prior procurement experience
• Prior compliance or audit experience
• Experience supporting audits
• Prior Government Contracting experience
• Experience with Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR)

Are you looking to play an integral role in building something bigger? Ibotta is seeking a Marketing Analyst to join our analytics team and this opportunity will provide just that. The Marketing Analyst will help the Marketing team make data-driven decisions to drive customers to the app, retain, and develop them.
As a Marketing Analyst, you will be responsible for using the latest developments in statistics, machine learning, and testing methodologies to understand the business in-depth, support and challenge strategic options, and build state-of-the-art tools to improve our marketing plans.
Here is what you will be doing:
Work cross-functionally with the marketing team in analyzing customer segments and uncovering key, actionable insights about Ibotta users and behaviors
Run statistical analysis and create predictive models based on past user purchases and behavior
Develop algorithms and machine learning tools for user targeting and personalization
Design, implement and measure controlled experiments to determine the impact of new approaches
Report and understand business performance in detail, and identify ideas for improvement
Here is what we are looking for:
2+ years of practical work experience in Analytics, preferably in a consumer-facing industry
Bachelor’s degree in computer science/mathematics/statistics/data science or equivalent experience preferred
An understanding of the key concepts of consumer behavior
Proven expertise with data handling, processing, statistical and analytical skills
Ability to think creatively and provide thoughtful, agile insights
Ability to develop, maintain, automate, visualize, analyze, and communicate reporting to management
In-depth experience with SQL required
Experience using modern data analysis tools (such as R, python, Hive/Presto) required
Experience with A/B testing and control group concepts
Ability to work collaboratively throughout the organization to drive towards common goals
About Us:
Headquartered in Denver, CO, Ibotta (“I bought a...“) is transforming the shopping experience by making it easy for consumers to earn cash back on everyday purchases through a single smartphone app. The company partners with leading brands and retailers to offer rebates on groceries, electronics, clothing, gifts, home and office supplies, restaurant dining, and more. Ibotta is the premier destination for rewarded shopping on mobile and has paid out more than $350 million in cash back to its users. Launched in 2012, Ibotta has 28 million downloads and is one of the five most frequently used shopping apps in the United States.
To learn more about what our Tech teams are doing day to day, visit Building Ibotta on Medium.com.
Additional Details:
This position is located in Denver, CO and includes competitive pay, benefits package (including medical, dental, vision), 401k, commuter stipend, Unlimited PTO and equity.
Ibotta provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, and genetics.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

Overview:

The Contract Marketing Manager position is a temporary role within the Enterprise segment of our business. This role will be responsible for implementing, overseeing and managing short-term and long-term projects related to digital marketing, content creation, marketing automation, sales collateral development and lead generation. The right person for this role will have a strong understanding of B2B marketing, an analytical and detail-oriented mindset, and experience managing third-party vendors. You will ideally have a level of comfort with actively using multiple systems and platforms such as marketing automation and project management tools.
This role will report directly to the VP of Marketing Strategy and will collaborate across the business with other Marketing team members, Sales, Business Development, Engineering and Tech Support as necessary. The position is located in Broomfield, CO. Partial work from home is available.
Please note that this is not a contract-to-hire position and the duration of the contract will be about three months. Only applicants interested in a short-term contract will  be considered.

Responsibilities: 
Digital Marketing
Manage external vendors responsible for lead-gen and demand gen campaigns. You will serve as point of contact to vendors to deliver all materials to vendor based on project deadlines. You will also be responsible for overseeing SEM campaigns and providing feedback to Digital Marketing consultant to optimize campaign performance.
Email Marketing
Implement HubSpot email campaigns to support lead-gen and demand gen campaigns. Experience with or comfort learning HubSpot is a must.
Creative Direction
Oversee asset creation for online, print and social media tactics as determined within team Marketing Calendar to ensure due dates are met and creative is in line with existing brand standards.
Sales Support
You will be responsible for initiating and overseeing development of any sales collateral and product marketing pieces.
Minimum requirements:
6+ years of marketing experience. At least 2 years in B2B marketing
Experience in brand building and managing lead or demand gen initiatives
Software or technology experience preferred
Knowledge of and experience leading modern B2B email marketing, digital marketing and SEM programs
Sales support and/or product marketing experience required
Prior hand-on experience with Marketing Automation Platforms. This role requires direct work within HubSpot.
Agency management experience and ability to successfully collaborate internally and externally

This position will provide analytics support for the marketing team to drive profitable growth (ShareAble For Hires and SmartMove).

A welcoming and energetic environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. We consistently explore new technologies and tools to be agile
Flexible time off, workplace flexibility, an environment that welcomes continued professional growth through support of tuition reimbursement, conferences and seminars
Our culture encourages our people to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius

Bachelor degree with emphasis in marketing, engineering, business, finance, accounting, economics, math/statistics, science or an equivalent field.
2+ years of relevant work experience in marketing, analytics, statistics, etc...
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Experience implementing different attribution models
Exposure to Marketing mix models
Demonstrate independence, initiative, and business acumen, and be able to work independently and in team settings
Proficient in:
Microsoft Word
Microsoft Excel
Microsoft PowerPoint
SQL


We'd love to see:
Graduate Degree
Prior experience in marketing or statistical analysis or product management


Impact you'll make:
Analyzes performance of marketing initiatives using both quantitative and qualitative measures.
Measure multi-channel marketing campaign effectiveness and impact on business performance in terms of attribution, marketing mix optimization, modeling, and ROI.
Delivers insights and recommendations that lead to profitable growth, as well as finds areas for improvement. Applies data mining, uses quantitative methods, and provides analysis to solve business problems and prioritize marketing tactics.
Completes assignments that assist in development and implementation of marketing strategies and tactics and contributes to the understanding of our brand, customers, and competitors.
Optimizes spend allocation and supporting channel optimization to drive profitability and other marketing goals.

Works with other business units to understand their best practices and recommend appropriate ones to rollout at TURSS. Communicate TURSS best practices to other business units to the overall benefit of TransUnion.

Your Opportunity
Do you love to strategize? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and managing multiple initiatives at once? We are looking for a Senior Marketing Specialist to join the regional marketing team. This position requires a detail-oriented individual with a strong background in marketing and communications—a team player who can lead pursuit processes and teams, communicate with conviction, and maneuver a competitive, deadline-driven environment confidently.
In this role, you’ll prepare high-impact proposals and communications that highlight our depth of experience, expertise, and creativity. You’ll be working closely with our technical project managers to create competitive pursuit strategies and compelling messages that convey Stantec's strengths and set us apart. You will work closely with key business development leaders to coordinate strategic client facing events, materials, and other communications in alignment with the Stantec brand.
Your Key Responsibilities
- Combining your business savvy with strong marketing sensibilities, you’ll:
- Look for creative ways to help us achieve our corporate and regional goals for revenue growth, profitability, and market leadership in select markets.
- Proposal strategy and development.
- Client event coordination, as well as management of conferences and tradeshows, community engagement, advertising, and general collateral and communications.
- Contribute to client development and account management efforts.
- Help maintain Stantec’s internal systems for information management related to opportunity tracking, people and projects, and promotional activity.
- Act as a contributor toward Stantec’s internal and external communications networks.
Your Capabilities and Credentials
- Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
- Proven experience developing responses to detailed requests for proposals (RFPs).
- Detail-oriented and organized, with exceptional prioritization skills
- Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office, Adobe Creative Suite, and web-based interfaces.
- Must have the ability to work independently and in cooperation with a larger regional team.
- Candidate should enjoy working with different personality styles and management levels, both in person and across geographies.
- Must thrive working assertively in a deadline-driven environment.
Education and Experience
- Post-secondary education in marketing, communications, journalism, business, or related area.
- Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in a marketing-related field.
- Experience in the AEC industry is strongly preferred.
Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.

Here is what you’ll be doing:
Manage Ibotta’s editorial calendar and paid advertising inventory within Salesforce
Track, measure, and report on the performance of all paid advertising channels
Identify and analyze revenue gaps and create promotional plans to accelerate sales and fill remnant inventory
Partner with Ibotta’s Sales Enablement team to develop sales collateral, including rate cards, one-pagers, lift analysis reports, newsletters, and case studies
Assist in the creation and execution of shopper-facing email, push, and in-app message campaigns, including creative concepting, copywriting, and scheduling
Work with the Product and Engineering teams to implement new tools, tracking, and processes

Here is what we’re looking for:
Bachelor’s degree or higher with focus in business, marketing, advertising, analytics, economics or a related field
3+ years of advertising agency experience or similar
Strong organizational and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail
Ability to think creatively and implement ideas
Polished communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to manage several projects and their moving parts accurately and simultaneously
Must be self-directed and self-motivated
Nice to have:
Prior experience managing a sales and marketing revenue line
Advanced Excel skills
Experience buying media or managing a digital advertising platform
About Us:
Headquartered in Denver, CO, Ibotta (“I bought a...“) is transforming the shopping experience by making it easy for consumers to earn cash back on everyday purchases through a single smartphone app. The company partners with leading brands and retailers to offer rebates on groceries, electronics, clothing, gifts, home and office supplies, restaurant dining, and more. Ibotta is the premier destination for rewarded shopping on mobile and has paid out more than $370 million in cash back to its users. Launched in 2012, Ibotta has 28 million downloads and is one of the five most frequently used shopping apps in the United States.
Additional Details:
This position is located in Denver, CO and includes competitive pay, benefits package (including medical, dental, vision), 401k, commuter stipend, and equity.
Ibotta provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, and genetics.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

We are looking for Sarbanes-Oxley Industry professionals who have a keen eye for technology and marketing to help take our product, Wdesk, to the next level! Do you have the experience to help us launch our products into the market? Are you looking for an opportunity to have a voice in the product marketing strategy, from beginning to end? Are you ready to make an impact as well as gain exposure to leading product marketing philosophies and practices?
Are you ready for a seat at the table?
Summary:
The primary responsibility of Product Marketing is to create the go-to-market strategies including product positioning, marketing strategy, and sales enablement to drive buyer awareness and desired business outcomes. They are the central team that manages product and solution launches across Solutions Management, Product Management, Customer Success, and Sales, just to name a few. By equipping themselves with crucial market feedback and analysis, they have a seat at the table as we identify and prioritize product features, providing consulting and management support to the overall initiative.
What You'll Do:
Create the go-to-market strategy and ensure that execution of the plan drives to business goals.
Identify key functional, ecosystem, and operational requirements to better serve the targeted market.
Point Solutions Management: manage point-solution initiatives to focus sales effort and to ensure the achievement of revenue and profit goals for specific solutions
Product Marketing and Sales Consulting: provide consulting and management support to marketing and sales areas, identifying emerging market opportunities
Product Management Consulting: provide consulting and management support to product managers and development teams, including identifying and prioritizing product features based on customer and market analysis
Drive the development of thought leadership content to advance credibility and awareness, and drive pipeline.
Skills You'll Need:
Knowledge of and experience with SOX (Sarbanes-Oxley) and internal controls implementation activities in the corporate setting
Passion for products and discovering new features to meet market needs
Passion for creating new and creative ways to articulate solution value to the marketplace.
Ability to work directly with customers
Successful track record collaborating with cross-functional leadership teams
Enjoy working with metrics and analytics that drive decision making
Extraordinary listening, communication, and program management skills
High comfort level working in a technology environment; experience in the technology sector
Wdesk experience is a plus
Experience
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or similar area of study; MBA preferred
Hands-on experience with SOX (Sarbanes-Oxley) Compliance in the corporate environment
Experience in roles that relate to product marketing, including product management or marketing a plus
Experience in SaaS industry is a plus
Where You'll Work:
At Workiva we started with an idea: make complex collaboration easy. We knew there was a better way, and that’s why we created Wdesk. We’re building something amazing and that’s why it’s already used by thousands of companies around the globe. We are seeking a Senior Product Marketing Manager to lead the way for some of our newest product initiatives.
Check out our Muse Page
Check out our Newsroom

As a Front End Engineer on our Marketing Campaigns team, you’ll utilize React and other modern JavaScript/CSS libraries to create an intuitive product that allows our customers to build, manage, and send their email campaigns.  You’ll work with a passionate, versatile, and collaborative team, tackling tough problems as we continue to push our technology forward. Additionally, you’ll have the opportunity to influence and implement architectural solutions that will enable us to achieve our goal of being the world’s most trusted communication platform.
Denver is our global headquarters and home to Marketing Campaigns, our second generation product - which your efforts will directly impact.
What You’ll Do
Live by and champion our cultural values of Happy, Hungry, Honest, and Humble
  Collaborate with other team members, including our UI/UX and Product teams, to help influence, own, and improve our current product offering
      Manage your work through the use of Github, Jira, and our build/deploy systems  
      Aid in the testing of our code and the delivery of what we create to production  
  Our stack includes: ReactJS with Redux, npm/yarn, Github, Jira, Chef, BuildKite, Docker, WebdriverIO
About You
Typically, 1-4 years of software development experience with a focus on user interfaces
Ideally you have a Bachelor’s in Computer Science
1+ years working in JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3
You have passion for building engaging and intuitive user interfaces
Understanding of web architecture such as the DOM, HTTP, JSON, REST and how they play a part in application design

Would you like to be part of a fast-growing, highly successful and innovative team that acts like a startup but is backed by the most adopted technology platform of the $2T Global P&C Insurance industry? Would you like to develop a well-rounded set of skills across business and technology that positions you well to take on a leadership position at Guidewire or the Insurance industry as your next step?
Go to Market Delivery (GTMD) is a specialized function within Guidewire that serves as a competitive advantage for the company.  Within GTMD, the Product Marketing team serves to ensure that Guidewire puts its best foot forward.  GTMD is seeking a Product Marketing Manager to join the product marketing team. This is a high-visibility, high-impact role that requires extensive collaboration across many departments at all levels of the organization.
Responsibilities
Maintain and execute an overall product marketing strategy for Guidewire Digital applications.
Serve as a subject matter expert for Guidewire Digital applications and the broader Guidewire digital ecosystem.
Create compelling messaging and internal and external sales and marketing assets. This requires the ability to collaborate with and influence internal teams, and synthesize product information, broader industry trends, competitive positioning, and regional considerations.
Support the company’s worldwide sales team, analyst relations, consulting and technology partners, demand generation and thought leadership campaigns, and public relations initiatives with compelling marketing content and presentations.
Conduct market research to determine emerging trends, market needs, and customer requirements.
Present on Guidewire Digital-related topics internally and externally at meetings, conferences and other industry events.
Support Guidewire’s annual user conference by providing guidance on the agenda, presenting content, and coaching other speakers.
Create effective customer success stories and product demo videos.
Qualifications
BA/BS with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in an enterprise software product marketing role.
Excellent skills and talent for communications in all forms and media—spoken, written, visual, presentations, websites, social media, video; formal and informal.
Experience building, driving and executing product marketing across multiple regions.
A proven ability to build relationships with individuals and teams that are peers, executives, internal customers, and Guidewire customers around the globe.
Strong team player with good time management capabilities and the ability to adapt as priorities evolve.
Sense of humor, fun, and empathy for colleagues and customers are prized qualities for this team.
Experience in P&C insurance a bonus, but not required.
Domestic and international travel (10-20%) as required to visit customers and to attend internal meetings and industry events.

Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, you're choosing a different path. From day one, we've been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season.

We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find fabulous fashion at affordable prices online and in one of our 1,000+ stores globally. Old Navy celebrates a workplace that's just as diverse as our customers. Fun, fashion, family and value are at the heart of everything we do. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, we're family.

Old Navy - a brand for everyone a place for you!

Old Navy makes current American fashion essentials accessible to every family. From day one, Old Navy was a revolution. We were something the world had never seen - fabulous, affordable fashion. We didn't take ourselves too seriously, and we broke the industry's rules. What we believe in today is exactly what we believed in when we started: we're on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find their must-have fashion essentials online as well as in one of our 1,000+ stores located globally.

As part of the Field organization, you make the brand come to life for our customers. Our stores are fast paced, fun, diverse and full of passionate people who love fashion. The Field offers endless opportunities to grow your career and be a leader - of your peers, of teams, of a business, and in the community.

Old Navy - a brand for everyone, a place for you!

Job Summary:

As the Product and Marketing Specialist, you drive profitable sales growth by managing execution of the signage, marketing, shipment, replenishment processes, and by ensuring back of house standards are met and maintained. You are the subject matter expert in all product operational processes, and ensure Brand Associates consistently meet company productivity standards and compliance measures. You support the development of the team. You create a culture of engagement and high performance through development and coaching of all Brand Associates.

As an Old Navy leader, your first priority is to contribute to the success of your store. This means that you not only deliver in your role as the Product and Marketing Specialist, but you also model leadership behaviors and deliver as a manager on duty. As the Manager on Duty, you deliver results during your assigned time, drive key performance indicators and brand loyalty by leading through your team. You make decisions and collaborate with other members of your store leadership team to prioritize work based on business needs and company direction.

Functional and Technical Skills
Informing
Organizing
Priority Setting
Peer Relationships
Learning Agility
Managing and Measuring Work

About Us:

HomeAdvisor and our sister company, Angie’s List, have combined to create the largest home services marketplace in the nation. A vibrant online marketplace offering an array of resources to its customers, HomeAdvisor is one of the biggest internet success stories in Colorado. We’ve grown up from our startup days – now with a half-billion dollars in annual revenue – but we’re nimble to stay ahead in the fast-changing internet ecosystem. Combine this with our parent company’s increased investment in our growth means lots of exciting opportunities to grow with us.

About the SEM Analytics Manager position:

HomeAdvisor is looking for a dedicated, analytical and technically-skilled leader to join our Digital Marketing team. This position will oversee an analytics team of two direct reports and will support an increasingly sophisticated SEM program. The SEM Analytics Manager is responsible for identifying and analyzing opportunities to use data-driven insights for improved decision making. This role requires an individual with excellent statistical and analytical abilities and a solid understanding of online lead conversion, optimization, UX principles and other digital marketing concepts.

About the Digital Marketing Team:

The Digital Marketing Team has been a key component of HomeAdvisor’s success. The Digital Marketing team is responsible for performance-based online marketing initiatives, such as search engine marketing, display advertising, social advertising and more. This team manages millions of dollars in spend each month, and with that comes a huge opportunity to learn and excel. We’re constantly exploring better ways to operate and trying new things; coupled with our rapid growth, there are innumerable opportunities to support the company with your insight. This makes the SEM Analytics Manager critical to the continued success of Angie’s List and HomeAdvisor by providing the information necessary to make great decisions.

Responsibilities:
In conjunction with account management team, ensure SEM campaigns are effective and efficiently managed, reported on, and optimized to meet expected demand with desired KPIs.
Create reporting dashboards and custom reports analyzing campaign performance to provide actionable recommendations and deliver continuous improvements.
Design testing frameworks (split testing, deliverability and tracking) for ongoing optimization of click-through and conversion rates. Ensure adaptive learning from past campaigns to guide future testing.
Provide competitive research and analysis to track and trend the SEM competitive landscape and impacts to current campaigns.
Build effective working relationships with colleagues across the organization.

Desired Experience:
Bachelor’s degree with focus in Statistics, Economics, Finance, or Math
3+ years experience in marketing analytics, direct marketing, financial analysis or similar field
Superior analytical, problem-structuring, and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with key digital marketing platforms and automated bidding tools
Ability to merge information from numerous sources and work with incomplete data
Experience synthesizing data into information and presenting concise analyses
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; communicate effectively at all levels of the business
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel

If you're interested in a career with us, we'd love to talk. If you have questions about any of our roles, talk with one of our Recruiters by signing up for our next chat: http://www.abouthomeadvisor.com/talk-to-us/

We’re growing quickly and want to ensure best-in-class service to our merchant clients. We're looking for a smart motivated Account Manager that understands the challenges SMBs face and is passionate about helping them reach for their marketing goals. You'll be the primary point of contact for our clients and responsible for developing new internal processes and best practices that can scale. 
We are looking for someone that can ‘wow’ our clients on all levels:
• Provide outstanding client service by phone and email regarding marketing campaign questions, account support, and billing issues
• Take ownership of merchant communications and consistently meet, beat and improve key performance metrics

• A degree from a top-tier College or University

markets

The primary function of this position is to develop business in the oil & gas industry. Develop and oversee customers and Authorized Sick Representatives. Work with Sick Inc. management to determine future industry needs. Responsibilities include but are not limited to for monthly sales reporting, sales forecasts, periodic business reviews and account strategy. Instruct sales department on quotations, develop promotional strategy, and collateral materials. Assist technical support team by developing training programs, trade shows and customer presentations. Primary accountabilities include directing appropriate company resources to develop strategic relationships with key clients and industry groups for existing products; Position is highly technical involving application solutions and presentations to technical customer audiences.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Research and validate market opportunities in a portfolio and development of customer contact and business in an incubator-type environment.
Use CRM system for all customer and sales process data to ensure proper documentation and retention.
Conduct and facilitate EoC (Environment of Customer) opportunity validation process.
In cooperation with Marketing Communication using the EoC pain index to create impactful marketing content in the form of webpage, advertising, and sales presentations.
Establish data-driven strategic marketing plans to achieve corporate objectives for strategic industries; analyze these marketing plans and adjust strategy and tactics to increase effectiveness where necessary.
Develop and execute market/business development type programs to achieve stated objectives regarding revenue, profitability and market share; plan and conduct market research to identify opportunities for increased sales.
Keep abreast of and monitor market and competitor activity; adjust marketing strategy and recommend client base expansions as appropriate.
Establish and maintain relationships with appropriate CSC's and other groups in AG. Participate in industry specific SICK group activities and meetings, present and advocate for US customers and the Strategic Business Development function.
Establish and maintain relationships with SalesCo and also North America RPC/RCC organizations, work collaboratively with these organizations to address customer needs.
Establish and maintain relationships with industry influencers and key strategic partners; as appropriate, meet with key clients and assist sales teams with maintaining relationships, negotiating and closing deals.
Transition new market opportunities to appropriate sales teams in an orderly and smooth hand-off.
Train and integrate new employees, when applicable, as part of the business incubation process.
Regular attendance and timeliness.
SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Requires a bachelor's degree in business or engineering with a background in physics, chemistry, electronics, gas measurement or a related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Requires a minimum of ten (10) years of flow measurement and control industry experience, prefer two (2) years concurrently in a successful sales management position.
Requires an understanding of the end user /product approval process for the natural gas industry
Requires proven managerial, verbal and written communication skills, solid business acumen, technical, and application solving aptitude, sales presentation skills, and industry and marketing skills.
Legally permitted to work in the United States
Other Physical Requirements
Computer monitor more than 4 hours a day
Frequent plane and/or car travel
If you thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented work environment that offers challenges and the opportunity for growth, we're the place for you! SICK, Inc. has several locations throughout domestic US and offers competitive wages and an excellent benefits program. Qualified candidates can apply online by clicking the apply online button. Visit us at www.sickusa.com.

The role is managed through the finance department and supports contract administration for Sales, Business Development, Finance and Legal. The Contracts Coordinator will work under general supervision while also having the ability to be extremely effective independently.

Responsibilities include:
Contract support
Data entry of contract terms and conditions
Review contracts
Ability to analyze a contract to determine the key parameters
Requires excellent attention to detail. The person will be able to glean basic details from a contract, including, but not limited to:
Client or vendor contract
Client market
Start date
Termination date
Termination for convenience
Auto renewals
Identify legal approver

Nature of services provided
Legal entity (Alliance Data, Epsilon Data Management, LLC, ICOM, etc.)
The relationship between one contract and other contracts, such as parent-child relationships.

Requires ability to adhere to all turnaround times
Requires ability to scan documents to create PDF copies when required.
Requires ability to convert PDF files to searchable PDFs (OCR).
Requires ability to determine when it becomes necessary to consult an attorney to ask for further clarification on details of a contract before processing the contract.
The contract coordinator will be required to research and pull contracts from systems when requested
The contract coordinator will have excellent file management and contract management skills.
Other duties and projects as assigned

Required experience/background:
The ideal candidate will have 1 - 2 years experience with contract administration and contract terminology
Experience with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and Power Point), Adobe Acrobat, DocuSign, a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong organizational and time management skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to detail

Are you looking to play an integral role in building something bigger? Ibotta is seeking a Marketing Analyst to join our analytics team and this opportunity will provide just that. The Marketing Analyst will help the Marketing team make data-driven decisions to drive customers to the app, retain, and develop them.
As a Marketing Analyst, you will be responsible for using the latest developments in statistics, machine learning, and testing methodologies to understand the business in-depth, support and challenge strategic options, and build state-of-the-art tools to improve our marketing plans.
Here is what you will be doing:
Work cross-functionally with the marketing team in analyzing customer segments and uncovering key, actionable insights about Ibotta users and behaviors
Run statistical analysis and create predictive models based on past user purchases and behavior
Develop algorithms and machine learning tools for user targeting and personalization
Design, implement and measure controlled experiments to determine the impact of new approaches
Report and understand business performance in detail, and identify ideas for improvement
Here is what we are looking for:
2+ years of practical work experience in Analytics, preferably in a consumer-facing industry
Bachelor’s degree in computer science/mathematics/statistics/data science or equivalent experience preferred
An understanding of the key concepts of consumer behavior
Proven expertise with data handling, processing, statistical and analytical skills
Ability to think creatively and provide thoughtful, agile insights
Ability to develop, maintain, automate, visualize, analyze, and communicate reporting to management
In-depth experience with SQL required
Experience using modern data analysis tools (such as R, python, Hive/Presto) required
Experience with A/B testing and control group concepts
Ability to work collaboratively throughout the organization to drive towards common goals
About Us:
Headquartered in Denver, CO, Ibotta (“I bought a...“) is transforming the shopping experience by making it easy for consumers to earn cash back on everyday purchases through a single smartphone app. The company partners with leading brands and retailers to offer rebates on groceries, electronics, clothing, gifts, home and office supplies, restaurant dining, and more. Ibotta is the premier destination for rewarded shopping on mobile and has paid out more than $350 million in cash back to its users. Launched in 2012, Ibotta has 28 million downloads and is one of the five most frequently used shopping apps in the United States.
To learn more about what our Tech teams are doing day to day, visit Building Ibotta on Medium.com.
Additional Details:
This position is located in Denver, CO and includes competitive pay, benefits package (including medical, dental, vision), 401k, commuter stipend, Unlimited PTO and equity.
Ibotta provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, and genetics.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

Overview:

The Contract Marketing Manager position is a temporary role within the Enterprise segment of our business. This role will be responsible for implementing, overseeing and managing short-term and long-term projects related to digital marketing, content creation, marketing automation, sales collateral development and lead generation. The right person for this role will have a strong understanding of B2B marketing, an analytical and detail-oriented mindset, and experience managing third-party vendors. You will ideally have a level of comfort with actively using multiple systems and platforms such as marketing automation and project management tools.
This role will report directly to the VP of Marketing Strategy and will collaborate across the business with other Marketing team members, Sales, Business Development, Engineering and Tech Support as necessary. The position is located in Broomfield, CO. Partial work from home is available.
Please note that this is not a contract-to-hire position and the duration of the contract will be about three months. Only applicants interested in a short-term contract will  be considered.

Responsibilities: 
Digital Marketing
Manage external vendors responsible for lead-gen and demand gen campaigns. You will serve as point of contact to vendors to deliver all materials to vendor based on project deadlines. You will also be responsible for overseeing SEM campaigns and providing feedback to Digital Marketing consultant to optimize campaign performance.
Email Marketing
Implement HubSpot email campaigns to support lead-gen and demand gen campaigns. Experience with or comfort learning HubSpot is a must.
Creative Direction
Oversee asset creation for online, print and social media tactics as determined within team Marketing Calendar to ensure due dates are met and creative is in line with existing brand standards.
Sales Support
You will be responsible for initiating and overseeing development of any sales collateral and product marketing pieces.
Minimum requirements:
6+ years of marketing experience. At least 2 years in B2B marketing
Experience in brand building and managing lead or demand gen initiatives
Software or technology experience preferred
Knowledge of and experience leading modern B2B email marketing, digital marketing and SEM programs
Sales support and/or product marketing experience required
Prior hand-on experience with Marketing Automation Platforms. This role requires direct work within HubSpot.
Agency management experience and ability to successfully collaborate internally and externally

Position:
Marketing Automation Manager

Job Description:
Marketing Automation Manager

At present, we have an excellent opportunity for a Marketing Automation Manager in our Centennial, Colorado location.

The Marketing Automation Manager will drive strategy, implementation and execution for all email & marketing automation initiatives within the Arrow Digital Group. The responsibilities of the role include: ownership of all email communications, campaign management to drive engagement & revenue, lead scoring for sales pipeline, and overall ownership of Eloqua for marketing automation and reporting.

This position works directly with internal stakeholders and manages a team to develop the strategies and tactics best suited to meet sales goals, lead qualification needs and overall goals of the Arrow Digital Group. The ideal candidate for the Marketing Automation Manager role will have a strong proficiency in direct response marketing, personalization, lead nurturing, with an exhibited comprehension of ecommerce marketing and lead management.

Essential Responsibilities
Develop & manage team to meet email channel revenue targets for multiple web properties, driving to overall business forecasts
Develop long-term strategic vision for the email marketing program.
Plan and execute strategies to drive global email growth and engagement, including lead nurturing programs.
Manage ongoing operations of email marketing program, including: email calendar, frequency, email production, performance, and reporting.
Overall ownership of email communications, including branding guidelines, email voice, quality, and results.
Manage & optimize lead management program, working with marketing & sales to deliver high-quality leads via Salesforce.com. Program will include lead nurturing, lead scoring, and delivering qualified sales pipeline.
Test and optimize marketing automation program to continuously improve KPIs, including revenue, open rates, click-to-open rate, unsubscribe rates.
Provide ongoing internal reporting for Key Performance Indicators
Maintain expert opinion on relevant email related regulation (CAN-SPAM, CASL, GDPR), through partnership with internal compliance experts, solution providers and independent research
Foster and maintain cross-functional partnerships to improve audience communications, deepen knowledge base and leverage organizational insights
Manage and develop vendor relationships with marketing technology solution providers and service providersREQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, similar degree, or equivalent experience
5+ years of experience in an analytical email-marketing role, preferably at an ecommerce company.
Experience with Eloqua
Ability and desire to take charge of projects to drive business results and to work in a fast-paced environment on multiple projects.
Strong analytic marketing orientation that regularly tests, refines, and optimizes email marketing campaigns, applying data analysis, marketing expertise, and experience to deliver exceptional results
Strong email marketing skills, including experience with testing design, customer segmentation, tracking, and interpreting results.
Working knowledge of web analytic tools such as Google Analytics.
Strong project management; detail-oriented and highly organized; proactive
Excellent presentation and reporting skills to organize and present campaign results.
PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS
Experience working with Salesforce.com is preferred.
Experience in other email marketing automation platforms is a plus
Adobe Suite of Products a plus

Principal Accountabilities
• Contributor to strategic marketing programs, with guidance from senior marketing leader. Serves as an expert within marketing and resource for best practices, and mentorship of junior team members.
• Manage and execute programs/initiatives, including online & offline marketing tactics. Work closely with any teams or vendors involved in marketing programs/initiatives/campaigns.
• Manage marketing program/initiative/campaign budget(s). Ensure marketing plan is implemented and program is completed on time and within budget; recommend or redirect strategies as needed.
• Works independently to support strategic marketing programs, bringing specialized knowledge and best practices to the team to identify and develop solutions.
• Champion Arrow's value proposition and brand to customers.

Job Complexity
• Guides others in resolving complex issues in specialized area based on existing solutions and procedures
• Serves as an expert within own discipline
• Serves as a resource for best practices/quality on functional teams or projects
• Trains/mentors junior staff

Experience / Education
Typically requires a minimum of 10 years of related experience with a 4 year degree; or 8 years and an advanced degree; or equivalent experience.

About Us:

HomeAdvisor and our sister company, Angie’s List, have combined to create the largest home services marketplace in the nation. A vibrant online marketplace offering an array of resources to its customers, HomeAdvisor is one of the biggest internet success stories in Colorado. We’ve grown up from our startup days – now with a half-billion dollars in annual revenue – but we’re nimble to stay ahead in the fast-changing internet ecosystem. Combine this with our parent company’s increased investment in our growth means lots of exciting opportunities to grow with us.

About the SEM Analytics Manager position:

HomeAdvisor is looking for a dedicated, analytical and technically-skilled leader to join our Digital Marketing team. This position will oversee an analytics team of two direct reports and will support an increasingly sophisticated SEM program. The SEM Analytics Manager is responsible for identifying and analyzing opportunities to use data-driven insights for improved decision making. This role requires an individual with excellent statistical and analytical abilities and a solid understanding of online lead conversion, optimization, UX principles and other digital marketing concepts.

About the Digital Marketing Team:

The Digital Marketing Team has been a key component of HomeAdvisor’s success. The Digital Marketing team is responsible for performance-based online marketing initiatives, such as search engine marketing, display advertising, social advertising and more. This team manages millions of dollars in spend each month, and with that comes a huge opportunity to learn and excel. We’re constantly exploring better ways to operate and trying new things; coupled with our rapid growth, there are innumerable opportunities to support the company with your insight. This makes the SEM Analytics Manager critical to the continued success of Angie’s List and HomeAdvisor by providing the information necessary to make great decisions.

Responsibilities:
In conjunction with account management team, ensure SEM campaigns are effective and efficiently managed, reported on, and optimized to meet expected demand with desired KPIs.
Create reporting dashboards and custom reports analyzing campaign performance to provide actionable recommendations and deliver continuous improvements.
Design testing frameworks (split testing, deliverability and tracking) for ongoing optimization of click-through and conversion rates. Ensure adaptive learning from past campaigns to guide future testing.
Provide competitive research and analysis to track and trend the SEM competitive landscape and impacts to current campaigns.
Build effective working relationships with colleagues across the organization.

Desired Experience:
Bachelor’s degree with focus in Statistics, Economics, Finance, or Math
3+ years experience in marketing analytics, direct marketing, financial analysis or similar field
Superior analytical, problem-structuring, and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with key digital marketing platforms and automated bidding tools
Ability to merge information from numerous sources and work with incomplete data
Experience synthesizing data into information and presenting concise analyses
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; communicate effectively at all levels of the business
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel
