About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 5,000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nationâ€™s 20 leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.

Position Summary

The Senior Marketing Specialist will be responsible for effectively planning, managing and executing Physician Marketing campaigns across both conference and digital channels.

First, this position will be responsible for the strategic direction and annual plan for large, international conferences. Key conference examples include, but are not limited to: AACR, ASCO and ASH. The Senior Marketing Specialist will identify key City of Hope clinical topics to showcase at these meetings via knowledge of the Oncology marketplace, insight from COH clinicians and clinical evidence in the form of publications and abstracts. This individual will plan all aspects of the conference, including booth, paid media and reception (may be in conjunction with CME). This individual will be the cross-functional conference lead at City of Hope and will be required to align stakeholders on the conference plan: objectives, core clinical topics/ messaging and marketing opportunities (i.e. align with COH clinicians, communications, creative services, pathology lab, HR, etc. as needed). The Senior Marketing Specialist will be responsible for the creation and distribution of the project brief, including management of agencies to execute the booth and paid media. On an ongoing basis, this individual will re-evaluate the conference plan in order to determine whether or not to add new conferences (e.g. ASCO-SITC) and/or reduce resourcing toward a planned conference.

This position will also be responsible for physician-directed digital promotion, including, but not limited to Doximity and MedScape. This individual will coordinate with cross functional teams (including clinical marketing, communications, creative services etc.) in order to determine content calendar for digital promotion. This will role have working expertise of capabilities of each of these partners along with the strategic acumen of how to apply to each campaign (e.g. CAR T). This position will develop a monthly performance report to highlight performance of each digital tactic, as well as recommendations as to how to modify tactical plan as needed.

This position will also provide overall strategic thinking to physician-focused marketing efforts such as: national Reputation, CPS, partnerships, symposiums and CRM. Strong project management, including but not limited to: vendor management, budget management, communication to internal stakeholders and timely execution are also a key requirement for the role.

The Senior Marketing Manager will demonstrate the following skillsets: the ability to apply sound strategic marketing practice; Oncology marketplace knowledge, cross-functional leadership and project management. These efforts will be supported through strong written and verbal skills that will be used to articulate Physician Marketing programs and manage strategic marketing plans and campaigns.

Essential Functions
The Senior Marketing Specialist will be the conference lead responsible for developing, communicating and executing large, international conferences (AACR, ASCO, ASH).
This individual will be responsible for physician-facing digital strategy and promotional execution (e.g. Doximity, MedScape, etc.).
This individual has strong physician marketing acumen, along with knowledge of the Oncology market place trends. This knowledge and hands-on execution will be applied to additional clinical marketing projects as needed (e.g. CAR T leadership, national reputation, CPS and other partnerships).
This individual will assist with Tier 2 conferences (SSO, ASTRO, etc.) and symposiums.

Position Qualifications
Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Marketing, Business, English or a related field. MBA preferred.
Five or more years of marketing experience required.
Good working knowledge of all aspects of business planning, campaign development/management, marketing, media relations, business development and/or event management.
Hospital/Healthcare or Project Management experience within a highly engaged marketing environment preferred.

Skills/Abilities
Excellent organizational skills
Excellent writing and editing skills
Excellent planning and time management skills
Event marketing skills
Computer savvy, very proficient with the following software: MS Office Suite: Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook

Working / Environmental Conditions:
Occasional pressure due to deadline requirements and multiple competing priorities, event timelines.
Occasionally subjected to irregular hours, weekend events and travel.

Marketing Specialist

Summary

Creative, resourceful, relentless - that's you. You feel the urgency to accomplish and innovate, your medium is community, conversation, and collaboration. Uncertainty doesn't scare you. Planning, organization, and communication are easy for you. You've built and grown communities before and you can't wait to do it again. We need your experience to help us grow our engagement.

The Marketing Specialist position focuses on the day-to-day execution of end user engagement campaigns, while working closely with the Client Relationship team (not to mention the Product and Consulting teams as well). You will be involved in the full campaign life cycle - idea generation, content creation, campaign set up, testing, launching, and analysis and reporting. The primary goal of this role is to strengthen client relationships by keeping their end users engaged so that customers can extract superior value from their relationship with Financial Finesse. With your experience, you will play a pivotal role in the overall customer success strategy for our market-leading corporate Financial Wellness programs.

Problems You'll Help Us Solve

We are B2B2C. For organizations, our customized programs integrate employer-sponsored benefits, enhance utilization of employer benefits, reduce related expenses and risks, and improve employee engagement and productivity. Free access to an unbiased Certified Financial Planner™ is the unique service that Financial Finesse provides, and we have proven, behavior-changing results that have a positive impact on people's lives.

As the right individual for the team, you will be instrumental in launching and executing our strategic user engagement efforts. You will work closely with the Client Relationship, Product, and Consulting teams to create valuable, appealing content for end users that we will be able to incorporate in full-funnel campaigns that aim to "wow" people in support of our mission to "change financial lives". Your love of words, passion for expressing ideas, and ability to connect with your audience will help drive awareness and demand at each stage of the marketing funnel.

Your Skills & Experience
Human Bridge - You're personable and outgoing and have developed effective communication skills to act as a liaison between the audience and the organization. You need to be able to work independently, but you know the importance of collaborating with other departments to create an incredible customer experience
Relationship Manager - You have an ability to delight and engage end users. You know how to build strong relationships through engaging marketing campaigns and have a personal mission to build a community of fanatic brand advocates.
Creative (of course!)- You'll flex your creative muscles, and consistently think out of the box and bring new ideas to the table to optimize programs. You'll show off your ability to interpret and translate ideas into meaningful marketing campaigns to engage and motivate .
Results Driven- You'll develop your proven track record of creating and executing marketing campaigns and programs that drive end user engagement and advocacy in B2B environments. Your graphic design and effective copy capabilities are a strong/preferred plus.


Who You Are
Mission Focused - You will have an appreciation for the value of financial wellness education.
Versatile / Multi-Talented Contributor - Beyond core responsibilities, we also seek to leverage the strengths and interests of our employees in line with the needs of the business. Bring your intellectual curiosity and roll up your sleeves, as Financial Finesse is a flat organization with a relatively small team of driven and intelligent people often working cross-functionally to make strategic contributions to a business they believe in.
Intrinsically Motivated - You find meaning in the journey and in what you learn and build throughout it, including the bumps along the way.


What's In It For You

The Marketing Specialist position is based in Financial Finesse's headquarter office in El Segundo, CA. The total compensation includes a $65,000 base salary with quarterly and annual bonuses (typically 10-20% and up to 25%, respectively), resulting in a total compensation of up to $94,250. Additional financial opportunities exist through cash-based profit sharing and through equity plans, and we offer a full comprehensive benefits package and 401k matching.

If you're like us, please bring your dog to the office, enjoy our snack-filled kitchen, wear flip-flops to work, and enjoy working flexible hours. Your career here is what you make of it, and long-term career opportunities exist as we continue to grow and build out our company. Our team at Financial Finesse loves what we do and has fun doing it together.

Who We Are

Financial Finesse is a boutique, entrepreneurial firm located in El Segundo, CA. Since its founding in 1999, we have been the pioneering leader of the workplace financial wellness industry, which has recently reached an inflection point of growth. As an employee-owned company that operates with an entrepreneurial spirit and a philanthropic heart, we love what we do and the people we work with. We leverage the strengths of our people and proprietary technologies to work with large organizations such as Nestle, Aetna, Viacom, and the NFLPA to design and deliver full-scale, proprietary financial coaching technologies and services to be provided as an employer-sponsored benefit to their employees. We've been around for 18 years, and we're honored to have been recognized by Los Angeles Business Journal as a 'Best Place to Work', by Entreprenuer.com as a 'Top Company Culture', and Best in Biz as 'Most Innovative Small Company of the Year'.

Job Description

Summary
Marketing is more than ensuring growth: it's also about ensuring profitable growth through customer adoption, retention, expansion and advocacy. Are you ready to lead Watson Marketing's long-term success by delivering exceptional post-purchase customer experiences? Are you passionate about turning customers into fans and advocates? Then this is the role for you.

Detailed Description
The Customer Marketing Manager (Product Marketing Manager) at IBM marries deep customer, competitive and market understanding with in-depth product knowledge to develop and execute omni-channel go-to-market programs that deliver on business objectives.

In order for IBM to truly be essential to its customers, they must feel their relationship with IBM begins, not ends, at purchase. The Customer Marketing Manager is focused specifically on creating that essential experience through outstanding post-purchase customer experiences. Your objectives: ensure onboarding and adoption experiences are so delightful that customers are compelled to be vocal, passionate advocates on our behalf. Your success will be measured through improved Net Promoter Score (NPS), contract renewal and cross-sell/upsell extension rates, and conversion of users into advocates. And finally, your programs will not only have a direct impact on lifetime customer value to IBM, but have a halo effect on IBM growth through reduced friction in the pre-purchase experience.

Responsibilities
Be the expert on our existing customers' users, buyers, and influencers: through deep empathy, anticipate their needs throughout the post-purchase stages of their journey, including onboard, adoption, and advocacy.
Partner with Offering Management, Client Success, Support and Design: create a true omni-channel post-purchase experience that includes all touchpoints: onboarding team, technical support, in-product/in-service, marketing communications, success teams, sales and more.
Partner closely with the Watson Marketing Product Marketing managers and their diamond teams: Consistently deliver compelling digital post-purchase experiences through the IBM Marketing Plan / Campaign framework, and deliver clear, customizable, and clever enablement materials for IBM Client Success Managers, IBM Contract Extension Managers, IBM Software Renewal Representative and IBM Business Partner relationship managers.
Convert users into advocates and a tribe: create Watson Marketing brand advocates, leveraging Blue Access, IBM Champions, and other IBM advocacy programs.
Partner with IBM Originals and content marketing: design and deliver high-quality digital content that delights existing customers, and compels advocate to take action.
Support the Watson Customer Engagement community manager: deliver engaging content and SME engagement from Watson Marketing.
Use Net Promoter Score and other qualitative and quantitative assessments: use data about our offerings, packaging, pricing and customer touchpoints to continuously improve across all touchpoints.

What you'll need to succeed:
Bachelors of Science or Arts, preferably in marketing, business administration, commerce, or engineering
2+ years of product marketing experience, preferably in cloud-based software
Can translate complex technical capabilities and solutions into meaningful stories that users and advocates can understand and easily share with broader, non-technical audiences
Lives and breathes the customer experience, and embodies a buyer-centric approach to all aspects of marketing and business.
Ability to implement with excellence, and improve both process and outcomes through continuous learning
Ability to influence cross-functional peers and leadership to build consensus and action, and is particularly adept at using data analysis to tell stories that resonate with them in their language.
Ability to represent their brand in public venues (events, client meetings, online, etc.). Experience in direct client relationship management a plus.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise

2+ years of product marketing experience, preferably in cloud-based software or marketing technology
Experience as a marketing/digital marketing professional


Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

Experience with pragmatic and agile marketing methodologies
Experience working on global marketing initiatives

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Overview
Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a nationally recognized, full-service accounting and advisory firm whose specialized professionals connect with clients and their businesses through refreshing candor and clear industry insight. With approximately 2,700 employees across the United States, Baker Tilly is ranked as one of the 15 largest accounting and advisory firms in the country. Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion.
 This Marketing Manager position will develop and implement strategic marketing plans for the Government Contracting Advisory Services and Forensic Litigation and Valuation Services consulting practices in alignment with the teams’ business plans. Work closely with partners, team leaders, marketing colleagues, and others to conduct research, develop plans, and implement strategies. Plan and implement a wide range of marketing tactics and initiatives, including demand generation through multi-channel campaigns, sponsorships, events, speaking engagements, thought leadership content, webinars, e-mail marketing, presentations, advertising, and press releases; develop and maintain effective sales collateral and practice-specific content. This is a hands-on, proactive role in planning, managing, executing, analyzing, and reporting on marketing activities for these consulting practices.
 It’s an exciting time to join Baker Tilly!
  Baker Tilly Annual Report 2017 
Responsibilities
Proactively develop and implement strategic marketing plans in alignment with the overall firm-wide marketing plan and respective industry, service line, or local office business plans.
Develop and implement strategic plans/playbooks for assigned teams

Manage and implement a wide range of marketing activities such as thought leadership, webinars, digital advertising, social media, events and sponsorships to support the strategic marketing plans. Discuss client service planning topics and relevant management recommendations
Share industry insights and knowledge
Monitor and report results

Establish industry/service differentiation
Effectively leverage firm marketing resources and planning tools
Innovate, share, and implement best practices
Research industry issues, developments, and trends
Track and report marketing return on investment and marketing return on objectives of initiatives 
Proactively communicate initiatives and results with marketing leaders, marketing director, and the marketing team
Conduct research and market intelligence
Research and prepare market intelligence reports
Integrate market research and competitive data into industry/service line strategic marketing plans as well as specific marketing tactics
Work with subject matter experts and lead the development and promotion of industry-focused content and thought leadership materials, such as white papers, articles/alerts, case studies, and client testimonials
Respond to ad-hoc research requests
 Manage staff, as assigned

Become acknowledged and sought out by others due to extensive, in-depth knowledge and expertise of the assigned industry/service lines
Perform other responsibilities as assigned

Prior marketing management experience in a professional services environment preferred
Excellent Microsoft Office Suite skills required and experience with Adobe Acrobat, Photoshop and/or InDesign preferred
Must be able to communicate effectively with all levels of staff from entry level to partners and work well in a team-focused environment. High-level verbal and written communication skills required. High attention to detail is essential
Excellent planning and measurement skills, including experience in building integrated campaigns and leveraging thought leadership
Strong grasp of marketing principles, including marketing automation, CRM, social media, online and native advertising, and other digital marketing
Excellent people skills, enthusiastic attitude, and ability to build relationships
Effectively work under tight deadlines, manage projects independently, and be resourceful in addressing challenges and solving problems
Strategic thinker with superior professionalism, judgment, and strong work ethic

About You:

Job Description:

WSJ Professional Membership- Marketing Associate

Who we are and what we do?

The newly developed Professional Membership team is responsible for recruiting and retaining members of the world's foremost influential business membership. We equip ambitious professionals with the essential intelligence and tools they need to better lead their industries, grow their businesses and advance their careers. We provide a highly specialized service that builds on the power of our journalism, the insight of our analysis, the ambition of our audience and the continuity of community.

Where am I based?

New York

Who is my manager?

Marketing Director

Position Summary

The Marketing Associate supports the marketing team in developing and executing integrated campaigns to deliver on brand and event marketing strategies for WSJ Professional Membership

We are looking for an organized marketing associate to join our team. The Marketing Associate will be able to analyze marketing data and metrics. The candidate will work and conduct research on special marketing projects identified by the Marketing Director. The Marketing Associate will support Marketing Managers with execution and implementation of marketing campaigns and daily administrative tasks. The candidate will have strong social media application knowledge, Excel and PowerPoint skills to create reports for various projects

What the Marketing Associate Does:
Assist Marketing Managers with the execution and implementation of campaigns by ensuring all deliverables are on track for completion according to deadlines, and creative is in adherence to campaign objectives and brand guidelines
Generate reports, maintain and update records of marketing metrics and results of past campaigns
Assist in setting brand standards, mission, and goals
Have strong social media application knowledge
Manage the workflow for creation, production and delivery of marketing materials. Work with internal departments and external agencies, draft creative briefs, provide creative feedback and manage approvals.
Manage daily administrative tasks to ensure the Marketing department runs smoothly
Assist with organizing promotional events
Coordinate with the Marketing Design and Content teams to create advertising material
Keep organized records of marketing metrics and results of past campaigns

Associate Requirements and Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or statistics or relevant field preferred
3+ years' previous experience as a marketing associate, marketing assistant, or related position
Solid computer skills, including MS Excel, web analytics and Google Adwords

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Strong analytical skills with a goal-oriented attitude

Able to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions

Knowledge of marketing digital tools and techniques

Do you love working across multiple marketing disciplines? Can you speak email, partnerships, content, design, and strategy? Have you built these functions for a B2B company before? If so, we need you on our team!
Every year, 45M Americans move from one home to another. Updater’s mission is to make the moving process more streamlined and efficient for all 45M of them.
We’re seeking an experienced Marketing Manager to create and implement B2B marketing programs that drive sales initiatives through email, search, partnerships and social channels. Many tech companies have marketers that specialize in each of these channels, but we’re looking for a “full stack” digital marketer who can span across these channels, testing new strategies that you believe will scale and move the needle beyond Updater’s current strategy.
Your main responsibilities will include leveraging email campaigns as powerful lead generation and client communication tools, fulfilling activities related to pre-existing partnerships (including email campaigns, webinars, and advertising), and developing fully-integrated marketing programs or “campaigns-in-a-box” that can scale with the business.
You’ll need a willingness to be flexible, a proactive nature and entrepreneurial spirit, and the keen instinct to de-prioritize things that do not have a direct impact on growth. A strong technical understanding of marketing systems is required.
What You'll Be Doing
Lead the development, monitoring, and optimization of all email marketing including design, execution, and post-send reporting
Develop strategy for nurture campaigns that drive leads to take action
Maintain positive and productive relationships with partners, managing partner marketing communications and supporting partner marketing strategies and campaigns.
Generate new partnership ideas across business verticals, with a passion and precise understanding of the Updater brand and all of its products and capabilities.
Identifying and researching new marketing opportunities for Updater
And much more!
What We Expect From You
Minimum 5 years of relevant marketing experience creating successful brands and B2B marketing/sales programs – startup experience a plus!
BA/BS degree or equivalent
Strong business/copywriting skills – there is a heavy amount of writing required
Proficiency in marketing automation systems and CRMs, particularly Marketo and Salesforce
Comfortable with learning new technologies
Self-starter mentality, fierce organizational skills, and a sense of humor
About Updater
Updater makes moving easier for the 17 million households that relocate every year in the US. With Updater, users seamlessly transfer utilities, update accounts and records, forward mail, and much more. Hundreds of the most prominent real estate companies in the US (from real estate brokerages to multifamily and relocation companies) rely on Updater’s real estate products to save clients hours with a branded and personalized Updater moving experience.
Headquartered in New York City, Updater has raised nearly $100 million from leading investors, including SoftBank Capital, IA Ventures, Commerce Ventures, Second Century Ventures (the strategic investment arm of the National Association of Realtors®), and more. Updater ranked #3 on Crain's 2016 Best Places to Work in NYC, ranking as the highest rated tech company on the list. For more information, please visit www.updater.com.
Updater is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, actual or presumed belonging to an ethnic group, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Overview
tronc is seeking a Marketing Strategist to partner with our account teams on building marketing programs for our current and prospective clients.  The Strategist will lead the ideation process while leveraging client KPIs and competitive positioning; proprietary and syndicated market research; and value proposition of our solution portfolio.  The Strategist will collaborate with research, creative, demand generation, and specialty agency partners to customize solutions for their market and educate our account teams.  This position is ideal for a candidate that is creative, intelligent, resourceful, collaborative, and has a passion to win.
Responsibilities
Become an expert on the client’s business and industry by ingesting information from our account teams and category research assets and doing your own research as needed (including direct client engagement).
Create media and marketing solutions from the tronc portfolio that exceed our premium clients’ objectives and KPIs. We’ve expanded far beyond our legacy publisher brands into digital, experiential, and multi-cultural programs that help businesses connect to their target customers.  The Strategist is a critical connection point between client objectives/KPIs, marketing solution, and supporting rationale.
Own the creation of visual materials that drive our client-facing presentations and proposals.
Create and customize portfolio collateral for your market and brand, including comprehensive media kits and specific solution offerings.
Challenge our account teams by ensuring their solutions are designed to exceed client objectives and expectations.
Facilitate and participate in real-time collaboration with your market partners and across other tronc business units.
Maintain online asset repository of our collateral for your market.
Collaborate across tronc market and centralized resources on marketing strategy, execution, research, and other relevant initiatives.
Collaborate across departments (Editorial, Planning, Ad Ops) to strategically align with and create revenue opportunities.
Manage 1-3 direct reports, if applicable.
Perform additional duties as assigned, meaning there will be other things you’ll need to do that we haven’t thought of, but will generally be in line with the position.
Qualifications
Personal attributes: Embrace challenge; relentless pursuit of excellence; little fear of adversity and headwinds; self-starter mentality that takes direction but doesn’t wait for it; kind and decent human being; doesn’t take her/himself too seriously; challenges current practice and standards; innovative; embraces change.
Education: Bachelor's degree
Experience: minimum 5 years of B2B marketing experience in media or marketing services with a solid understanding of fundamental marketing principles including online/digital, promotions, product development, competitive media.
Strong research and analysis skills, with the ability to generate insights based on data, sales strategy, and consumer trends
Multi-tasker: Ability to manage multiple deadline-oriented projects concurrently and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail and organizational skills
Balance: Ability to be strategic, analytical, creative, communicative, and detail-oriented
Expert skills in Powerpoint, Excel and graphic design programs.
Experience using Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, comScore, MOAT, Scarborough, Media Radar, Borrell, Claritas/Nielsen, Polk Insight/Catalyst and other similar research and analytics services
Embraces team outings with karaoke

At Convene, we’re changing the way the world works by transforming the way businesses work. You are either already an expert in or must be able to quickly learn the tools and technologies within the marketing and sales stack.  In this role, you will become an expert on digital marketing, the marketing funnel, and pipeline management.
What You’ll Do
Execute digital marketing campaigns on Google Adwords, LinkedIn, Twitter, and others
Execute email campaigns, and assist the operations team in creating nurture and smart list programs in Marketo
Building dashboards and reporting in Marketo and Salesforce
Building models for the marketing funnel to project the future marketing performance
Who You Are
Strong quantitative background with 1-2 years experience
Proficient in Excel
Working knowledge of Salesforce and Marketo preferred
Ability to follow directions and learn from senior marketing team members
HTML experience a bonus
About Knotel
Knotel is transforming the office market with its Agile HQ™ Platform. Making long-term leases a thing of the past, Knotel designs, builds, and operates custom spaces for established and growing brands, so they can be free to grow their businesses at will and build what’s never been built.
Named a Business Insider Top 50 Startup and New York's Hottest New Workspace Model, Knotel has over 50 locations across more than 1 million square feet in New York, San Francisco, London, and Berlin. Founded in 2016, Knotel has raised $100 million in funding. Knotel’s member network includes companies like Starbucks, Cheddar, and King.  Visit www.Knotel.com.
Our Core Values
Fly your Flag - Don’t check your identity at the door. Bring it inside - we are better for it.
Don’t Look Away- Care for the details no one told you about. Make every space a home and give the gift of belonging.
Outcomes, Not Processes- Time is precious. Save it. Start with the goal and back out the journey
Get Uncomfortable- Innovation starts at the edge of the unknown. Embrace the adventure and sign up for the hairy challenges.
“Where is it Engraved…”- Question orthodoxy.
Share in the Victory Dance- No one summits alone. Leverage the best in others and offer the most in yourself.
Diversity & Inclusion at Knotel
At Knotel, we know that a diverse workforce fosters our individual and collective success. We are committed to building an inclusive, collaborative culture where people of all races, genders, sexual orientations, and religious backgrounds can do their best work. This is all fueled by our employees, who drive the efforts and initiatives outlined here.

BounceX is hiring a VP of Marketing to build the strongest enterprise brand in MarTech. You will define and solidify BounceX’s reputation as the category leader in the People-Based Marketing (PBM) space, further evangelize our value proposition, and drive interest from CEOs and CMOs of enterprise organizations.
We’ve already been established as the first revenue channel with scale in 10 years and are just getting started. You’ll be able to directly influence BounceX’s impact across the industry.
Below are the qualifications you’ll need in this role. If you’re interested, get an intro to someone on the BounceX executive team.
Responsibilities:
Use your previous experience building a powerful brand to execute strategy on company marketing initiatives that contribute to our high growth goals
Collaborate with senior leadership to manage production of content and convey BounceX’s brand voice across all marketing channels
Manage and motivate the existing team and develop a long-term plan for marketing team structure and growth

You have managed brand reputation and defined a new category
You have marketed million dollar products before
Dynamic and charismatic public speaking skills
Proven track record of driving interest from CEOs and CMOs of enterprise organizations

Founded in 2012, BounceX’s People-Based Marketing (PBM) cloud is the first new revenue channel with scale in 10 years. We are trusted by global enterprises such as Forever21, Avis, JetBlue, CNN, Uniqlo, Comcast and many more.
BounceX is built on the belief that the success of a company is rooted in the strength of its team, so we’ve created a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages employees to love coming to work. World-class benefits like paid family leave, career coaching and donation matching are just a few of the things that make BounceX different. Overview:
The selected candidate will be part of Guidepoint's growing Marketing team, assisting in building and expanding the Guidepoint brand. We're seeking an innovative B2B marketer who will define, develop and execute marketing plans that generate leads, nurture existing clients, and raise overall brand awareness. The successful candidate will work with senior business partners to build strategic integrated programs and manage through delivery. The ideal candidate will have an entrepreneurial, digital-first mind-set that balances both creative approaches to reaching our audiences, and executing effective, measurable campaigns. Guidepoint is a dynamic organization which requires this individual to bring new ideas to the table, and be proactive on Day 1.

Guidepoint is a leading expert network firm connecting business decision-makers with experts around the world. Since our inception in 2003, we've arranged more than a half million interactions between our clients and experts. We support clients in identifying critical insights through a suite of services including phone consultations, in-person meetings, custom surveys and proprietary data products.

Our experts, known as Guidepoint Advisors, provide business professionals with a comprehensive understanding of a topic prior to deciding upon strategic choices and making investment decisions. Guidepoint Advisors are accomplished industry leaders and practitioners. Our esteemed client list is vast and includes the top global consultancies, private equity firms and hedge funds, as well as Fortune-ranked companies.

Guidepoint is headquartered in New York City and has offices in San Francisco, Dusseldorf, London, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Singapore and Seoul. For more information visit our website at Guidepoint.com

Responsibilities:
Develop and manage integrated programs including content strategy, thought leadership, lead generation, digital and social media, and events
Concept, edit and produce written and video content
Generate & execute email marketing campaigns
Work closely with senior management and sales team to develop promotional material and sales presentations
Write strong web copy and targeted copy for social media channels
Develop and refine messaging, competitive differentiation and marketplace positioning through industry research
Qualifications:
Minimum of 3 years relevant experience in B2B marketing or communications strategy with experience in digital marketing
Prior experience working in professional services industries desired
Knowledge of Salesforce, Google Analytics, Marketo/Eloqua/Act-On, and WordPress a plus
Experience directing the work of creative agencies and design professionals
Ability to work in a deadline-driven environment while working on multiple projects simultaneously
Strong project management skills and organizational skills
Experience managing end to end marketing from analysis and planning through execution of successful marketing programs
Must have pulse on new digital trends across digital, mobile and social platforms
Must have both solid writing & interpersonal skills; aptitude for numbers
Bachelors degree required (Marketing, Communications, English, and/or Business major a plus)
Guidepoint is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V

Company Description:
Quartet is a pioneering technology company connecting physical and mental care to improve people’s health and quality of life. We are building a collaborative technology platform that brings together physicians, mental health providers, and insurance companies to effectively improve patient outcomes and drive down healthcare costs. Our data-driven platform identifies high-need patients and facilitates access to personalized care. Backed by $92MM in venture funding from top investors like GV (formerly Google Ventures) and Oak HC/FT, Quartet is headquartered in NYC and is currently operating in several markets across the US -- Pennsylvania, Massachusetts, Louisiana, Washington, Northern California, and New Jersey.

Developing strong partnerships with health payers and systems is critical to how Quartet delivers on our mission to bridge the gap between physical and mental health care. Reporting to the Head of Business Development Operations and partnering closely with the Chief Marketing Officer, you will tell Quartet’s story to our customers through core marketing materials and establish our industry presence through thought-leadership and events. As the Sales Enablement Lead, you will equip the BD team with training to sell better, smarter, and more efficiently.

You will play a critical role in aligning the intersecting elements of sales, marketing, customer success, product, and operations to drive sales effectiveness and enhance the customer experience.

Success for this role will be marked by the transition of our BD team from independently-operating revenue owners, each building unique value stories for customers, to a scaled, cohesive team telling a unified story across our current and prospective customer base. Empowered by your work, our BD team will be equipped to pursue more leads, with shorter sales cycles, and to strengthen our existing partnerships. Most importantly, your work will advance our mission of providing mental health services to the greatest number of patients across the country.  
Responsibilities
Develop messaging to articulate Quartet’s story and product solutions in a clear, compelling, and consistent way, partnering closely with Marketing, Product, Data, and Operational teams
Gather customer insights, conduct competitive analyses, and identify industry trends to enhance our product-market fit 
Translate customer feedback and industry insights into value creation opportunities, and then drive cross-functional initiatives to build these actionable solutions
Establish two-way communication channels between the BD and cross-functional teams to share insights and facilitate collaboration 
Develop marketing collateral to visually communicate Quartet’s value and solution (e.g., case studies, presentations, testimonials)
Manage the sales enablement content repository and ensure information is readily accessible 
Design and execute an industry event strategy with Marketing to drive pipeline movement, coordinating events and thought leadership seminars with senior healthcare executives 
Equip the BD team with trainings to foster continued education on sales excellence, industry knowledge, and Quartet’s solution
Qualifications
3+ years of experience in the healthcare industry (health plans and health systems preferred)
5+ years of Marketing experience (both B2B and B2C preferred)
Experience working closely with sales teams 
Strategic thinker that can take broad visions and complex concepts and distill them to clear messaging
Experience working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial driven organization with willingness to roll up your sleeves and work iteratively on deliverables
Collaborative team player with a proven ability to partner cross-functionally   
Bachelor's degree required, Master's degree preferred

Quartet interview requests and job offers only originate from quartethealth.com email addresses (e.g. jsmith@quartethealth.com). Quartet will also never ask for bank information (e.g. account and routing number), social security numbers, passwords, or other sensitive information to be delivered via email. If you receive a scam email or wish to report a security issue involving Quartet, please notify us at: security@quartethealth.com.

The Role:
The Director, Marketing will own the development of campaigns and experiences that build awareness and drive audience conversion for Topic and The Nib. We want a curious, creative, and critical thinker who can translate insights into initiatives that create growth. In addition, this role will support marketing efforts for The Intercept, Field of Vision, and other First Look Media initiatives.
Collaborate with the editorial, studio, creative and business teams to identify and implement strategies to meet organizational goals, including editorial performance, creative development, marketing campaigns, audience growth, revenue, and more.
Lead projects from conception to completion in collaboration with other teams.
This role will be an integral member of the Marketing team and will report to the VP, Audience within the Marketing organization. The role will have one direct report.
Primary Responsibilities:
Content Marketing: Oversee the creation of creative briefs and strategy materials. Collaborate with creative, editorial and studio teams to position our digital and TV content.
Paid Media Planning: Develop (along with the agency) highly-efficient performance driven media plans that effectively promote our brands and content across Facebook, Twitter, and Google (YouTube, AdWords, Paid Search).
Audience Targeting and Outreach: Understand the position of our brands within the cultural and competitive landscape in order to target the right audiences and build the right user behaviors.
Podcasts: Lead the development of podcast awareness initiatives that grow listeners and revenue.
Newsletters: Develop and execute audience acquisition strategies for Topic and The Nib’s newsletters to increase engagement and subscriber base.
Secondary Responsibilities:
Partnerships: Establish and maintain partnerships (including syndication, content swaps, sweepstakes, etc.) with third party publishers to grow traffic and brand presence.
Business/Revenue: Collaborate with the business team to uncover insights and strategies to develop appropriate collateral and sales marketing material.
Analytics/Optimization/SEO: Understand changes in traffic and engagement in order to translate user response data into actionable insights. Work closely with the product team to identify testing initiatives to improve onsite engagement. 
Background & Qualifications:
8 or more years of marketing experience, preferably in entertainment (TV/film/digital), media or publishing.
Experience working with editorial, product, creative, and technical teams.
Some experience working with customer-centered business goals (e.g. subscription, e-commerce or membership).
Experience overseeing campaigns on social/advertising platforms including: Facebook Ads Manager, Instagram, Twitter, Adwords, etc.
Extensive experience with developing creative briefs and evaluating concepts / final executions
Proficiency in internal web tracking solutions (Google Analytics), native social media measurement tools (Facebook Insights, Twitter Analytics, YouTube Analytics, etc)and social media measurement experience (Sysomos, ListenFirst, CrowdTangle, etc.)
Strategic thinker with excellent analytical, written, and verbal skills with an eye for creating engaging presentations and simple reports
The Company:
A bold, independent spirit defines everything we do at First Look Media – from journalism that holds the powerful accountable, to arts & entertainment that shapes our culture. Launched by eBay founder and philanthropist Pierre Omidyar, First Look Media is built on the belief that freedom of expression and of the press, and fiercely independent perspectives, are vital to a healthy democracy and a vibrant culture. 
From The Intercept, dedicated to fearless, adversarial journalism to Topic, our Academy Award™-winning (Spotlight) entertainment studio, we develop, produce and finance content for all screens including feature films, television, digital series and podcasts. First Look is also home to Field of Vision, the filmmaker-driven documentary unit, and the Nib, a site for the most provocative satirical and political comics.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer--people of color, people with disabilities, women, and LGBT candidates are strongly encouraged to apply; we are committed to a diverse workplace, and to supporting our staff with ongoing career development opportunities.

Job Description

IBM Watson Marketing is the world's leading AI-powered marketing platform.

As a Diamond Team Marketing Manager on the Watson Marketing team, you will work across the functional marketing teams to execute the strategy, plans, and KPIs in support of the pipeline, signings, revenue and profit goals of the business. You will act as a liaison to marketing, product, and sales to address risks and concerns and ensure corrective action plans are in place.

The ideal candidate is organized with attention to detail, strategic, highly collaborative, and works seamlessly to manage a shifting workload. Candidates should excel at working in a fast paced work environment with rapid/continual changes.

Detailed Responsibilities Include:
Oversee and project-manage the execution of product marketing, digital, web and social media marketing plans with quantifiable objectives
Collaborate on a comprehensive marketing plan in support of the go-to-market strategy for the buying agenda
Drive quarterly marketing priorities to create demand for new and existing customers and achieve marketing contributions to pipeline and revenue
Work across marketing, product, and sales to deliver promotions with compelling offers
Define, measure and drive teams to course correct issues with key marketing KPIs to ensure the success of GTM activities including digital campaigns, web initiatives, GTM readiness, events participation and social amplification
Support sales teams in their efforts to execute on their business, revenue and growth objectives by ensuring the delivery of required content, marketing materials and sales tools for the buying agenda
Ensure representation of buying agenda solutions, and improve evangelist/ executive presence, at 3rd party and industry events
Lead the work with professions and industry diamond teams in the IMTs to define GTM strategies and plans for the buying agenda

What you need to succeed:
A passion for continued improvement and experimentation with new techniques and technologies
Track record of delivering effective marketing programs that demonstrate original thinking
Thorough understanding of what marketing tactics are needed to achieve desired results
Expertise and experience in the development, analysis and reporting of marketing KPIs.
Ability to influence the inclusion of the buying agenda and associated offerings across GEOs and Industries
Experience in the B2B sales cycle and in working through multiple selling channels
Excellent written and verbal skills with the ability to work cross-functionally across marketing, product/offering management and sales and teams
Proven experience communicating and presenting data to key stakeholders and senior management
Results oriented, and a self-starter
BS/BA in Business, Marketing, Communications, or related field required
A positive and collaborative mentality


Required Technical and Professional Expertise

5+ years internal IBM marketing experience, or 6+ years experience in enterprise marketing, ideally in both the B2B and SaaS space;
Experience in agile/scrum methodology
Cross functional experience with teams is required.


Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

Experience in hi-tech product marketing preferred
Experience in digital marketing technology preferred


EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Job Description:

Marketing Associate - Student Memberships

Job Description:

The Marketing Associate supports the Student Memberships marketing team in developing and executing integrated campaigns designed to deliver on brand strategy, in life customer engagement and sales support. You will contribute towards overall business objectives and the future direction of Dow Jones entities, namely The Wall Street Journal.

Responsibilities:
Assist Marketing Managers with the execution and implementation of campaigns by ensuring all deliverables are on track for completion according to deadlines, and creative is in adherence to campaign objectives and brand guidelines.
Nurture contact with a variety of stakeholders, coordinating with teams across the business to move projects forward.
Represent the student customer: advocate for seamless customer journeys, champion the value of membership and arm yourself with key data insights to drive marketing strategy and communications.
Exercise a thorough knowledge of the brand and an ability to balance team goals with overall company objectives.
Manage the creation, production, and delivery of marketing materials. Work with internal departments and external agencies, draft creative briefs, provide creative feedback and manage approvals.
Deliver improvements in student subscriber activation. Manage the reporting of KPI and other indices as per set criteria, on a daily, weekly, monthly basis.

Qualifications:
1-2 years experience working in a marketing or communications role. Media or publishing is a plus.
A bachelor's degree in marketing, business administration, journalism or communications.
Experience in supporting campaigns that use a variety of marketing channels and communications methods.
A passion for and understanding of The Wall Street Journal brand, customers, and products.
A mindset that is data curious, data literate and digital first, with the ability to balance the need for art and science.
The ability to work quickly and manage multiple projects efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
First-rate communications and writing skills with the ability to present, as well as proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite.Ability to stay calm under pressure and manage workload effectively in a fast paced environment

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. It produces leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Factiva, Barron's, MarketWatch, Financial News, DJX, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, and Dow Jones VentureSource.Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (NASDAQ: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

Job Req 12314

Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

Position Summary

Marketing Operations is the foundation of our demand generation team. The Director of Marketing Operations will help drive inbound lead acquisition strategy and build the marketing automation programs to nurture leads to sales readiness. They will utilize our martech stack to its fullest potential, employing all features available to load the top of the funnel and drive leads through with increased conversion rate and velocity.

In addition, Director of Marketing Operation will recruit, develop and retain the analyst and data science talent necessary to staff a robust analytics program. They will direct the analytics team to enable a higher level of data-driven performance across all marketing functions but maintain a core focus supplying the demand gen activity with advanced segmentation and targeting.

Finally, they will maintain constant communication with sales leadership and enable our marketing and sales teams to connect with our global target customer base. They will be revenue minded and directly contribute to the continued growth of F5 and the Marketing organization.

Primary Responsibilities

• Lead the Global Marketing Operations team, comprising of martech, demand center, and analytics functions.

• Manage the demand funnel, and optimize conversion and velocity of leads traversing through the funnel in partnership with Sales leadership and Sales Operations.

• Own and optimize the MarTech stack, looking for new tools to improve operational effectiveness and efficiency.

• Manage the service bureau function offering highly accurate Marketo program creation and on-time execution servicing Theater Marketing, Solutions, PD, Services, Sales and Channel Sales functions.

• Manage the analytics function to enable a higher level of data-driven performance across all marketing functions.

• Drive Advanced Analytics (Data Science) process to ensure proper framing of business problems and effective delivery of models and segmentation.

• Maintain and optimize our lead management process through reporting, lead scoring, and lead routing to ensure no lead is left behind.

• Work closely with the Sales Operations team to identify gaps in current processes and systems, focusing on the enhancement of sales productivity.

• Lead our data hygiene efforts through data cleansing, list segmentation, data alignment and implementing process and workflow improvements.

• Create scalable and repeatable operational processes to improve the efficiency of demand generating programs.

• Drive data and analytics strategy to ensure end-to-end campaign and demand funnel reporting, from lead and account acquisition to closed won sales.

• Work closely with the Sr Director of Strategic Marketing to manage Budget tool and ensure budget planning and execution remains visible and on-target and ensure all marketing budget is spent responsibly

• Create and manage A/B testing initiatives as well as other proactive testing strategies.

• Actively monitor, analyze and report on the health of the marketing contribution to pipeline.

• Offer and amplify Demand Generation best-practice

• Act as the liaison between Marketing and Executive Leadership to report on Marketing successes and weaknesses.

• Partner with Sales leadership and Sales Operations to ensure Sales teams have proper enablement content and training

• Partner closely with Finance and Marketing Leadership team to ensure optimal use of marketing budget.

Qualifications

• 5+ years of experience in marketing operations or sales operations

• A strong commitment to leadership and a consistent track record of management excellence

• Experience with Marketo, Salesforce, or the Adobe Marketing Cloud

• Experience with implementing or operating with the SiriusDecisions Demand Waterfall strategic framework

• Strong understanding of the B2B marketing space

• Background in digital marketing channels and tactics throughout the B2B buyer journey

• Theoretical and practical analytics skills

• Ability to adapt quickly to requirement changes

• Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills

• Creative thinker

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Solid interpersonal skills

• Resourcefulness and organizational skills

• Roll up your sleeves, can-do attitude.

Physical Demands and Work Environment
Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.
Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material.
Duties may require being on call periodically or working outside normal working hours (evenings and weekends). Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane, approximately 5% of the time spent traveling.
Job may be performed on-site at a customer facility or data center, or in an office environment sitting at a desk or computer table.

Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

The Sr Product Marketing Manager will be able to understand the target customers and market dynamics in order to launch and support new products, services, and technologies to customers, the F5 sales force, analysts and channel partners. The role requires excellent writing skills in prose and presentation formats, as well as marketing strategy, execution and business analysis skills with a proven track record of effectively leading technology products and solutions. This individual will create product messaging and positioning, launch and support new products, and enable sales and channel teams, and engage directly with customers and partners.

Our ideal candidate will also have strong leadership, communication and project management skills with an ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, including Product Management, Corporate Marketing, and Sales and Business Development, to lead and execute on a wide variety of product marketing initiatives. Demonstrable skills in developing customer and sales-facing presentations and other materials, including sales playbooks, white papers, website material, videos, and written communications to employees and external stakeholders, is mandatory.

Primary Responsibilities

Develop product messaging and positioning that differentiates F5 products in the market

Enable Sales/Partner teams by creating and communicating the value proposition of the products and developing the sales tools that support the sales motion of your products

Support launches by developing the product marketing strategy launch plans for new products and releases and managing the cross-functional implementation of the plans

Produce product collateral such as sales, customer, and analyst presentations, product overview and datasheets, FAQs, briefs, and webcasts

Build and leverage market intelligence by understanding the new and emerging F5 buyers, how they buy and their buying criteria, and by understanding the competition and how to position successfully

Contribute to demand generation efforts by delivering product content and participating in activities for the marketing programs that drive demand for F5 products

Develop and implement go-to-market plan in coordination with cross-functional team including corporate marketing, sales/channel readiness, and BD teams

Lead engagements with sales and channel teams, customers, and partners via webcasts, direct meetings, marketing communications, and industry events

Lead engagements with industry press and trade analysts

Lead and mentor teammates on the product marketing team

Present marketing strategy and plans to senior and executive level management

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Significant experience in technology-oriented product marketing

Ability to effectively lead & own project initiatives independently

Understanding of networking and public and private cloud technologies desired

Demonstrated ability to produce technical marketing content of hiring quality: sales playbooks, white papers, website material, videos, and written communications - writing samples required.

Experience working in a global role and understanding marketing differences across different regions.

Good collaboration and negotiation skills, and the ability to work effectively across teams and organizations in a global (often virtual) work environment

Knowledge of enterprise marketing and sales processes

Outstanding written and oral communication skills including public presentations

Strong organizational, analytical and execution skills

Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane up to 20%.

Qualifications

BA/BS degree required. MBA Preferred

6+ years experience in product marketing or equivalent

6+ years analyzing products, customers and market dynamics.

4+ years in technical marketing

Job Title

Manager, Consumer Marketing

Job Description

In this role, you have the opportunity to
Add value : in order to aggressively grow beyond our current 800 million EUR yearly turnover we are looking for a passionate business professional that will drive a new innovative Oral Healthcare solution that addresses the needs of our various markets.

You are responsible for
Drive the definition, development and introduction of new Power Toothbrush products that bring our consumers a superior performance and product experience
Translate in-depth market, consumer, dental professional and competitive analyses into winning concepts by defining - market specific - product positioning
Integrate these new concepts into a strategic product roadmap that uniquely addresses the needs of Philips Personal Health markets
Deliver innovation to the market via the innovation product development process, from idea to product introduction
Interact with all associated disciplines, including Technology & Development departments, internal and external design agencies, own manufacturing units and/or external suppliers and the Commercial Organizations of key target markets.
You are a part of
A dedicated marketing professionals reporting directly into the Sr. Consumer Marketing Director responsible for global Power Toothbrush portfolio. The team brings a wealth of international experience: your peers have background in various parts of the 'value chain' bringing experience in 'upstream' marketing as well as 'downstream' experience e.g. from working in sales organizations or market communication.
In your role as leader of multifunctional project teams you will closely interact with Commercial organizations, Innovation & Development team, Market Communication, Market Intelligence team, Supply Chain and in-/external Suppliers.

Our offer

We offer a highly challenging position with an attractive balance of strategic thinking and 'hands on' activity in an international business environment. You will work in an exciting dynamic working environment in the Seattle area on breakthrough innovation. Your work will directly contribute to Philips' ambitions to be a leader in the world of innovative Oral Healthcare solutions, as well as making a meaningful impact on consumers' lives through your product range.

Finally the position provides an excellent opportunity for fast career advancement, with successful candidates likely to move up to more senior positions in the Philips organization.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

University degree or MBA qualified in a relevant subject area (for example business/strategic marketing, economics)
A minmum of 5 years of consumer marketing, product market introductions or marketing communications experience in an international business environment
International business or study experience preferred
Your conceptual thinking, organizational and communication skills allow you to influence and motivate others
Your broad interest and ability to communicate with different 'layers' in the organization allows you to build and maintain extensive networks and 'connect the dots'
Your highly entrepreneurial mindset and real aptitude for business motivate and inspires your environment and creates momentum behind your ideas
Your natural affinity for consumer health/ lifestyle products, and a consumer driven approach allows you to identify new opportunities and translate them into winning propositions.

In return, we offer you
As the Consumer Marketing Manager, we offer a highly challenging position with an attractive balance of strategic thinking and 'hands on' activity in an international business environment. You will work in an exciting dynamic working environment in the Seattle area on breakthrough innovation. Your work will directly contribute to Philips' ambitions to be a leader in the world of innovative Oral Healthcare solutions, as well as making a meaningful impact on consumers' lives through your product range.

Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job. It's a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum . Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video .
To find out more about what it's like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog . Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process , or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions .

Philips is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, protected veteran or marital status.
As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.

PositionSummary

We are looking for a Director, Web Marketing to establish the technical vision and strategy of F5's digital properties to drive leads, conversions, engagement and ultimately revenue for the company. In this role, you will work with marketing, creative, content, campaigns and technical partners to deploy a premier website infrastructure and deliver on innovative functionality. You will be expected to translate global marketing strategies into a roadmap for developing personalized, performant, and desktop + responsive mobile experiences. You will lead our web production, web development and user experience team members leveraging agile methodologies. The ideal candidate will have strong digital strategy and web platform skills; a consistent track record of leading/scaling teams and strong operational capabilities to drive efficiency & speed.

This is a highly visible role which requires the ability to partner with strategic and technical leadership across the organization. This role reports to the Vice President, Corporate Marketing.

Primary Responsibilities
Employee management including but not limited to interviewing and hiring candidates for open positions, onboarding, establishing goals, assigning or delegating work, providing on-the-job training, giving guidance to staff, conducting performance evaluations, approving paid time-off (PTO), developing performance improvement plans, and taking disciplinary action.
Leads the technical implementation of a new large-scale web platform to develop optimal experiences for different audiences.
Work closely with campaigns and demand generation teams to optimize campaign performance via development of integrated landing experiences and customer journeys.
Partner with regional marketing leads to deploy systems and processes needed to evolve regional websites from simple translations to truly localized experiences.
Work with content and developer teams to establish strong governance practices and QA to ensure consistency and alignment to brand standards.
Grow organic inbound traffic through SEO and technical site optimization; ensure all web-based properties are aligned and generating the highest quality results.
Develop, prioritize and execute the roadmap of longer-term strategic website enhancements and tactical improvements that align with the overall marketing strategy.
Partner with analytics team to enable accurate reporting on web performance and closed-loop impact on the full funnel.
Support a culture of continuous experimentation within the web experience through multivariate testing.
Build a customer- obsessed culture within the team that focuses on user experience and customer success.
Manage and scale a team of web producers, web developers and web optimization experts to evolve and continuously improve F5 web properties.
Develop and maintain critical metrics and site statistics in tight alignment with marketing operations.
Responsible for upholding F5's Business Code of Ethics and for promptly reporting violations of the Code or other company policies.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Expert experience in project management with emphasis on achievement definition and management
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including an ability to meet objectives through influence, facilitation and consensus building
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use data and analytics to understand and improve performance
Advanced capabilities to multi-task in a dynamic environment
Advanced competency in critical thinking and leadership with positive relationship management ability
Qualifications
Bachelors Degree, preferably in Marketing, Business, or related field.
10+ years' experience in technical enterprise website management and production, with a focus on integrated systems and process optimization
Working knowledge of Adobe AEM (required)
Experience in business requirements analysis, software architecture and programming
Physical Demands and Work Environment
Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.
Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material.
Duties may require being on call periodically or working outside normal working hours (evenings and weekends). Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane, approximately 10% of the time spent traveling.
Job may be performed on-site at a customer facility or data center, or in an office environment sitting at a desk or computer table.

KOMO/KUNS, in Seattle, WA, is looking for an experienced Marketing Consultant with deep expertise in the operations and marketing of auto dealerships to become Sinclair local market subject matter experts. The people in these positions will become integral parts of our company-wide training and sales initiative focused on tier 3 auto business. In addition to training and coaching, we're looking for closers with a proven record of developing business in the category, accurately forecasting revenue, and creating strategic business plans in this highly competitive vertical. The winning candidates will design and implement revenue growth strategies for their local market both as an independent seller and co-seller with local colleagues. Creating solid partnerships with dealers and Sinclair station leadership will be keys to success. If you're an industry leader, we're interested in talking to you.

Specific Duties include:
Exceed expectations for market penetration, average deal size, and total revenue in assigned geography
Maintain consistent presence in the field driving growth from all auto dealer
Develop, implement, and manage business plans to exceed corporate objectives and sales goals
Act as player/coach on in-person sales calls with key decision makers at dealerships throughout the local market
Conduct immersive training sessions with sales team based on Sinclair auto philosophy
Collaborate with in-market SBG leadership to set sales goals and objectives for each local account
Provide the Regional Digital Automotive Manager with monthly outlook and revenue forecast
Work closely with sales management and corporate staff to ensure coordination and cooperation in support of sales and operations
Perform other related duties as assigned
Desired Skills/Experience:
Demonstrated success in building and maintaining top-tier customer relationships
Strong business acumen with a thorough understanding of marketing strategies, automotive business cycles and consumer behavior
Real experience and success communicating and working directly with auto dealers on identifying and achieving their business goals
Proven track record of developing and managing people and sales process
Strength is running multiple unique strategic projects concurrently



Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree
3+ years of experience in dealership operations and/or digital media sales
Experience managing a large sales territory
Proficient in the use of office software and CRM tools
Excellent communication, presentation, planning, organizational, and problem-solving skills
Previous sales management experience is not required but valued

At HUB International, we are a team of entrepreneurs. We believe in empowering our clients, and we do so by protecting businesses and individuals in our local communities. We help businesses evaluate their risks and develop solutions tailored to their needs. We believe in empowering our employees. As a global firm, we offer employees resources in both technology and industry expertise, but we still maintain the local flavor of our offices. Our structure enables our teams to maintain their own unique, regional culture.

HUB is the 7th largest global insurance and employee benefits broker, providing a broad array of property, casualty, risk management, life and health, employee benefits, investment and wealth management products and services. With over 10,000 employees in 450 offices throughout North America, HUB has grown substantially, in part due to our industry leading success in mergers and acquisitions.

Here's Where You Come In

We are currently seeking an Associate Marketing Coordinator to join our growing Northwest Insurance team. You'll be supporting producers, helping them to achieve their goals as it relates to marketing and sales operations, present HUB Value adds and benefits in sales meetings and new business pitch environments, present in-person and webinar hosted training sessions for individual producers and office locations, and providing best in class sales content including media, events, and presentations. Other tasks include supporting our sales team with presentation templates, marketing collateral, and top client retention campaigns, and coordinating and interfacing with the corporate marketing team.

You're Great At

Ideally you'll be well versed in marketing and project management, with excellent verbal and written communications, Adobe Creative Suite and be detail oriented. You should also have at least 2 years marketing & sales experience, preferably in insurance or other financial service industry. Working with Microsoft Office products is a daily occurrence and strong knowledge in these applications will help.

Here's What We Can Offer:

At HUB we are committed to providing a diverse and challenging work environment encouraging critical thinking, problem-solving and project management. Our teams thrive on a collaborative environment while embracing and celebrating individual achievements.

We offer competitive pay and an excellent benefits package, including medical, dental, vision and 401k with employer matching. We all strive for a healthy work life balance so we offer paid holidays and a generous paid time off policy.

Still Interested?

Take the first step towards a rewarding career and future with HUB, we want to hear from you! Apply today!
