Job Description:

T-Mobile USA, Inc. has an exciting opportunity for a Paralegal to join the Legal Team that supports the Communications, Advertising, and Marketing groups at T-Mobile's corporate headquarters in Bellevue, WA. This role will assist the Legal Team's attorneys and program managers in a variety of functions.


Responsibilities:

Enterprise Core Competencies:
Requires competency in customer focus, change & innovation, strategic thinking, relationship building & influencing, and results focus.
Essential Functions:
Review, edit, and approve advertising and marketing materials;
Monitor compliance and reporting in various marketing-related contexts;
Assist attorneys with any competitor disputes, regulatory inquiries, and other adversarial inquiries that may arise;
Conduct factual research and data collection as needed;
Assist with special projects and other duties as assigned.


Qualifications:

The successful candidate will have the ability to work effectively both independently and as a team member, excellent attention to detail, excellent organizational and monitoring/tracking skills, the ability to own and complete multiple and competing tasks within tight deadlines, good verbal and written communication skills, strong customer-oriented and interpersonal skills, a strong desire to take initiative, and the desire to work in a fast-paced and cutting-edge industry. In addition s/he must have 3 or more years of experience in a paralegal role, and competency with all Microsoft Office products and Adobe. An interest in and aptitude for consumer protection and advertising law is strongly preferred.

Education:
High School Diploma required
Paralegal certificate from ABA-approved paralegal program preferred
Bachelor's Degree preferred


Minimum Qualifications:

Must have the above listed required education and experience as stated. Must be at least 18 years of age, able to pass the required background check and have US work authorization in place and established.

Company Profile:

As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile US, Inc. (NASDAQ: TMUS) is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile US provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and MetroPCS. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com

Position Summary:

The Solutions Marketing Manager is a member of the solutions marketing group that provides deep product and market expertise to support outbound marketing activities and deliver business value messaging to market influencers through product, solution and market evangelism. This role is a key role at F5, designed to help drive core and cloud ADC customers, market and external awareness about the breadth of F5's product capabilities and overall F5 thought leadership in the core technology space. It requires someone with exceptional written and oral communication skills, a deep passion for the technology and a commitment to making sure the world knows about our solutions.

Primary Responsibilities:
Create strategic Business Value Messaging for F5 products, solutions, and go-to-market collateral for the core and cloud ADC market
Develop and produce key technical product content (e.g. white papers, best practices architectures, tech briefs, PPTs, webinars, narratives, eBooks) that allows for effective marketing and to arm customers, channel, and sales
Evangelize and promote F5 products and solutions to key market influencers and the general market through F5 collateral, social media, industry events, community events, customer road shows, etc.
Collect and relay customer and market requirements and use cases to foster broader understanding of market influences, direction, and timing.
Write blogs, and other collateral that tell a compelling story of the value proposition of F5 solutions as well as creating thought leadership content. These must be coordinated, aligned, and published with other team members content. Strong teaming and communication skill are required.
Act as the solutions marketing consultant to other organizations in the planning, development and delivery of go to market plans, presentations and projects (trade shows, road shows, training, etc.)
Assist Product Management and Product Marketing in planning and prioritization of new products and solutions based on market and customer insights.
Responsible for ensuring the integrity and credibility of the Solutions Marketing team by providing peer-review and discussion of content produced.

Qualifications:
10+ years relevant work experience required. (SE/SA background highly desirable)
Background and experience in writing and/or public speaking required.
Considerable technical experience with core and cloud ADC technologies.
Experience with ADC technologies and overall industry, business, and marketing.
Experience working with F5 products or competitive solutions supporting core and cloud customer needs.
Strong technical, written, and verbal skills are a must.
Must be able to work individually as part of a cohesive team.
Must be able to provide constructive criticism.
Passion for evangelizing solutions, promoting the products and public speaking.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering or equivalent, required. Master's degree preferred.


Duties require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane, approximately 20% of the time spent traveling.

Your Impact:
In this role, you will provide primary research methodology, survey/discussion guide design, and analytical consulting and execution supporting Axon product and marketing groups. The successful analyst will work directly with product/marketing teams to develop and execute comprehensive “Voice of the Customer” (VOC) plans that support strategic and tactical direction throughout the lifecycle.  This analyst will leverage qualitative, quantitative and instrumentation data, to drive key insights aimed at growing competitiveness in the marketplace.

At Axon, our goal is to make each individual feel valued for his or her contributions to the company’s mission. We want intelligent people who are passionate to do remarkable things, and we strive to create an environment where people can succeed and enjoy coming to work every day. 
Your Day to Day
You understand the product lifecycle, and relevant business objectives throughout, and in turn will recommend and design appropriate research methodology, develop questionnaires and discussion guidelines, and build and implement sampling as well as analysis plans to address those objectives
You will design methodologies and instruments to collect data on customers, competitors and markets, and leverage advanced analytical approaches (key driver analysis, perceptual maps, conjoint analysis, etc) to provide meaningful insights that drive actionable results. 
You will analyze data using statistical software, converting complex data and findings into understandable tables, graphs, and written reports
You will continually look to improve the quality, visibility and meaningfulness of “VOC” within the organization
You will create easily digestible, insightful reports and present findings and implications to product, marketing and executive teams.
You evaluate program methodology, sample plans, and data to ensure that data is accurate  
You will work with advanced research software to create, distribute, analyze and centralize research and results
You will triangulate results across multiple sources to provide holistic, and comprehensive research insights
You remain fully informed on research innovations and implement standard methodologies
Skills Preferred
Experience using online survey implementation tools such as Qualtrics, Vision Critical, Satmetrix or similar.
Experience with software, law enforcement and/or hardware experience
Skills Required
Bachelor of Science degree (preferably in Statistics, Marketing Research, Marketing or related discipline)
Minimum 4 years experience in validated market research analysis experience
Strong understanding of software design, instrumentation data and usability testing
Sound understanding of statistical concepts, research and collection methods, survey design, and experimental design
Experience with qualitative moderating and discussion guide development
Ability to interpret and clearly articulate large amounts of data
Strong communication and presentation skills
Strong Analytical, Critical Thinking, and Multitasking Skills
Familiarity with CRM, NPS, and CSAT programs
You have working knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite: Excel, Powerpoint, Word, Outlook, etc. 
Willing to Travel 25-30%
Compensation and Benefits
An awesome office/working environment with the latest technology
Competitive salary and a comprehensive benefit package
Fun team activities and outings
Flexible working hours
Options for training in the US
Opportunities to ride along with local law enforcement

5-9 years of marketing & sales related business and/or consulting experience with increasingly more senior responsibilities, ideally focused in Digital Marketing
Experience executing and/or leading digital marketing programs for digital agencies or client marketing
Broad understanding of current marketing & sales trends, their impact on business strategies, and their implications in creating and sustaining competitive advantage with a focus on digital marketing and customer experience
Understanding of how to use digital marketing channels, techniques, and operating models (e.g., org, processes, capabilities, client/agency engagement)

Who You'll Work With
You'll be working in one of our offices in North America with our Marketing & Sales practice.
The Marketing & Sales Practice strives to help clients in both consumer and business-to-business environments on a wide variety of marketing and sales topics. The mission of this practice is to help clients achieve marketing-driven profit growth. Our clients benefit from our experience in core areas of marketing such as branding, customer insights, marketing ROI, digital marketing, CLM, pricing, and sales and channel management.
What You'll Do
You will work in teams to tackle the key strategic, organizational, and operational challenges faced by our clients.
You'll collaborate within a team to bridge marketing expertise/knowledge and quantitative, fact-based consulting approaches. Using this expertise, you'll guide our clients in defining and refining their strategies in Consumer and B2B Marketing & Sales with a focus on Digital Marketing.

Specifically, you will work with companies to capture breakout sales growth by tapping new markets, personalizing customer experiences and optimizing interactions.

Affirm is looking for an ambitious Email Marketing Manager with hands-on experience in email campaign management to help build and drive consumer engagement strategy. The Email Marketing Manager will be responsible for the design and execution of complex life cycle and trigger programs that drive customer activation and retention and improve the user experience. The ideal candidate should have proven success building and managing a variety of email activation and nurture programs, an entrepreneurial attitude, and strong interest in e-commerce or financial services.

 This an extremely cross-functional role, working closely with internal business, product, creative, analytics, credit, and product marketing teams.
What you'll do
Define, lead, and drive our email marketing strategy to activate, retain, and engage our Affirm’s quickly growing consumer base
Define operations and infrastructure requirements to scale email marketing operations
Manage daily operations of the email marketing channel – marketing calendar, creative design, execution and deployment of email campaigns, A/B testing and measurement
Build and Manage complex CRM programs for our existing customer base; Automate nurture programs, ensure end-to-end tracking and proper measurement
Collaborate with the Design team to determine content strategy and ensure brand guidelines are followed in emails
Work closely with Analytics to regularly report email performance, use data to continuously test, measure and optimize the email marketing program
Partner and collaborate cross-functionally with business, product, product marketing, credit, design and analytics teams
What we look for
3-6 years experience in email marketing operations and end-to-end campaign management
Strong analytical skills, understanding of A/B testing and holdout test methodologies, ability to draw conclusions from data and take action accordingly
Demonstrated project management experience with ability to indirectly manage and build consensus across diverse teams, including creative, and analytics
Entrepreneurial spirit to build channel strategy and operations from scratch and openness to testing and learning
Eye for creative design and basic copywriting skills preferred
Expertise in email best practices, including segmentation, deliverability, and copy and design approaches.
Experience with a major email service provider
Working knowledge of HTML for email coding
ABOUT AFFIRM
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly. Started by PayPal co-founder Max Levchin, Affirm gives consumers the flexibility to buy now and make simple monthly payments. Unlike other credit options, Affirm offers transparent payment terms (no fees or compounding interest), and employs advanced technology to reach a broader consumer population.

Product Marketing Manager, Partnerships
About Mixpanel
Mixpanel helps businesses build better products with the most advanced analytics software for mobile and web. With almost 20,000 customers worldwide and 14% of the Fortune 500, Mixpanel has earned a reputation for creating a delightful customer experience and an innovative approach to analytics.
About the Role
We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager, Partnerships to work with our Partner & Business Development Team to identify new partner opportunities, build collateral, and develop partner onboarding. This person will also drive joint marketing and take on other core marketing projects as needed.
Key Responsibilities
Drive partnership strategies in collaboration with our business development and executive teams
Inform our partner prioritization through a deep understanding of the market, customer needs, and competition. Partners can include technology products like Optimizely or Salesforce, boutique and global channel resellers, strategic analytics consultants, and implementation partners.
Drive co-marketing with partners, working with their marketing teams and ours to bring in leads. Marketing activities may include joint webinars, events, email marketing, and other demand generation campaigns.
Build an onboarding and certification program for partners based on industry best practices.

Develop world-class content to recruit and enable partners
Craft tailored partner pitches and positioning to support business development efforts.
Create joint collateral that helps turn leads into customers.Content could include one-pagers, white papers, competitive talking points, product positioning, etc.
Pitch to customers/partners and work side by side with our business development and sales teams to strategize and build new tools to land new deals and upsell opportunities.

Take on key projects that help grow our enterprise business
Develop competitive strategies & positioning with our Sales Engineering team.
Conduct deep research to understand the data & analytics ecosystem and customer/sales requirements, then feed findings into our roadmap planning process.
Run product launches related to Mixpanel’s platform and integrations.
What We Are Looking For
3-5 years of product marketing experience, especially in B2B, analytics software or SaaS.
Ideal candidate has at least 2 years of experience working with partners, either in a marketing or business development role.
Strong quantitative chops and a desire to measure results, married with excellent written and oral communication.
Relishes the challenge of translating highly technical product offerings and concepts for a wide variety of audiences, elucidating the “why”, not just the “what”.
Self-starter who thrives on the opportunity to build new programs that impact the company.
Strong storytelling skills (with a strong allergy to jargon).
Quick learner, organized, and self-motivated with ability to define goals and prioritize work based on what’s most impactful to the business.
Why choose Mixpanel?
A clear market leader in the analytics space, Mixpanel received funding by world-renowned VC firms like Andreessen-Horowitz, Sequoia, and YC, and our revenue has grown significantly since then. Our ambitious, collaborative team makes it possible by finding creative solutions to new challenges with scaling, reliability, design,and customer service. Mixpanel has a rapidly growing team of 250+ in our offices in San Francisco, New York, Seattle, Salt Lake City, and London.
Mixpanel is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer supporting workforce diversity.

San Francisco Office

We take our jobs seriously, but we also know how to have fun, with sponsored social activities and plenty of opportunities to celebrate our achievements!

SUMMARY:

The Manager of Omni Channel Marketing Strategy will be responsible for helping develop and implement marketing strategy and programs to drive customer growth. This individual will also be responsible for reading and reacting to business performance, creating strategic solutions to help the brand exceed financial goals. Reporting to the Director of Marketing Strategy, this role will serve as an integral function in building the brand's annual marketing strategy, as well as seasonal strategies and key marketing initiatives, all through an omni channel lens. As part of the Marketing Strategy team, he/she will be an important piece of the strategic hub of the marketing department, turning insights into opportunity through a comprehensive understanding of the customer, the brand, and the retail landscape.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Owns the strategic analysis of Old Navy marketing performance as it pertains to ROI, customer growth/engagement, and market share.

o Leads efforts to analyze seasonal performance and leverage key data and customer insights to optimize existing programs and drive new strategies for customer growth

o Quickly assess and anticipate business performance, competitive shifts and adopt strategies to drive optimal performance.

o Leads the measurement and analysis of strategic marketing initiatives (e.g. product growth strategies, customer experience initiatives, etc.)

o Partners with marketing effectiveness team on seasonal benchmarking and ROI measurement

o Partners with analytics team on media forecasting and optimization
Plays a key role in turning insights into action across the marketing department
Maintains an intimate understanding of the target customer, utilizing internal data along with primary and secondary research
Supports the development, execution and share-out of consumer insights
Perform analyses to understand Old Navy's competitors and trends in the industry
Relentlessly drive growth through creative thinking and a test-and-learn methodology


REQUIRED SKILLS:
Min. 5 years of professional experience with a strong strategic planning background; marketing experience a plus
Proven ability to derive, synthesize and apply findings to business problems to lift sales, traffic and customer engagement
Keen ability to use data to tell a story; experience drawing and synthesizing insights from a number of different sources (e.g. consumer research, industry data, internal performance metrics, etc.).
Passionate about investigating consumer behavior and how it drives marketing strategy; customer insights or CRM experience welcomed but not required.
Ability to work with an omni channel lens; e-commerce experience a plus.
Strong written and oral presentation skills (e.g., can make clear, persuasive arguments for the relevance and applicability of their insights)
Contagious in your enthusiasm to lead others and inspire great innovative work
Innately curious with an insatiable appetite to learn
Self-starter not afraid to tackle any opportunity
Must be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Embraces and enjoys collaboration, but can effectively tackle projects independently
Proficient in Microsoft Excel


KEY BENEFITS:
Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta.
One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.

Employee stock purchase plan.

Employees can apply for tuition reimbursement.

Company Description
Dropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the world's creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox has more than 12 offices around the world.

Team Description
Our Marketing team sets product positioning and strategy, manages product launches, and gathers customer insights. We're responsible for maximizing our products' potential, in order to delight our users and help Dropbox grow. We partner with teams across the company, including Product, Sales, and Engineering.

Role Description
As a Digital Marketing Analytics Manager, you will be a part of the Strategic Marketing Operations group responsible for driving discipline in marketing analytics, supporting the marketing organization with sophisticated analytics and reporting and understanding the impact of our marketing efforts.

The Marketing Analytics team is passionate about using data to help make better decisions about our marketing activities and investments. The Marketing Analytics Managers are responsible for the entire marketing analytics lifecycle, from ensuring that we design the right campaigns and experiments, to making sure we implement all learnings and insights into day-to-day marketing decision-making. We are an action-oriented team that focuses on driving a large organization to incorporate data and insights into all critical decisions.

You will take ownership of analytics projects and programs, work with contractors and agencies, partner with key stakeholders within Digital Marketing, Data Science, Revenue Analytics, and other cross-functional teams to establish priorities and timelines and deliver on critical digital marketing analytics initiatives. You will work in close partnership with Marketing Operations and Data Engineering to help assess and shore up our data repositories, data infrastructure, and data governance policies.

Responsibilities
Function as the lead analytics partner for digital marketing: own end-to-end performance reporting on all core performance marketing metrics
Take ownership of all datasets for measurement of digital marketing performance and reporting to cross-functional stakeholders, including leadership in marketing, sales, and product
Collaborate with marketing leadership to develop strategy, standards, goals, and KPI's throughout the entire marketing funnel from awareness to purchase
Extract insights on behavior of customers acquired through performance channels using analytics tools, data platforms, and internal databases
Ensure your numbers are air-tight by performing individual quality control, checking with relevant data owners, and cross-referencing findings against secondary sources
Drive interpretation, socialization and adoption of operational marketing reports
Surface analytical insights: proactively investigate root causes of aberrant data, and identify opportunities for optimization
Lead design and implementation of experimentation necessary to improve channel efficiency, drive growth, and inform marketing investment decisions
Work with data science to inform development of predictive models that guide digital marketing targeting and investments
Requirements
2+ years experience working on performance and CRM marketing (through channels such as SEM, Display, and Email)

This role is a new position on Slack’s Field Marketing team and will be a key player in fostering the growth of Slack's regional marketing practice. You will work closely with the AMER sales team to understand region-specific market priorities in addition to partnering with product marketing, business development, and design teams to create high value events that deliver best of breed content and experiences for our customers, prospects and partners.

Maximize Slack’s reach and presence at third party events through sponsorship execution and complimentary marketing campaign creation.
Develop event programs that effectively create brand awareness, new pipeline and influences existing deals across all segments of Slack’s business
Think creatively about the customer and prospect experience at in-person events, and build experiences that are above expectations for attendees
Operational excellence in building event programs across the country, often running multiple events consecutively

4-7 years experience in field marketing
Experience in building field marketing programs in both saturated/high customer-density regions and green-field territories
Proven track record of building successful partnerships with sales teams to craft programs that are metrics-driven in their approach

Track record of creative execution of in person experiences
Travel up to 35% of the time

5-9 years of marketing & sales related business and/or consulting experience with increasingly more senior responsibilities, ideally focused in Digital Marketing
Experience executing and/or leading digital marketing programs for digital agencies or client marketing
Broad understanding of current marketing & sales trends, their impact on business strategies, and their implications in creating and sustaining competitive advantage with a focus on digital marketing and customer experience
Understanding of how to use digital marketing channels, techniques, and operating models (e.g., org, processes, capabilities, client/agency engagement)

At Bozzuto, it's all about experience. Whether it's the experience you bring, gain or give, we want your journey to be exceptional. Guided by our core values of creativity, concern, passion and the pursuit of perfection, we've been creating inspiring, engaging and vibrant communities for three decades.

Why do we do it? Because home is where aspirations are pursued and memories unfold. We believe in the power to impact the lives of the people we touch through the delivery of extraordinary experiences.

Responsibilities:

You're the marketing leader for a portfolio of communities. You bring your passion for marketing, apartment living and being a local market expert with you to work every day. You instill, in everyone you interact with, a sense of Bozzuto pride. You're obsessed with understanding your customer's mindset and strive to create extraordinary experiences, for customers and team members alike.

As a Marketing Manager, your primary responsibilities include:

Lead Management & Marketing Innovation
A Marketing Manager is expected to be an innovator on every project. This role provides an opportunity to develop original concepts, approaches, and solutions to set each development apart from the competition and position our internal and external clients for success.
Facilitate agency selection and oversee creative direction to deliver brand and marketing strategies and materials that meet expectations of all stakeholders and adhere to Bozzuto standards
Partner with operations teams to analyze local market trends and make strategic marketing recommendations
Conduct regular site visits, attend owner meetings and participate on regular calls for assigned portfolio
Continually enhance deliverables by using consumer insights and trends to exceed expectations of our customer
Project manage branding initiatives including but not limited to: property websites, collateral, signage, promo items, digital ads, etc.
Marketing Implementation
Successfully market the launch of new properties by developing and executing strategic marketing plans for the launch of new properties.
Establish and manage relationships with creative partners
Analyze available data and using findings to drive marketing plan optimization
Advise on and execute media plans, digital media campaigns (email, SEO, PPC, social, etc.)
Provide direction on website design and user experience
Develop and execute opening strategy
Develop and implement signage plan
Project & Budget Management
Exhibit excellent project management, problem-solving and decision-making skills while leading cross-functional collaboration across the organization and with clients and partners. This is a fast-paced role that requires ability to manage many projects simultaneously.
Communicate branding and marketing initiatives and ROI to clients throughout entire brand development process
In conjunction with the respective Property Manager and Regional Manager, develop an annual marketing budget for each property in the assigned portfolio
Ensure adherence to deadlines and budgets
More Responsibilities
Contribute to the overall marketing discipline, processes and standards of the Bozzuto marketing team
Support the development and activation of Bozzuto global initiatives
Support new product development efforts by communicating relevant insights and learning to the team
Provide marketing support to new business efforts and RFP responses
You Create Value by:
Building a motivating environment that encourages your team members to give their very best
Coaching in the moment and providing team members with opportunities to develop their skills while simultaneously developing your own
Proactively managing the performance of all team members through performance reviews, regular constructive feedback and development/growth plans
Taking responsibility for delivering results, making sure issues are addressed and resolved with urgency
You play an supporting role in making certain the community reflects Bozzuto's 5-star standards
You roll up your sleeves and assist team members-no job is "below your pay grade"
What You Bring to Us:
Minimum of 4 years of marketing experience
Previous agency experience with a working understanding of email marketing, direct mail, and buzz marketing a plus
Proven success in crafting and implementing innovative ideas and concepts
Previous marketing experience in the multifamily real estate industry preferred
Expertise in launching marketing plans and advertising campaigns
Expertise in managing marketing planning and activation from start to finish
Proven success in managing multiple projects with tight deadlines
Adobe Photoshop and InDesign experience preferred
What We Bring You:

In addition to our award winning culture, a myriad of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, great looking offices, and a positive and supportive environment, Bozzuto offers a wide range of insurance options, programs, and benefits that let you and your family be healthy and plan for the future. Including:
Comprehensive and affordable health plans
Free life insurance
Employee wellness incentives
Company-matched 401K
Teledoc, free 24/7/365 access to a doctor online

Job Description

The purpose of the Consumer Marketing Team is to lead the marketing strategy, planning and development of consumer, customer and Allstate Agency level communications programs that build Allstate brand consideration, choice and loyalty, drive brand consistency, and broaden the brand footprint across all media and communication vehicles, and to ensure programs are delivered with operational excellence. The team is also responsible for developing and maintaining Allstate brand standards and guidelines. The Consumer Team collaborates with various Allstate business and marketing internal and external partners to ensure programs and communications are strategically aligned with business goals and strategies.

The Customer Marketing Specialist supports planning, design and creative development of 1:1 marketing communications programs and manages day-to-day execution of marketing communications tactics that are designed to drive profitable growth and retention for Allstate. The Customer Marketing Specialist will help in 1:1 multi-channel test design and personalization, including leading all phases of a program/project plan. This position will primarily support the enterprise areas of Product Innovations, Content Marketing and Customer Newsletter development and execution. This position will work with his/her manager to consult with others in Consumer Marketing or other business areas to set plans and then develop, execute and measure the 1:1 plan. The Marketing Specialist must possess a variety of competencies including some analytic skills, attention-to-detail, good communication skills and ability to judge creative and provide constructive feedback to both internal and external partners. The Customer Marketing Specialist is expected to both manage and/or support the day-to-day efforts of multiple projects simultaneously.

Key Responsibilities

Contribute to the planning, creative development and implementation of integrated marketing communications (primarily 1:1) to support various programs and strategies, offering solutions and recommendations to manager and other contributing team members
Support day-to-day management of all elements through completion including creative development, campaign measurement and post program analysis
Support the development of business rules for data management technology platforms
Manage required day-to-day tasks, including status report and timeline management, meeting coordination, legal and key stakeholder approvals, and maintaining centralized files for reference and compliance..
Assist with the development of presentations, program overviews, recaps, and other materials for internal meetings and presentations.
Contribute to integration across Consumer Marketing teams and other departments, building relationships with internal and external business partners and resources
Initiate ideas and actions on cross-functional teams
Work with solid level of independence on new or unfamiliar projects


Job Qualifications

Experience in developing and implementing creative communications across multiple formats
Intermediate organization and project/program/time management skills
Intermediate experience using Microsoft suite; advanced PowerPoint skills a plus
Intermediate relationship, interpersonal and negotiation skills
Intermediate presentation development and delivery skills
Intermediate solutions skills; flexible in times of change
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal; strong ability to write, copyedit and judge creative
3+ years of Marketing experience (preferably including Advertising/Marketing Agency experience)
Bachelor's degree required, advanced degree preferred: Marketing, Journalism or Communications concentration preferred
Must be highly motivated and a passionate team player

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities â€" we're just getting started.

The Facebook platform offers marketers limitless opportunities to reach consumers. The same properties that make the Facebook platform an ideal place for marketing also make the platform an ideal place to conduct analytical work and marketing research to become a better marketer in the new mobile world. This role will be part of the Marketing Science Team focused on Small and Medium Businesses and Agencies (SMB) on Facebook helping scale marketing science practices to more agencies in the SMB ecosystem. The person in this role will help drive the mission of marketing science with SMB agencies through education, consultative support and proactive research. A key responsibility is to help build our leading edge global program to support the success of agency partners. The person will provide leadership to a cross-functional team and guide the team from a Marketing Science perspective, as well as execute the program. They will also be responsible for working directly with our sales and product marketing teams to identify and execute proactive scalable programs in market that lead to growth of our advertisers' businesses, while continuing to manage against inbound demand for support. The scalable programs will span from key ad-effectiveness research questions that impact industry, market, vertical and measurement product strategies.

The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and critical thinking skills, a passion for generating data-based insights, experience working with research organizations, and the ability to drive the mission of data and insights forward with high impact and speed. They should have talent for taking complex concepts and distilling them into clear accessible formats. This role will challenge the candidate to not only provide strategic direction to advertisers on their measurement efforts, but also to develop strategic insights into marketing on the Facebook platform.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead development of a new capability to scale the SMB agency ecosystem, leveraging a broad array of existing marketing science solutions and developing new ones
Work cross-functionally and globally to develop relevant content, solutions, and treatments as part of the new capability and execute the same
Use a variety of methods such as webinars, office hours, consultation sessions, and outbound communications to support the day to day needs of the sales organization and clients
Work directly with a broad array of Facebook agencies to help them deliver true business value and growth to their advertiser clients and thereby ensuring success of the agencies
Engage in agency and client conversations, presentations of results, and consult internally with the sales teams, to ensure the right recommendation, design and setup of measurement studies
Deliver trainings/education for the sales teams through dedicated sessions and boot camps
Design and/or lead key proactive research programs that will help grow our advertisers' businesses (in partnership with product marketing and sales)
Provide key strategic partnership and guidance to Facebook product teams and other cross-functional teams for success of SMB agency partnerships
Analyze key sets of ad-effectiveness studies to summarize key learnings/findings for sharing out best practices and inform future strategies for businesses on Facebook
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
5+ yearsâ€™ experience of media/marketing measurement or analytics experience or 3+ years' experience with advanced degree
Experience influencing and partnering with stakeholders across organizations
Knowledge of online advertising, branding, and performance advertising and marketing frameworks, including ad-effectiveness measurement techniques
Experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets, statistical software such as R, SPSS, SAS as well as data extraction tools such as Hive and/or SQL
Statistical analysis experience, including but not limited to experimental design
Experience delivering data-driven insights, including influencing advertiser planning and buying behavior
Track record of operating independently, demonstrating creativity, and delivering results
Experience communicating technical content to audiences
PREFFERED QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced degree in a quantitative field

Overview
tronc is seeking a Product Marketing Manager to support our go-to-market strategy and growth in digital marketing services.  These services, combined with our media brands, boutique marketing agencies, and strategic sales approach, offer our client partners highly-effective solutions to grow their business.  This position will focus on market positioning, growth strategy, and business planning.  The ideal candidate will have a combination of digital marketing expertise, strategic and creative thinking skills, and financial acumen.  S/he will be equally comfortable and effective with both strategic planning and digging into specific client partnership pitches.
Responsibilities
Own our strategic planning process and deliverables for our digital marketing services businesses.
Develop expertise by tracking industry trends and client feedback/performance with our offerings. Understand how various industries leverage digital marketing services to grow their businesses.
Contribute to company decision-making process around growth and direction of the business.
Create portfolio collateral including comprehensive media kits and specific solution offerings.
Apply best practices from our partners and vendors to strengthen our product portfolio and sales effectiveness. Facilitate and participate in real-time collaboration with your market partners and across other tronc business units.
Collaborate across tronc market and centralized resources on marketing strategy, execution, research, and other relevant initiatives.
Challenge our account teams by ensuring their solutions are designed to exceed client objectives and expectations.
Perform additional duties as assigned, meaning there will be other things you’ll need to do that we haven’t thought of, but will generally be in line with the position. 
Qualifications
Personal attributes: Embrace challenge; relentless pursuit of excellence; little fear of adversity and headwinds; self-starter mentality that takes direction but doesn’t wait for it; kind and decent human being; doesn’t take her/himself too seriously; challenges current practice and standards; innovative; embraces change.
Education: Bachelor's degree
Experience: Minimum 5 years in a related role, or related experience with agencies or consulting firms.
Marketing Tools Experience (preferred): Google Analytics, comScore, Adobe Analytics Suite
B2B marketing experience in media or marketing services with a solid understanding of fundamental marketing principles including online/digital, promotions, product development, competitive media.
Strong research and analysis skills, with the ability to generate insights based on data, sales strategy, and consumer trends.
Multi-tasker: Ability to manage multiple deadline-oriented projects concurrently and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills; attention to detail and organizational skills; financial acumen to build models.
Balance: Ability to be strategic, analytical, creative, communicative, and detail-oriented
Embraces team outings with karaoke

As the world's leading sports data and technology company, STATS powers sports. We are trusted by more than 800 clients around the globe to enhance fan engagement and maximize team performance by analyzing sports data from more than 100,000 games a year with unrivaled speed and accuracy. We power sports on and off the field through data feeds, video analysis, sports content and research, player tracking through STATS SportVU®, and customizable digital solutions.

For more information, go to www.stats.com and follow STATS on Twitter @STATS_Insights.
Job Description
Due to the success and growth of our company, we are looking to hire a Head of Global Marketing. In this role, reporting to our Chief Revenue Officer, you'll build and lead a lean, high-impact team across all major marketing disciplines. As the Head of Global Marketing, you and your team will play in integral part in developing STATS' brand, executing an effective demand generation strategy, overseeing all public relations and corporate communications, managing marketing operations and supporting sales enablement through product and solution marketing. In this position, you'll have a global remit covering all major international markets.

We believe that modern marketing is a blend of art and science, with a strong creative approach supported by robust analytics to drive optimized performance. To succeed in this role, you'll need a proven track record leading marketing in a technology-driven environment with an ability to develop and implement a strategy that aligns with the company's short- and long-term objectives.

What You'll Do:

Develop and execute a strategic marketing plan that results in substantial revenue growth for the organization
Build equity in STATS as a global brand through effective storytelling and well-crafted messaging
Enhance demand generation efforts via a comprehensive digital marketing strategy and events, delivering leads and nurturing them through the sales cycle
Weave STATS' narrative into all PR, including communications, press releases, customer newsletters and company announcements, focusing on a world of sports powered by STATS
Improve sales enablement by establishing greater rigor around product- and solution-marketing efforts, including, but not limited to, sales collateral, presentations, customer success stories, competitive analysis, and market research
Optimize marketing operations efforts focusing on tools and utilization, data and metrics, and the overall alignment across the business
Transform the business by establishing STATS as a solution- and customer-focused company
Establish metrics to measure the success of strategic marketing initiatives
Consistently evaluate the ROI on marketing spend and determine ways to improve efficiency and effectiveness
Manage and maintain the annual marketing plan and budget
Skills & Requirements

What You'll Need:

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or related field required; MBA preferred
10+ years' experience managing the strategic development and execution of marketing activities with technology-enabled and data business models (ideally subscription-based); strong preference for someone with international/global marketing experience
Comfort-level working lean, in a fast-paced environment, at a growing company
Expertise in brand strategy and positioning
Proven experience developing lead/demand generation programs for a B2B software companies
Past success leading and supporting new product launches
Experience working with Salesforce.com and marketing automation platforms (i.e., Marketo) required
Knowledge of marketing KPIs and analytics with the ability to make data-driven decisions
Strong leadership, interpersonal and business partnership skills
Ability to work with all levels of internal staff, clients and prospective customers
Experience managing agency and vendor relationships for advertising and PR
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong presentation skills
Exceptional project management, planning and budgeting skills
Ability to create a culture of teamwork by hiring and motivating a successful and high-functioning team
Passion for business and sports
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook and Project)

Who We Are:

The values at STATS mirror those of foundationally great teams and franchises. Our objective is to win through effort, creativity, team-work and positive energy. Specifically, we look for candidates that embody the following: Be All-In, Put the Fan at the Center, Get Stuff Done, It's Your Team, Make an Impact, and Fearless Integrity. We want employees that crave responsibility, accountability and want to have fun working in a collaborative, Get Stuff Done environment.
Put Fan at the Center: You enjoy working with customers and have the strong communication skills to make those interactions a success.
It's Your Team: You embrace others' ideas (even if they conflict with your own) for the sake of the company and customer. You are a collaborator and relationship builder.
Get Stuff Done: You are driven and your can-do attitude inspires others to elevate their performance in a fast-moving environment.
Make an Impact: You thrive in a fast-paced, changing environment and you're excited by the chance to play a large role.
Be All-In: You must be passionate about what you do and about our customers' success.
Fearless Integrity: You are self-motivated and capable of holding both yourself and others accountable to deliver on multiple tasks.

STATS provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

At Capital One, we're building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.

Manager of Performance Marketing

Capital One is seeking a talented Manager of Performance Marketing to join the Card Partnerships Marketing team in Chicago, IL.

The Manager of Performance Marketing will be responsible for developing and executing customer acquisition and retention strategies for the Card Partnership business. The successful candidate will evangelize customer-centric, digital-first best practices in developing, managing and continually optimizing retail card marketing programs.

The ideal candidate will be able to get into the details while providing day-to-day strategic marketing expertise to a retail partner. She/he will have a strong background in data-driven marketing and will develop and execute comprehensive lifecycle programs to drive acquisition, retention, and growth by partner and by customer segment.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Lead marketing strategy to acquire and retain customers for a retail card partnership

• Track, analyze, and inform internal and partner teams of all key customer KPIs and qualitative feedback and present regular action-driven plans to impact those drivers.

• Manage all aspects of direct-to-consumer marketing including creative development, routings, execution and budget management.

• Refine and leverage consumer data and insights to make well informed, ROI driven decisions

• Own testing design marketing campaigns

ACQUISITION

• Conceptualize innovative marketing programs focused specifically on customer acquisition, through a balance of keen analytics, subject matter expertise and creativity.

• Develop and execute customer acquisition strategies across multiple paid, owned, earned and shared channels by the partner and by Capital One

• Identify and execute new customer acquisition tactics and platforms

RETENTION

• Leverage data to develop thorough understanding of the omni-channel retail customer

• Execute against strategic recommendations on how to further engage the customer into higher spend and retention

• Create lifecycle programs that drive cohort-level conversion and spend-by-customer metrics.

Basic Qualifications:

- At least 7 years of experience in direct to consumer marketing

- At least 3 years in digital marketing

- At least 2 years experience working with external clients or partners

- At least 1 year experience working with modern marketing platforms (Adobe, Salesforce, etc)

Preferred Qualifications:

- Retail industry experience

- Financial services experience

- Experience working with loyalty programs

At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Welcome!Got a taste for something new?
We’re Grubhub, the nation’s leading online and mobile food ordering company. Since 2004 we’ve been connecting hungry diners to the local restaurants they love. We’re moving eating forward with no signs of slowing down.

 GrubHub is looking for a Associate of Marketing Partnerships to support the development and implementation of enterprise partnerships and co-marketing opportunities. Reporting into our Sr. Manager of Partnerships, this individual will be responsible for all stages of co-marketing with our enterprise restaurant partners including: creating marketing programs that drive more business for the restaurants, selling in the proposed campaigns internally and to the restaurant partners, negotiating with restaurant partners for inclusion in their marketing and media and supporting expanding existing relationships through marketing. This individual will also be required to work with stakeholders across Grubhub’s different departments and teams and will be responsible for driving growth through these efforts to support the business objectives of Grubhub.

Create co-marketing proposals based on restaurant and Grubhub data and trends, as well as market and business needs. Effectively communicate those needs to both internal and external teams

Interact with different management levels both internally and externally. Collaborate effectively with CRM, PR, B2B, sales, account managers and product marketing teams to create integrated programs that support multiple business and restaurant objectives
Support enterprise account managers to expand current restaurant relationships and help sell in new restaurant partners with marketing
Streamline enterprise account manager requests to appropriate marketing lead
Execute Grubhub activations at various restaurant and industry conferences
Face challenges with optimism and strive for innovation and excellence in everything you do

2-3 years of experience in partnership management, business development, advertising account management and/or marketing
Excellent negotiation, communications, organization, data/measurement and team-work
Cross-functional project management skills and experience working with creative teams
Proven success executing end-to-end marketing campaigns including managing project timelines and implementations
Strong presentation and deck development skills
Proactive approach and enthusiasm to problem identification and solving
Able to evaluate a situation through restaurant partners’ perspective
Detail oriented, creative thinker and efficiency-minded – balancing strategy with operational requirement
 Got These?  Even Better:
 Experience working with digital and/or e-commerce brands
Previous work in agency, marketing partnership and/or restaurant marketing
Event and vendor/production experience

Job Description

True Value Company, a global wholesaler serving retail locations in 60 countries, has an immediate need for a Marketing Analytics Consultant. You will play a meaningful role in helping to create and execute data campaigns to analyze customer data for our new digital marketing program. Being an expert in statistics, including conducting quantitative analysis on large data sets, and having a strong understanding of how that data applies to the marketing team are critical in the success of this role. Are you ready to help apply innovative and technical quantitative analysis to drive critical business results?

Join the True Value Marketing Analytics team and assist in bridging the gap between mountains of data and actionable digital marketing programs. As a marketing analytics consultant, you can make an immediate impact by having strong quantitative and programming-based statistical skills, a polished business acumen, and an ability to tell stories with data. The Marketing Analytics team is a small, highly leveraged team in the organization where you can continue to learn, get strong exposure to the business, and work with cutting edge customer data practices.

Joining True Value Offers a Culture That
Embraces personal and professional growth
Recognizes diverse perspectives
Provides competitive compensation while balancing your work-life needs

Your Value = Our Value. True Value.

Position Description

Adventure On And Check Out The Daily Responsibilities Expected

Testing and analysis at both customer and store levels for all CRM and loyalty marketing efforts including test design, implementation and evaluation. Helps to determine and establish core CRM metrics methodology, reporting and analysis infrastructure including integration and possibly automation within existing and future third party CRM applications. This includes translation of business requirements and development of all relevant technical requirements for any associated software enhancements.

Develops, validates, executes and evaluates tactical CRM-related modeling regarding audience, offer, cadence, messaging, content, product trigger-based targeting including predictive modeling. Works with third party analytic and reporting technology vendor(s).

Partners with Insights team to create and translate through statistical modeling practices and integrate relevant existing and future strategic customer segmentations within customer loyalty program data. Also leads methodology and development of all customer transaction data-oriented strategic modeling for Marketing purposes.

Collaborates on the methodology development, reporting design and potential automation at both co-op and store/member level customer key performance indicators and customer life-cycle management analysis.

Position Qualifications

Minimum Type and Years of Related Experience:
Five to seven years of related experience required
Customer, Marketing, or Retail data experience required
Programming proficiency in at least one statistical software package: SAS/Base and SAS/Stat, (ability to write SAS macros preferred) or SPSS
Experience in applied statistical techniques: correspondence and cluster analysis, logit model estimation, regression modeling, classification and regression trees, CHAID and confirmatory factor analysis
Experience in attrition/ retention modeling, survival analysis methods, and time series analysis is preferred
Ability to assume a wide range of analytic tasks including program measurement, customer segmentation, database analysis and more sophisticated modeling techniques; Ability to write programs to process and manipulate data
SQL and SAS proficiency
Minimum Education Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing or related quantitative field required or equivalent work experience
Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing or related quantitative field highly preferred

About Convene
At Convene, we’re changing the way the world works by transforming the way businesses work. By partnering with the largest landlords in commercial real estate, we design and service the next generation office building – one that feels more like a full-service, lifestyle hotel. Our integrated “workplace-as-a-service” platform gives building tenants and enterprise clients access to a growing network of premium meeting and event spaces, flexible workspaces, hospitality services, and curated experiences for users, all connected by Convene’s proprietary technology platform. Founded in 2009, Convene has locations in New York City, Boston, Philadelphia, and Washington, D.C., with plans to expand globally. The company has been named one of America’s 100 Most Promising Companies by Forbes, one of America’s fastest growing companies by Inc. Magazine, and the #11 Best Workplace in New York by Fortune Magazine.
Position Summary
Come and help build Convene’s brand with our powerhouse marketing team!  This is a rare opportunity to be at the pivotal point of a growth stage company where will you be able to intimately shape the company’s national growth.
In this role, s/he will be supporting the company’s growth and brand awareness efforts for the Mid-West, starting with Chicago. S/he will be responsible for both implementing and refining our regional marketing plan – owning our local brand strategy and demand generation efforts.  S/he will also serve as the primary liaison between the corporate marketing team and the local teams in the region – field sales, operations, human resources, and production.
The ideal candidate is a proven field marketer, and possessing “scale-up” experience in hospitality, technology and/or lifestyle categories. This person has demonstrated expertise with balancing the cross-functional needs of a corporate marketing department while also supporting the day-to-day local/regional marketing requests. S/he takes a data-driven approach to making decisions and incorporating varying points of view from the company’s executive, customers, colleagues, and partners. S/he will also have an endless appetite to learn and innovate in our verticals as well as others, and will be relentlessly improving the way Convene delivers a customer experience journey for our current and future clients. S/he will be comfortable taking initiative, solving problems and thrive in a fast-paced environment where cross-functional collaboration is paramount.
This position is based in Chicago, IL and travel to NYC and other Convene locations may be required from time to time.
Duties & Functions
Work closely with key partners and stakeholders across Marketing, Sales, Operations, Technology, and People & Culture departments to design, develop, and execute a regional marketing plan that supports our corporate goals, educate local teams on regional and national marketing initiatives, and also serving the day-to-day needs and requirements of our regional team.
Develop locally relevant sales and marketing templates & tool kits to systematically support campaigns, collateral, events, and operational needs
Maintain a regional calendar including but not limited to: openings, events, activations, press, collaborations and promotions
Ensure compliance with Convene’s brand guidelines – consistency in visual identity and company messaging across all communication channels and product lines.
Ongoing training and coaching of the field sales team on all brand, business development, and cross-market marketing initiatives
Act as the regional brand ambassador who amplifies our company’s thought leadership, brand awareness, and executive awareness.
Assist with developing and delivering best-in-class marketing campaigns across a variety of channels – website, email, social, PR, print, events – that are ROI positive.
Oversee activities associated with going into new properties and/or markets - pre-launch, openings and post-launch
Source and manage new local partnerships (associations, hotels, experience vendors, local businesses) as well as local freelancers – copywriters, designers, photographers and videographers.
Maintain Convene’s Experience program infrastructure for all properties in the region
Develop and manage budgets, adhere to deadlines and workflow processes, and provide reporting on the region’s progress.
Competencies
5+ years’ progressive work-related experience in field marketing, and/or digital product marketing roles
Experience with managing teams and/or complex marketing projects & campaigns
Proficiency in marketing automation technologies and software (e.g. Eloqua, Marketo, Pardot, Mailchimp), events (e.g. Eventbrite), CRM (e.g. Salesforce), social media (e.g. Sprout Social) and design (Adobe Creative Suite)  
Previous work history within the commercial real estate and/or hospitality industries is a plus
High degree of personal drive and able to pursue own intuition and vision
Excellent problem solver with strong communication (written & verbal) abilities
Strong at tactical delivery with a good eye for detail
Able to effectively apply creative methodologies and thinking within a fast-growth company
Proven project management ability (e.g. external creative agencies, PR firms, freelancers, and partners)
Responsive to demands from multiple stakeholder groups and able to understand and balance consumer, managerial and ownership perspectives

The Field Marketing Manager is responsible for creating and implementing local marketing strategies focused on driving sales, building brand awareness, and ensuring successful new store/market launches. Through innovative and authentic field marketing plans, and a deep understanding of the Outdoor Voices customer, this position will connect to local communities, deliver memorable OV experiences, and drive customer acquisition. We want a people-person who’s able to foster connections within the community – a leader who understands, lives and breathes our culture so that he/she can create and execute experiences that deliver on our brand promise. A love of Recreation is a must. 

Responsibilities:
Develop best-in-class strategies to connect local initiatives to the overall brand message, and ensure a consistent brand experience across all markets.
Execute a local marketing plan as an extension of national seasonal marketing plan, inclusive of events calendar, partnerships, press and budget.
Manage all communication between the field and clubhouse; act as a liaison, ensuring healthy discussions, touch bases and feedback loops.
Work with our creative team to develop collateral, assets and toolkits to support local efforts and marketing needs.
Develop turnkey event and campaign solutions that can be scaled and utilized across a variety of locations or demographics.
Build short- and long-term grassroots marketing plans in partnership with our events and operations teams to drive traffic and sales.
Recommend media and advertising opportunities (OOH, sponsorships, etc.) based on store or market needs.
Understand ROI of efforts; be able to measure success and develop a reporting structure for all online and offline efforts
Identify and build relationships with local businesses, company fitness studios, influencers and media to drive authentic communications.
Work with additional OV recreationalists to support local efforts
Keep a pulse on local competition and reporting back; be the eyes and ears of your market.
Drive loyalty by connecting customers with our brand and the notion of the Doing Things, both in and outside of our store
Qualifications:
2+ years of field marketing or public relations experience
Superior people skills: you believe in recreation and doing things and how to get people to rally around it
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Understanding of general marketing, PR and communications
Enthusiastic and self-motivated team player, with the ability to lead projects proactively
Demonstrated ability in setting and achieving both short- and long-term priorities and goals
Strong knowledge of the local market, with ability to leverage psychographic and demographic data to make decisions
BA/BS required
Must be willing to travel locally and be based out of the retail store
Compensation & Benefits:
Competitive compensation package
OV Benefits include flexible vacation, 75% of health care premiums, dental and vision
The latest OV gear and—of course—Recreation
  About Outdoor Voices:
We believe in Doing Things — moving your body and having fun with friends. From dog jogs to dodgeball, we make clothes for sweating without the added pressure. Our team is made up of casual Recreationalists who approach activity with ease, humor, and delight. Since launching in 2014, Outdoor Voices has been featured in The New York Times, Vogue, Wall Street Journal, GQ, Forbes and Fast Co.

Director of Content Marketing, Epsilon and Conversant
Epsilon and Conversant together represents one of the most innovative marketing companies in the world, comprised of 9000 associates across the globe with a strong, public parent company (Alliance Data - ADS). We have a track record of solid organic growth and strategic acquisitions that have brought together the digital and data-driven marketing services that today's Fortune 50 CMO requires to be successful. We are focused on understanding consumers, connecting consumers to brands and driving growth for our clients.

At a pivotal time with new marketing leadership, Epsilon and Conversant are establishing one integrated, results-driven marketing team, which includes a new content team led by the Director of Content Marketing.

A mix of content marketing, sales support and strategic communications, the ideal candidate is a proficient writer and editor, who understands content, demand generation and inbound marketing. This individual has a passion for 'wowing' vs. simply settling for 'ok and expected.'

This is an entrepreneurial and managerial role in a growing team and will report directly to the Vice President, Strategic Communications.

What You'll Be Responsible for At Epsilon and Conversant:
You'll have the opportunity to build a department and strategic plan from the ground up, including budget management and oversight.
You'll develop compelling written and visual content aligned to business objectives and designed to elevate internal and external visibility of the Epsilon and Conversant brands.
You'll create an approach to write, edit, source, develop and amplify a stream of thought leadership content, including video - proactively driving strategy and the formation of cross-organization relationships to accomplish goals.
You'll collaborate with colleagues to develop and drive strategic content communications plans including the development, process, implementation and measurement of the Epsilon and Conversant content calendar.
You will own development and content creation for client-facing newsletters, blogs, white papers, webinars, research reports, infographics, case studies, social media content, advertorials and more.
You will manage an internal team of content specialists and tap into external freelancers; while working closely with a talented team of internal creative staff.


Let's Talk About Who You Are:
You are located in Chicago.
You are a natural storyteller with a passion for technology, digital marketing, data, innovation and start-up culture.

The Opportunity:
An opportunity has arisen for a Manager, Growth Marketing to lead the Americas trading and performance monitoring team. In partnership with other regional and cross-functional leaders, you will be accountable to drive growth and return-on-investment for all performance channels in our North and South American markets. Working with a high degree of autonomy, you will build and develop a team of Analysts to oversee the performance of our growth marketing channels.
A background and experience in digital marketing and analytics is required, along with a technical expertise of performance marketing channels and e-commerce environments. You should also be keenly customer-centric, curious by nature and able to collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, marketing, finance, and product).

Job Description
Digital Strategist, Ecosystem Marketing

You're a multichannel platform marketer and innovator. You know all the channels - digital, email, marketing automation, lead nurturing, paid media, SEO, events, print - you name it. So, let's talk about what you'll do. In the IBM Global Business Partner organization, you'll help to lead marketing transformation through digital engagement, visual strength and placement of our narrative and stories, expansion of our offering reach and scale, and helping to reimagine the brand of the IBM ecosystem.

About us!
Well, we think partners are pretty cool. Our team helps to make sure our offerings and programs are just what they need. We are changing the way IBM does marketing to one of our greatest assets, our Business Partner community. Our partners need to be armed with the most forward-looking technologies, resources and incentives to reach their clients. That is what we do.

What we do for our partners and their client's, we're doing consistently for ourselves: reinventing, learning what it takes to stay ahead of technological shifts and building what comes next. We're good at change because we've never been afraid of it. Change is part of our DNA, it's what drives us. If you have been wanting to be part of something great, the ecosystem is where it's at.

About You!
If you live and breathe digital marketing, we want to talk to you! We are looking for a Digital Strategist to develop, implement, track and optimize our digital marketing campaigns across all relevant digital channels (web, social, paid media, nurture, email, events, video, etc.). You should have a strong grasp of current marketing tools and strategies and be able to lead integrated digital marketing campaigns from concept to execution.
You will also play a key consultative role in drawing the audience in through compelling and impactful visual and design. For essential branding and digital assets, you'll maintain production oversight to ensure creative developed is aligned to our goals and provides a seamless experience.
You will be an integral member of a small squad of individuals with a common goal to increase our demand generation and progression through partners with a focus on the co-marketing and digital content marketing offerings and campaigns. The new WW ecosystem performance marketing team will consist of campaign, digital and content marketing individuals. In this role you will also collaborate extensively with WW business unit marketing, communication, and the geography partner-facing performance marketing teams.
This Digital Strategist role requires translating client/partner goals, objectives and business KPIs (digital funnel metrics that lead to validated lead revenue created and win revenue) into actionable strategy and is crucial to ensuring the success of digital campaign delivery and performance. Given your strength in user experience and visual design, you will play an important role as we transform our identity and partner user experiences. It requires self-motivation, enthusiasm, resilience, flexibility and the ability to communicate clearly and effectively. The position also requires an analytical and logical thinker with the conviction to meet problems head-on and solve them accurately and quickly.

Responsibilities
Serves as the performance marketing team member that focuses on digital marketing strategy and tactics through marketing offerings, platforms and campaigns that IBM and our agencies execute with Business Partners.
Contribute & evolve the business strategy including: assessing the opportunity, audience segmentation, offering alignment, marketing channel selection, and management system and KPIs.
Develop & manage digital strategy, including responsibility to influence and create content, social, and campaign execution strategies working with extended team members in the geos and on the GBP business unit marketing teams.
Lead digital and design initiatives with marketing vendor and agencies, internal and external.
Own KPIs and drive to funnel targets that increase offering engagement, validated lead creation and win revenue targets for each campaign or marketing offering.
Guide paid media / paid social for maximum effectiveness to drive traffic and engagement.
Responsible for continuous optimization of tactics through curiosity, hypothesis, A/B and multi-variate testing, and optimizing. This role will use Lotame, Optimizely, Hotjar, Pearl, and other key tools to drive digital success.
Guide the user experience including branding, design, campaign landing pages development and implementation.
Create and execute offerings / experiences that are innovative and represent a new way for IBM to show up with Business Partners.
Work across WW and geography channel marketing team members to ensure initiatives are brand-aligned, seamless and in focused on increasing participation and engagement rates.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

At least 5 years of experience as a Digital Strategist, User Experience Designer or any other role which involves strategizing and architecting user experience for high-traffic, complex digital campaigns & properties
Strong project management and organizational skills
Deep knowledge of digital technologies and demonstrated experience building and leading multiple digital media campaigns simultaneously
Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns
Experience in optimizing landing pages and user funnels, A/B and multivariate experiments and keyword discovery
Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking
Strong knowledge of user-centered design
Clear understanding of search engine marketing and applying SEO best practices
Ability to articulate and present ideas based on insights, sound user experience and interaction design principles
Maniacal about testing, measuring results and optimizing for continuous improvement


Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

None
