Job Description
IBM Systems leads in transformation. We power the most critical industries on the planet - from finance to telecommunications to scientific research. Our portfolio features the legendary Z mainframe, new AI-enabling servers, and Gartner-ranked best-in-class Flash and Software Defined Storage - everything it takes to build the next-generation IT infrastructure that can think, learn, predict, and compete in the cognitive era.

You have a passion for data - measuring success, finding insights, and helping teams create high-impact campaigns. At IBM Systems, you'll invent things. A new way to tell a story. A smarter strategy. Better ways of working. And, you'll be part of a top-performing organization that has fun, learns from failures, and innovates every day.

About Your Role
As a member of the Systems Marketing Analytics team, you will play a critical role in helping us achieve our mission: to foster a culture of data-driven decision making across Systems Marketing by providing reporting, analysis, and insights that enable team members to optimize campaign results and increase marketing ROI.
Responsibilities
Track and measure the overall performance of worldwide marketing campaigns against revenue for one of IBM Systems flagship brands
Track and measure the performance of online and offline marketing tactics for each campaign, including search engine and display advertising, paid media, email marketing, Web-based content, gated assets, and events
Provide product launch reporting in line with standard cadence to help determine efficacy and highlight areas for improvement
Deliver data-driven insights and recommendations to stakeholders, including campaign and content strategists, portfolio marketers, and event managers
Enable performance marketing team members to effectively utilize IBM tools and reporting dashboards to interpret data and optimize campaign results
Where appropriate, create customized reports to supplement corporate tools and look for opportunities to streamline/automate current processes
Work with campaign managers to troubleshoot brand and campaign performance issues and investigate data anomalies/outliers
Serve as liaison between Systems Marketing and corporate analytics team
Build relationships with partner orgs, including geo marketing, marketing ops, and other BU Analytics teams, to improve reporting quality and completeness
Provide inputs for weekly executive summary and support ad hoc executive reporting requests
#mktngSRjobs

5-7 years of experience in marketing, campaign, and digital analytics, including experience measuring campaign performance
Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills
Ability to manipulate and visualize data using industry-standard tools such as Excel or Tableau
Ability to parse and evaluate large data sets, distill findings into actionable insights, and clearly communicate these insights to marketing stakeholders
Ability to synthesize input from multiple stakeholders with diverse requirements to develop a cohesive point of view
Self directed with strong planning, communication, and leadership skills


Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

Experience using internal IBM tools and platforms, or have the ability to come up to speed quickly on new technologies

Experience using SQL or other query tools

Strong project management skills.

Kasasa employees are dedicated to helping community banks and credit unions compete and win. Like the Spartans in the Battle of Thermopylae, we stand together and inspire others to join us in our mission. Stronger together and united by core values, we are more than a team: We are a phalanx.

Summary of Purpose
The Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for supporting and adding value to the Digital B2C Team through planning, placing, executing, managing and measuring digital marketing programs across multiple channel tactics such as search, social, programmatic and streaming media as well as creative input. The DMS is responsible to both internal and external stakeholders while embodying the Kasasa Patch Values.

Essential Functions
Infuse the Patch Values into your work ethic, every day and every interaction.
Act as a floater and assist marketing program owners across all marketing channels (i.e. Digital Display, Video, Streaming, Social Media, Paid Search, and Marketing Automation)
Responsible for setting up, updating and maintaining current and new digital campaigns across multiple channels.
Develop financial forecasts and budget recommendations for new programs
Analytics, including placing pixels, tracking conversions, and evaluating content marketing ROI
Identify underperforming digital campaigns and opportunities for improvement and work cross-functionally to improve results
Stay up-to-date on best practices and research industry landscape to identify new opportunities and provide updates to team
Assist in strategic thinking and A/B test plan development to optimize digital channel performance
Support Digital Marketing Team with weekly/monthly/ad hoc channel/campaign reporting and decks
Assist in the implementation of segmentation, using testing and targeting to maximize acquisition and conversion
Devise new ways to market our products and craft engaging content
Work closely with our creative team to generate creative ideas on design & layouts
Build processes around how metrics are pulled and analyzed in an automated manner
Develop necessary materials and resources to educate and promote both internally and externally: creative briefs, process documents, performance tracking requirements, client-facing documents, and internal-facing documents.
Monitoring and managing JIRA boards/tickets
Other duties as assigned


Position Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Marketing, Business or related field from a four-year college or university; 1-2 years related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Fundamental understanding of marketing and the marketing funnel
Base knowledge in key areas of digital marketing (SEM, Social Media, Display Media, Streaming Audio, Content Marketing, and email marketing)
Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform and motivate
Evaluates problems and generates options to find actionable, practical solutions by thinking innovatively
Proactive and proficient at noting things that need to be done without being prompted and managing up as necessary
Can be flexible and open to changing priorities and managing multiple tasks simultaneously
Ambitious, self-motivated with a passion for learning and acquiring new skills
Strong computer skills, particularly in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). CRM & PM Software
Experience creating media plans and implementing marketing strategy a plus
Google AdWords, Google Analytics and Facebook certifications is a plus
Experience with Google Tag Manager a plus
Must be legally allowed to work in the U.S.


Physical Requirements
Sitting for extended periods of time; approximately 5-6 hours per day
Simultaneous use of hand, wrist and fingers
Daily operation of standard office equipment
Frequent use of oral communication to perform work
Lifts and moves up to 20 pounds occasionally

Are you looking for a growth opportunity for a reputable company with a positive work environment? Our client, is looking for a Channel Marketing Manager to join their team in Austin, TX. Please contact us today to discuss this opportunity!

Job Duties:

Deliver key account marketing plans which return profit, and fit within agreed marketing spending levels
Develop and implement best-in-class launch activity for your accounts, in coordinaton with the sales directors
Ensure timely creation and deployment of launch assets to customers for launch
Optimize ATL placements and develop new and innovative ways to amplify BTL messages
Plan, manage, and execute customer trade shows from start to finish, ultimately being the main point of contact for internal and external stakeholders

Requirements:

Minimum of 5 years' experience in marketing
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, or related field
Proven track record of executing channel campaigns across different geographic territories
Experience working with channel partners in both a B2C and B2B environment
Highly proactive and dynamic in approach, as well as ability to work in a very fast tech environment

Capterra, Software Advice, and GetApp are in the Digital Markets business unit within Gartner.  We help small businesses find the software solutions they need to grow and succeed. Gartner Digital Markets offers the excitement of working for a start-up, balanced with the resources of an established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation.

The ideal candidate will enjoy working in a fast-paced but highly collaborative environment with white space opportunity to make an impact. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with A+ colleagues and work directly with leaders at every level. You also subscribe to our philosophy of ‘Team first, always’. 

This position reports to the Manager, Marketing Analytics. You will help lead digital marketing analysis and reporting efforts to guide and advance marketing initiatives and strategies for Gartner Digital Markets. You will collaborate closely with other stakeholders to build reports, dashboards, and new KPIs to measure business health. You will also oversee data management processes, controls, and remediation processes. In an analytic capacity, this position will leverage data from a variety of disparate sources to deliver actionable insight for business decision making and monitoring. 

Primary Responsibilities:

Develop quantitative analyses, build dashboards, and support both recurring and ad hoc reporting to provide insight into performance of marketing channels and identify opportunities for improvement. 

Work with engineering teams to resolve data issues that impact data accuracy, and ensure data infrastructure exists to provide purpose and quality to end users. 

Assist with the automation of reporting, currently maintained by both the analytics team as well as reporting owned by stakeholders across a variety of teams within the marketing organization.

Support the implementation of data management processes and controls.

Manage data error reporting and remediation processes. Lead the effort to implement exception reporting, and ensure the right checks and balances are in place to promote accurate reporting. 

Partner with internal customers (marketing, engineering, finance) to plan, develop, and execute analyses that lead to actionable insights and new business opportunities.  

Extract and manipulate data from multiple data sources including customer, marketing, and transactional databases to create integrated views that give analyses a holistic perspective. 

Produce recommendations for changes and improvements to business systems and processes to ensure analytical insights can be achieved.

Identify meaningful trends or patterns that impact strategic decisions and future marketing investments and regularly share results with marketing stakeholders.

Design targeting and testing structures to support marketing learning objectives, while ensuring results will be statistically sound and can be scaled out to a larger audience.


Job Requirements:

Who You Are:
You’re curious – you’re always trying to understand the “why”, and you’re confident in wrestling the underlying data in order to get there.
You’re flexible – you understand priorities change, requiring you to shift focus when needed, while also working on multiple projects in parallel.
You’re collaborative and you genuinely like working with people – you thrive in environments where you can partner and work closely with a variety of teams in many different locations.
You’re positive – you love data and you understand it can sometimes be defeating, but that doesn’t keep you from staying positive and enthusiastic day in and day out.
You are an effective communicator - you possess the verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills that are essential to translating quant-based analyses into digestible, actionable insights.

Technical/Functional Qualifications:
Bachelor or MS in quantitative marketing or a related field with a strong interest in digital marketing, and 2-4 years related experience
Proficiency with table creation and querying using SQL
Proficiency with generating big data visualization using Tableau or Microsoft Power BI
Proficiency with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Omniture, Coremetrics
Comfortable working with all Microsoft applications
PPC platform experience a plus (AdWords and Bing)
Brings a highly creative approach to quantitative analysis and problem solving and is able to comfortably think outside the traditional methodologies to analyze data and render findings
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to problem solving
Strong understanding of relational databases
Exceptional analytical skills. Ability to draw conclusions and actionable recommendations based on insights derived from analysis, while presenting results with easily understood and meaningful charts and tables.
Must be able to make intelligent business decisions in a timely manner, while working under tight deadlines on multiple projects and be comfortable working with data derived from a variety of data sources.
Attention to details, while able to also grasp the larger picture
Prioritize, provide deadlines, and define the most efficient approach to a requested analysis
Ability to learn quickly and utilize new tools for data exploration and analysis

SUMMARY OF PURPOSE
The Regional Manager, Client Marketing role is a marketing consulting and support management position that oversees the strategic direction of our Kasasa product delivery. The role manages a team of Marketing consultants. The manager is operationally focused and directly client-facing. The position requires expertise across multiple marketing channels and the ability to consult on the principles, strategies, and best practices associated with their execution and optimization in addition to managing the day to day operations of the team while embodying the Patch Values.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Infuse the Patch Values into your work ethic, every day and every interaction
Proactively coach/develop Client Marketing Managers abilities and ensure the team delivers service resulting in high levels of customer satisfaction, customer program adoption, and program success
Demonstrate model behavior that is representative of Kasasa values
Day to day supervision and management of Kasasa marketing program delivery including but not limited to: Budget management/reconciliation, quarterly program optimization, program presentations, program adoption, general consulting practices
Manage and influence client conversations, deliver exceptional service, and create mutually beneficial outcomes
Design/develop/implement systems that pro-actively analyze performance of marketing programs against client goals, and make adjustments to achieve highest ROI
Create a true partnership (instead of vendor) relationship with all clients
Create "raving fans" of Client Marketing Managers and Kasasa
Operate as executive level Client Marketing Manager within strategic accounts when appropriate
Advise on best practices of web design, usability, and ongoing support of client websites
Develop and maintain expertise in any existing or future Kasasa programs
Regular review of program analytics and review metrics and corrective action with clients.
Manage projects from beginning to end
Oversee systems that track program adoption, performance, and satisfaction levels across entire portfolio
Oversee systems that create alignment and manage timelines, tasks, and communications across several internal and external teams: Designers, Copywriters, Launch and Support teams, media agencies, and various program partners
Maintain forecasting reports and provide insights that build on business goals
Establish, monitor, and adjust processes, performance metrics, and staffing ratios for Client Marketing Managers and their resources.
Interpret, negotiate, and execute on contracts
Oversee execution of entire Kasasa portfolio and manage to revenue goals
Other duties as assigned

POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent years of work experience.
5-7 years in client-facing account management
2+ years leading client-facing teams
Extremely high level of professionalism
Highly competent presentation skills
Ownership of results: accountability and "know how" for getting things done
Flexibility and adaptability in responding to rapid change
Strong problem analysis and resolution skills, with an ability to develop and implement solutions that benefit both the client and Kasasa
Leadership - ability to work and exercise influence cross functionally
Marketing expertise including but not limited to: Online (digital, social, web, interactive), Traditional (radio, print, out of home, TV), Email, Direct Mail, Creative, Promotions and events, Budgets
Willingness to develop super-user expertise in all internal applications including but not limited to our Customer Relationship Management system (SugarCRM), workflow management system (JIRA), marketing enablement tool (Balihoo), and knowledge management system (MindQuilt and JIRA)
Must be legally allowed to work in the U.S.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Sitting for extended periods of time; approximately 5-6 hours per day
Simultaneous use of hand, wrist and fingers
Daily operation of standard office equipment
Frequent use of oral communication to perform work
Lifts and moves up to 20 pounds occasionally

Procore is seeking an Sr. Marketing Events Specialist to join our Marketing team at our Austin office. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work with a power-house marketing team and across departments to ensure the success of marketing campaigns, regional events, and trade shows. As part of the events team, this role will work directly with regional marketing.
Candidates must thrive in a fast-paced environment, often juggling multiple events simultaneously, managing remote events and working with remote employees.
The position requires up to 25%travel. 
What you'll do:
Plan and execute all trade shows, roadshows and regional events in your assigned region.
Utilize project management software to manage event timelines and ensure all event deadlines are met
Travel to select events for day of logistical support for trade shows, roadshows, and regional events
Develop and produce campaign strategies with the Regional Marketing team.
Create systems and processes to streamline workflow within event planning process
Develop strategies to hit target engagement numbers, vet new shows/partnerships, and ROI tracking
Work within event budget for sponsorships and production costs
Create website content, presentation content development, email strategies for attendee recruitment/retention
Sponsorship and contract negotiations, post-show analysis
Target new/untapped markets, develops new trade show campaigns to drive engagements
Collaborate with other departments to align events with global marketing campaigns
Collaborate with demand gen, marketing ops, and comms teams to drive awareness and attendance to events
Oversee event logistics including booth design, staffing and scheduling, budget tracking, and deliverables
Support the conference and internal event teams on select events
What we're looking for:
4+ years in event coordination or relevant industry experience required
Excellent organization, communication and collaboration skills
Ability to manage multiple projects and work assignments
Fantastic customer service ethics and high expectations for quality.
Proficient using the latest versions of Microsoft Office, Google Applications, event management software user experience preferred
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent 
About Us
Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore. Our headquarters is located on the bluffs above the Pacific Ocean in Carpinteria, CA, with growing offices worldwide including Austin, TX. To learn more about our team, click here.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Perks & Benefits
You are a person with dreams, goals, and ambitions—both personally and professionally. That's why we believe in providing benefits that not only match our Procore values (Openness, Optimism, and Ownership) but enhance the lives of our team members. Here are just a few of our benefit offerings: competitive health care plans, unlimited paid vacation, stock options, employee enrichment and development programs, and friends & family events.

We’re WorldFirst, experts in moving money around the world. As a fast growing FinTech business, we specialise in making foreign exchange simple, fast and fuss-free for people and businesses with global ambitions. By combining best in-class technology with award-winning customer service, we’ve helped over 120,000 people, small businesses and online sellers transfer over £60bn since we launched in 2004.
Purpose:
WorldFirst is seeking a growth marketer that is passionate about the science and art of marketing. The Email Marketing Associate will be responsible for the automation marketing delivery for World First USA, while supporting the needs of the entire customer journey. This position will support our integrated media strategy through various marketing channels: email campaigns, lead generation, referral programs, event support, and funnel management, with ownership of marketing automation platform utilization and adaptation. In addition to automation, this position will also help develop the email program’s forecast goals in association with revenue, traffic, and ROI targets.
Our ideal candidate is a professional who thrives amidst the challenges of a fast-paced environment and possesses a natural bent towards common sense thinking and urgency in delivery. You will have the opportunity to bring your energy, creativity and passion as a growth marketer to a high-performing team, working collaboratively on the planning, definition and delivery message emails to our loyal customer base.
Examples of Key responsibilities:
Be the US authority for email strategy, production, execution, list building, A/B testing, and reporting of B2B and B2C email marketing campaigns.
Own US Marketing Automation process and oversee platform integrations and optimizations, while working with global team to ensure best practices
Work across all departments to analyze results on a daily basis with a goal to maximize revenue, identify opportunities, optimize email campaigns, and troubleshoot issues
Work with Global CRM Administrator to ensure effective data flow and segmentation across automation and CRM platforms
Support acquisition through nurturement, retention, and reactivation programs geared to meet commercial goals
Implement and evaluate processes with the goal to enhance productivity, create new growth opportunities, and increase ROI
Day-to-day monitoring and reporting to assess the health of user acquisition programs
Support overall digital acquisition through tracking code management implemented across multichannel campaigns
Prepare briefs for creative and channel deployment that define campaign objectives, target audiences, messaging, offers, execution timing, and tactics
Maintain program budgets and push to drive efficiencies where applicable
Proactively coordinate with relevant stakeholders and to maximize interaction and effectiveness of email campaigns
Responsible for ensuring compliance, CAN-SPAM regulations and brand guidelines are followed
Maintaining industry knowledge to keep us at the forefront of marketing developments
Key Capabilities:
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or advertising
Experience with email marketing tools and systems, specifically Eloqua and Salesforce
Working knowledge of HTML and email design best practices, including deliverability, segmentation, and frequency
2-4+ years direct marketing experience, preferably with a mixture of B2B and B2C, email, and web-based activities
Exceptional Excel, writing skills and familiarity drafting email campaigns
Skilled at planning, organizing, prioritizing, and executing simultaneous email campaigns
Ability to communicate effectively and productively across various teams, stakeholders and departments
Flexibility to work in a rapidly changing environment and meet tight deadlines
You are optimistic, resourceful, and ready to take on any challenges
Salary and Benefits
Competitive compensation packing including annual discretionary bonus.
Premium benefits including company 401(k) matching, health, dental, vision, & disability benefits, enhanced maternity and shared parental leave policies, & educational sponsorship.
20 days’ vacation, 10 observed federal holidays, 3 life event days during your career with WorldFirst, annual volunteer day, & your birthday day off!
Perks, including; On Your Side awards & recognition, free breakfast (Tacos on Wednesdays!), Friday drinks fridge, intramural teams, corporate discounts, gym discounts, bi-annual company parties – and more.

Description:

The Software Product Manager provides marketing leadership to develop differentiated and compelling software solutions for the Commercial PC product portfolio. This position will be instrumental in the development and management of key software experiences that align with the overall Commercial PC strategy and help the organization maintain industry leadership and achieve aggressive growth targets.

This position reports to the Manager of Software Product Marketing in the Commercial PC organization in the Personal Systems business unit.

The position is based in Houston, Texas.

Develops a thorough knowledge of the SMB & enterprise software marketplace through primary and syndicated research, accumulation of market trend data, and analysis of customer, competitor and product trends.
Evaluates business opportunities with key industry partners and ISVs.
Provides guidance to product planning on the changes in the PC software market ecosystem, user needs, pain points, & competitive trend assessments, and leads integration of the technology, use cases, and product feature requirement definition into the overall software solution roadmap.
Acts as end-to-end product owner for key software deliverables.
Derives customer-facing marketing communication and participates in various go-to-market activities.


Roles and Responsibilities:

The Software Product Manager position is responsible for the development and management of new software initiatives and business opportunities. The emphasis of the role will be to work with cross-functional teams in the planning, evaluation, development, implementation, and marketing of software preinstalled on Commercial PC products.

Conduct market research to determine emerging industry trends, markets, and product categories, as well as develop a thorough knowledge of the SMB & enterprise software landscape.
Understand customer pain points and key usage model trends through customer insights, primary and syndicated research, and analysis of customer, competitor, and product trends
Identify and evaluate business opportunities with industry partners and ISVs
Implement customer and market insights into actionable business and product requirements
Work with strategic partners to address key technology integration into software solutions
Communicate strategic initiatives and business plan/ROI to extended team and upper management
Own the software product lifecycle from concept through production release and end-of-life


Qualifications:
Proven record of success in product marketing management, as well as functional experience in technology planning, business development, and project management
Ability to evaluate general computing and usage model trends, market & competitive landscape, and generate strategy recommendations
In-depth knowledge of marketing elements (product, pricing, promotion and positioning)
Team-oriented self-starter able to work and partner with different personalities and professional styles
Customer-centric focus with the ability to communicate, strategize, plan, and prioritize while seeing through the eyes of the customer
Excellent communicator with strong influencing and presentation skills
Passion for technology and good knowledge of life cycle for technology products
Excellent organization skills with an attention to detail


Candidate Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in technical or business field (MBA strongly preferred)
Minimum 5 to 7 years product management experience
Experience in technology industry (PC and software experience preferred)
Excellent writing, time management, and interpersonal skills
Good presentation skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office
Fluent in English

The Commercial Desktop business is a fast-paced, dynamic business that is continuing to evolve and grow within HP. As a Commercial Desktop Planning Manager, you will be responsible for driving business growth by understanding key customer trends and requirements and creating the right product definition to meet those requirements. The role will require managing deliverables through the product planning lifecycle - from concept planning through product planning definition closure, while driving a smooth transition to product launch and end-of-life execution and transition.

Within the Commercial Desktop Planning team, the specific responsibilities include:
Gathering and understanding key customer insights
Performing analysis of technology and market trends while developing a market growth opportunity analysis within the industry
Lead ideation sessions within the group to generate ideas of how to solve customer problems within the Commercial Desktop All-in-One segment
Collaborating with other product managers across different businesses to create complete product solutions.
Document required features and lead feature trade-decisions based on product vision, customer needs, market trends and technology capabilities
Creating and managing effective content and processes for product positioning and messaging for regional partners, sales force and channel partners
Working in partnership with downstream product management teams to ensure we have a strong story and strategy for Go-to-market and external launch messaging and positioning

HP delivers the world's most secure and manageable PCs used by governments, defense organizations and international corporations. Today's IT threats strike businesses from many places and from all angles. Security must cover every entry point with multiple layers of protection. To stay competitive, businesses need security solutions that are simple to deploy, manage, and customize, while also being easy to use.

The Role:

To continue and expand HP's leadership in the market as the "most secure and manageable PC", this role is for a highly-skilled, multi-faceted director-level security product and strategy manager who will be responsible for the Commercial PC security portfolio within the Product Marketing organization.

This includes providing leadership for a team that will define the product portfolio, taking input from regions, the competitive view, the market, and key partners (such as Microsoft, Intel etc).

As a Director in the Product Marketing organization, you will lead a team that defines product specifications and strategy, as well as build a security assessment practice from scratch.

What you will work on:
Build a world-class team of security product management.
Build a security assessment practice from scratch; includes setting up the practice, hiring talent, building processes, doing sells-in, and building a funnel of potential assessments.
Manage a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the security strategy and product management for Commercial PCs but by adjacencies, for all of Personal Systems (PS)
Interact internally and externally with executive leaders to provide guidance on strategic security choices
Work tightly with engineering to deliver on security roadmap, making the necessary trade-offs and timelines for delivery of the portfolio
Envision and communicate product strategy and functionality.
Initiate and foster relationships with other functional and business groups (internal and external)
Direct and ensure the curation and implementation of strategy through subordinate managers and senior individual contributors.
Work in cross-functional teams and provide input on security strategy across other business groups (eg Commercial Personal Systems, Workstations etc)
Work with worldwide marketing to build GTM strategies for security product launches.
Work across partner ecosystem to find/develop strategic partnerships with security product vendors.


Who we are looking for:
Functional expertise and broad market knowledge is critical.
Demonstrated leadership and people management skills.
Strong communication skills, analytical skills, and thorough understanding of product development and product management.
BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 10 or more years of security product management or related experience preferred.

A Career at Rheem: Where Comfort Is Your Calling

At Rheem, we're dedicated to bringing comfort to people's lives. And, as a leading global manufacturer of heating, cooling and water heating equipment, we're innovating all-new ways to deliver just the right temperature while saving energy, water and supporting a more sustainable future. It's an exciting challenge that requires a team of talented, passionate people with a diverse set of skills. From engineers to accountants, sales professionals to support experts, Rheem depends on people to power our innovations. Join Rheem, and help shape the future of products that impact people's lives-every day.

This exciting Manager, Marketing role leads the design and production of product marketing and communicates to customers, builders, service companies, installers, employees, consumers (web site) and trade press. Supports product management activities including product/market requirements, strategic marketing, and go-to-market plans.

This position will serve Rheem's Water Heater Division in Roswell, GA.

Manhattan designs, builds and delivers market-leading Supply Chain Commerce solutions for its customers around the world. We help drive the commerce revolution with unmatched insight and unrivaled technology, connecting front-end revenue and relationships with back-end execution and efficiency-optimized on a common technology platform. This platform-based approach is enabling leading companies across the globe to get closer to their customers and achieve real-world results.
JOB SUMMARY
The Director, Global Marketing Programs position requires more than just the ability to execute against existing and traditional campaigns models. This role will be responsible for the total life-cycle of strategic marketing campaigns-collaborating with stakeholders to identify new opportunities, developing strategies, designing programs, and then executing, measuring, and evaluating them against agreed upon business goals and objectives. Develop industry and solution-level marketing programs and collaborate on demand generation activities to increase awareness of Manhattan's solutions in the market and ultimately increase market share within Manhattan's priority industry verticals.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
10 + years of experience within marketing programs, building and managing digital marketing programs and operations, preferably in Supply Chain Management solutions.
7 + years leading a team of communications and/or marketing professionals. Selects, develops and evaluates team to ensure the efficient operation of the function.
Experience with marketing automation software, preferably Marketo, and CRM platforms (SFDC) and other business critical marketing applications.
Demonstrated track record in driving product revenue through marketing execution and industry thought leadership, preferably to a global customer base.
Business oriented strategic thinker with an ability to implement and make sound decisions quickly and efficiently.
Must be an excellent team player who is dependable, confident, committed, flexible, innovative, and detail-oriented.
Proven track record of successful campaign development and execution, preferably in a B2B environment
Thorough understanding of online, offline, and direct marketing principles and practices
Demonstrated ability to influence stakeholders outside of immediate team - sales, leadership, regional teams and other functions within Marketing.
Experience working with cross-functional teams.
Ability to easily interact with a demanding group of sales and marketing team members, appropriately juggling requests from different individuals.
Results oriented: ability to track results, derive actionable insights from resulting data, and quantify meaningful impact.
Excellent verbal, written, visual communication skills -- and comfortable presenting to large audiences.

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
A bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, public relations, or a related field required.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities
CAMPAIGNS - Identify target markets, outline goals and set/manage budgets for the various campaigns. Lead marketing efforts in support of the launch of new products and releases, both internally and externally. This includes managing campaigns from 'cradle to grave' and overseeing all campaign follow-up (via Market Development or other resources). Recommend new ideas and approaches for marketing and positioning Manhattan solutions within our existing install base as well as to prospective clients.
EVENTS - Take ownership for planning and execution of tradeshow and conference sponsorship from a content, engagement and results perspective (supported by events team for contracts, logistics and production).
MESSAGING - Ensure that messaging is differentiated from competitors in the marketplace. Develop solution/product positioning and messaging that is differentiating and resonates with target customers. Champion dissemination of messaging throughout the organization.
CONTENT - Work collaboratively with product marketing and content to aid the creation of effective marketing collateral, including product brochures, data sheets, white papers, FAQs and web sites.
RESEARCH & ANALYSIS - Obtain and apply market research/competitive intelligence to understand user needs and to identify market trends and dynamics specific to our priority industries. Keep abreast of customer, competitive and market trends in conjunction with other team members to ensure relevance in all outreach programs and internal communication of domain knowledge. Evaluate market trends and provide analysis and recommendations to management.
DELIVERABLES - Ensure achievement of strategic objectives for a specific market or industry segment within the organization. Oversee the implementation of plans across market/segment to achieve sales, operational, and organizational goals. Evaluate effectiveness and profitability of programs. Monitor the development of business plans, assesses market penetration, and product positioning to drive competitive advantage, revenue and market share. Distill broad concepts and business strategies into structured program marketing plans.
PARTNERS - Develop and sustain strong partner relationships to deepen position in assigned market/segment.
PR / AR - Support analyst relations and relations with other industry influencers -- and provide on-going presentations to prospects, customers, and key influencers.
WEBSITE - Work collaboratively with the web content team to ensure our regional websites carry appropriate messaging, underpin our campaigns and drive engagement as part of our programs.

Scope of Impact/Degree of Independence
Assists executives and/or other senior leaders in defining organizational goals and strategic plans.
Directs and controls the activities of a broad functional area.

Problem Complexity/Decision Making Authority
Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth knowledge of the company.
Provides strategy and direction for major functional area.

Client Relationship Skills
Interacts internally and externally with executive level management,
Influences decision makers internally and externally

Job Description

Regional Marketing Field Support partners with Allstate Exclusive Agencies to help them grow their business and improve customer loyalty through strategic local marketing planning strategies and programs. Through this partnership we strengthen our corporate purpose to help people realize their hopes and dreams through products and services designed to protect them from life's uncertainties and to prepare them for the future.

A Field Associate Manager (FAM) promotes business growth and improved customer loyalty at the local level by overseeing the implementation and execution of local marketing programs, program engagement and agency education. The FAM provides Customer Experience leadership for the region and supervises Field Marketing Consultants.

Key Responsibilities

Regional Marketing Strategy
Inform the Field Sr. Manager of regional issues, trends and needs
Initiate and implement marketing strategies using segmentation, targeting, quantitative and qualitative campaign analysis
Assist Field Sr. Manager in the development of regional marketing plan and strategy
Accountable for Regional Marketing Plan implementation
Establish metrics and leverage measurement data to report on program success and alignment to regional strategy

Program execution
Direct and supervise Field Marketing Consultants on Home Office and Local marketing program execution
Formulate recommendations on local program needs to the Field Sr Manager
Partner with Home Office Director/Home Office Associate Manager to ensure effective program implementation at a local level
Provide subject matter expertise on regional marketing trends and opportunities to Field SR Manager, Home Office Director/Home Office Associate Manager
Participate in cross-functional/cross company teams for program development and execution

Administration
Responsible for the performance management and development of Field Marketing Consultants
Manage the Regional Marketing budget and resource allocation

Measurement
Solicit input/feedback from Field Marketing Consultants on program execution, marketing trends and opportunities at a regional level
Measure and report on overall local program results to the Field Sr Manager
Coordinate with Home Office Associate Manager to establish metrics and report on overall regional program results
Analyze marketing data to identify regional marketing trends/opportunities


Job Qualifications

Bachelor's degree with marketing concentration preferred; MBA a plus
6+ years of Marketing or related business experience
Prior management or supervision experience preferred
Advanced Marketing & Customer Experience knowledge
Advanced insurance industry knowledge
Advanced organization and project/program management skills
Advanced communication skills
Advanced meeting facilitation skills
Intermediate leadership skills
Advanced personnel development and management skills
Ability to align program results with Regional Marketing strategy
Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Intermediate proficiency in online meeting solutions (e.g., WebEx)

Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, you're choosing a different path. From day one, we've been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season.

We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find fabulous fashion at affordable prices online and in one of our 1,000+ stores globally. Old Navy celebrates a workplace that's just as diverse as our customers. Fun, fashion, family and value are at the heart of everything we do. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, we're family.

Old Navy - a brand for everyone a place for you!

Old Navy makes current American fashion essentials accessible to every family. From day one, Old Navy was a revolution. We were something the world had never seen - fabulous, affordable fashion. We didn't take ourselves too seriously, and we broke the industry's rules. What we believe in today is exactly what we believed in when we started: we're on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find their must-have fashion essentials online as well as in one of our 1,000+ stores located globally.

As part of the Field organization, you make the brand come to life for our customers. Our stores are fast paced, fun, diverse and full of passionate people who love fashion. The Field offers endless opportunities to grow your career and be a leader - of your peers, of teams, of a business, and in the community.

Old Navy - a brand for everyone, a place for you!

Sales Director - Digital Marketing
Location: Southeast Region

Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.

People in the Sales career track grow pipeline and sales by supporting, managing or leading the origination and closing of highly complex, marketing optimization, sales opportunities across a range of Accenture offerings. Sales professionals drive the sales process and outcomes on a dedicated basis, growing a profitable pipeline and/or backlog of sales, through deal origination, sales negotiations and closure.

Job Description

The Digital Marketing Sales Capture Senior Manager owns the sales process and outcomes, leading a pursuit strategy through the origination and closing of specific sales opportunities in both established and new accounts. He/she develops relationships with key buyers and decision-makers at new and/or existing clients and acts as the point of contact for resolution and escalation of all key sales pursuit related items with the client and internally.

Key responsibilities include:

Relationship Development: establish and strengthen relationships with client C-Level face-offs, Marketing leaders, business and technical buyers, and key project stakeholders. Network with Industry Leaders, as well as business partners, Accenture Alliance partners, Industry Vendors, Competitors, and participates in key industry forums.

Client Demand Stimulation and Opportunity Generation: Identify specific sales opportunities within existing and prospective clients. Engage in activities focused at generating client awareness of the firm and/or demand for its Services (may include developing/sending promotional materials, presenting in business forums, charitable activities, business associations, etc.).

Sales Process Leadership: Lead Sales Process for specific approved opportunities, complying with all internal sales stage entry/exit requirements. Construct and execute sales strategy and deal plan; including value proposition, win themes, tactics & action plan, relationship and communication plan and competitive analysis. Review solution plans, cost models and written proposals as appropriate to ensure alignment with sales strategy.

Deal Closure: Lead team of professionals including technical, finance, legal, procurement, HR and proposal management through deal closure. Develop and maintain deal close plan, aligning proposition to client's selection process, evaluation criteria and process. Understand the client's organization and processes and manage all negotiations and closing activities accordingly.

+ Basic qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

Minimum of 10 yrs. Business Development experience in Digital Marketing
Minimum of 10 yrs.' experience in Sales Execution/Sales Pursuit and Closure
Minimum of 5 years selling complex solutions to the Financial Services market.


Professional Qualifications:

Must understand end-to-end Marketing solutions, from Design (Strategy) to Build (Technology) to Run (Optimization)
Experience working with delivering Digital Marketing Services related work within a large, heavily matrixed company environment.

Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, you're choosing a different path. From day one, we've been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season.

We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find fabulous fashion at affordable prices online and in one of our 1,000+ stores globally. Old Navy celebrates a workplace that's just as diverse as our customers. Fun, fashion, family and value are at the heart of everything we do. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, we're family.

Old Navy - a brand for everyone a place for you!

Old Navy makes current American fashion essentials accessible to every family. From day one, Old Navy was a revolution. We were something the world had never seen - fabulous, affordable fashion. We didn't take ourselves too seriously, and we broke the industry's rules. What we believe in today is exactly what we believed in when we started: we're on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. Today, customers can find their must-have fashion essentials online as well as in one of our 1,000+ stores located globally.

As part of the Field organization, you make the brand come to life for our customers. Our stores are fast paced, fun, diverse and full of passionate people who love fashion. The Field offers endless opportunities to grow your career and be a leader - of your peers, of teams, of a business, and in the community.

Old Navy - a brand for everyone, a place for you!

Overview

The Chick-fil-A Marketing Department desires to know more of our Customers and to deliver food, services and advertising that resonates with them. We are looking for individuals who can support our pursuit of a "Modern Marketing Engine". As part of the Customer & Market Insights (CMI) team, this role will help us to identify, store and analyze quantitative data and qualitative research to better understand competitors, customers and consumers as we incorporate new platforms into our ecosystem. This position will work with others on the CMI team as well as IT and external vendors to help identify data sets as we implement new data platforms. The role will support strategic decisions by devising methods for identifying data patterns and trends in available information sources.

Responsibilities

Assist in identification and implementation of data sets related to new data platforms, including a DMP, CDP and others identified in our analytic roadmap to support analytic capabilities
Analyze quantitative data and qualitative research to better understand customers and competitors
Understand and apply data mining techniques to generate deep insights
Support Customer & Market Insights in providing strategic insights to Marketing
Proactively identify and resolve areas of friction impacting operation or usability of data
Partner with IT to ensure adherence to industry leading data integrity practices

Strong Microsoft Excel ability
Strong verbal and written communication skills and ability to work cross functionally
Strong interest in customer focused marketing technologies that lead to insights for the business


Preferred Qualifications

Experience in the day to day support of marketing technology platforms, for the purpose of supporting data mining and analytic needs
Understanding of customer recognition and management of PII for targeted engagement
Experience implementing data platforms
Strong understanding of marketing automation best practices
Experience collaborating with IT organizations
Ability to translate identified business use cases into analytical & technical requirements

IgnitionOne® is a global leader in cloud-based digital marketing technology, providing a world-class proprietary platform and expert services to improve digital marketing performance. IgnitionOne’s integrated Digital Marketing SuiteSM (DMS) empowers marketers to buy, manage and optimize digital media across Search, Display, Social and Mobile, understand client users through Data Management and Cross-Channel Attribution, while helping to optimize conversions on a marketer’s website through Marketing Automation. At the core of the DMS is the proprietary User Engagement Score Algorithm, which determines the value of a user to automate the delivery of the right message, at the right time, at the right cost, to a marketer’s users, on and off their website.
IgnitionOne currently scores over 300 million users monthly in 75 countries and powers more than $30 billion in revenue each year for leading brands, including General Motors, CenturyLink, Bridgestone, La Quinta and Fiat, as well as advertising agencies such as 360i, GroupM and iProspect.
Work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment alongside some of the smartest thought leaders in advertising technology. Be the member of a team that delivers innovative marketing technology that simplifies marketers’ lives and drives performance to new heights. Have fun collaborating on ground-breaking, challenging assignments where your opinion matters, you grow professionally and high performers are recognized and rewarded. And join a company on the cutting edge of digital marketing and technology that is regularly honored with awards and has been featured in major news media such as WSJ, NYT, Bloomberg, AdAge, ADWEEK and more.

Job Description
The Product Consultant is responsible for delivering and providing guidance on Watson Marketing packaged services and programs. In this capacity, they will serve as a trusted consultant to help instill product confidence, adoption and utilization. The role requires a technically proficient Consultant who is resourceful, confident under pressure, and has demonstrated skill in both product knowledge transfer and product problem resolution.

The Product Consultant engages with a wide-range of clients, but typically focuses on unique initiatives pertaining to marketing technology implementation and adoption. A Product Consultant (Level 3) advises clients on successful advanced strategic product adoption and utilization. The bulk of their work will leverage proven methodologies, best practices and knowledge sharing while incorporating risk mitigation strategies into every project phase. Lastly, they are responsible for delivering services and documentation that exceed customer expectations. The Product Consultant will deliver some packaged strategic solutions, but most of the time will be asked to identify and delivery on custom needs and solutions. They frequently lead and mentor a team of Consultants who will deliver various service products and act as a program manager for the delivery of those services.

The role is responsible for delivering product implementations, integrations and consulting activities that require:
Deep technical understanding of Watson Marketing technologies and touch-points with 3 rd party software solutions (e.g., CRM, WEB analytics, etc.) to architect optimal and future-proof solutions.
Strong consulting skills to distill complex business requirements down to the essential project/technical requirements while providing advisory guidance throughout the process.
Experienced and proven team management skills to orchestrate activities across internal and external organizational units to drive time to market and high-quality results.
ESSESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Must be technically proficient in Watson Marketing's product and API suite and integrations with partner products.
Must pass basic certification within 30 days of hire and professional certification within 60 days of hire.
Able to deliver high quality, value-add engagements around Watson Marketing's solution areas and features in diverse client environments with quantifiable ROI.
Able to deliver on their own consulting work and manage a customer portfolio of projects.
Able to mentor, train and grow other product consultants who deliver custom engagements (scoped consultant hours).
Able to guide customers through custom complex implementation efforts of Watson Marketing solutions for new clients and expanding business initiatives.
Able to effectively manage multiple large-scale delivery efforts simultaneously
Proactively provides strategic continuous improvements to consulting methodologies and SOPs and ensures improvements are well documented and communicated to the team.
Develops and executes detailed program and project plans which include requirements definition, scoping, design, resource plans, schedules, dependency management, issue/risk management, project reporting/tracking and client communications and task dependencies. Further this role will track and report on project and deliverable status and manage variances; prepare weekly project status reports, and other project communications and/or presentations as needed. Identify, escalate and resolve project issues, problems, and changes in scope. Ensures all project deliverables are completed on time, within budget, and with the highest level of quality.
Prepares and reports on portfolio of deliverables to both internal and external stakeholders (oral and written) at a various management levels but mostly to C-Level leaders.
Lead in troubleshooting product issue resolution which includes problem determination, issues resolution/plan and client communications.
Develops an advanced strategic understanding of the Watson Marketing product family and Services methodologies to apply within customer engagements.
Provides leadership and consultative direction for Watson Marketing products and services that will improve the efficiency and effectiveness of a client's digital marketing campaigns and streamline operations to ensure best-fit for Watson Marketing product and services.
Provide consultative advice and direction to onboarding new clients.
Provide consultative advice and direction on marketing campaign's best practices.
Proficient knowledge of Industry verticals and key subject matters including cutting edge best practices / formally own vertical and/or subject matter SME responsibilities for PS
Own the RFP process for product consulting work across any customer engagement.
Defines and documents engagement scope, deliverables and pricing within a Statement of Work (SOW).
Collaborate with sales on new or existing opportunities; able to own re-negotiations as needed by sales.
Up-sells and cross-sells services and identifies areas where custom solutions may be appropriate.
Ensures project alignment with Watson Marketing's Services standards and processes.
Promotes knowledge sharing and acts as a mentor throughout the Services team.
Adheres to target billable and client utilization targets as communicated by management.
Create post mortem reports defining engagement finding and analysis work.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Minimum of seven (7) years of professional services experience in software implementation and technical consulting and large-scale project management within a similar SaaS organization.
Minimum of seven (7) years of experience in similar role at a marketing, agency or services company.
Minimum of seven (7) years of experience with marketing automation technologies, including email marketing.
Minimum of seven (7) years of experience and proficiency in email systems, ISP's, data manipulation, databases, Flash and other web technologies (HTML, CSS, Web Forms, JavaScript, RSS, FTP, XML, APIs, Web Services).

Trustpilot is an online community helping consumers choose with confidence, enabling companies to grow their business. A new review is written through Trustpilot every five seconds, and each month reviews are displayed over 1 billion times with our widgets and website. Our mission is to ensure that consumers around the world make informed buying choices by learning from each other’s experiences.
Overview:
Trustpilot is looking for a motivated, energetic and dynamic leader to join its management team. The Sales Manager will be responsible for managing a team of Account Executives to support them in achieving and exceeding their individual targets that contribute to an overall goal.  This is a highly visible role that gives you the opportunity to exercise situational leadership, develop a team of reps and be an integral part in the growth and success of Trustpilot. As a sales manager, it’s your responsibility to define, measure and reinforce best sales practices by researching trends, staying up to date with competition and anticipating the company’s needs. With a team of 8-10 sales reps, you will set the tone for competitive nature, resilience and an emphasis on customer success.
Responsibilities:
Play an integral part in growing Trustpilot by being actively involved in hiring practices
Motivate, coach and develop a team of 8-10 inside sales reps
Have a hand in running demos, navigating objections and closing deals
Define, measure and reinforce sales metrics, goals and best practices
Collaborate with other managers in order to develop and evolve sales tactics
Ideal Fit:
4-7 years sales experience with 2+ years management experience
Expertise in the digital/SaaS space in a subscription model strongly preferred (particularly online marketing)
Experience in managing a sales team in a fast-paced, high- volume, outbound selling environment
The ability to create, set and manage a strategic plan for your sales team and how it works with all supporting teams
Knowledge of how to use metrics and data as a way to support effective sales behavior as well as the health of the sales performance of your team
Passion for improving global standards for customer satisfaction; desire to maintain a customer focus
Proven success managing a team comprised of varying levels of professionalism and experience; Proven models for coaching and development of your team
Ability to help support and direct the overall sales plan and strategy
We Offer:
Ongoing training for a career in technology sales
The opportunity to be a key player at a rapidly expanding global technology company
Full benefits & 401k
Paid family leave
Commuter benefits
Free lunch Friday and bagel Mondays
Social clubs and sponsored activities
Snacks, ping pong, foosball, darts, etc.
Uncapped commission
Chance to win a spot at President’s Club vacation
Check out our office on The Muse!
Trustpilot is an online review-driven community and platform that builds relationships between consumers and businesses. Launched in 2007, Trustpilot has seen demand for its service rapidly increase, now providing over 140,000 businesses with TrustScores based on more than 22 million reviews. Trustpilot operates in 65 countries, with offices in the UK, US, Denmark, Germany, Australia and Lithuania. Enabling businesses to engage with customers directly, Trustpilot invites shoppers to provide reviews of their experiences, allowing for a more open conversation about business improvements based on personal feedback.
Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Position Description:
Partner with business and commercial bankers to sell business deposits and services into a relationship. Identify prospects for business deposits and services sales. Loan products sold are credit card and checkline reserve. Partners with a minimum of 2-3 business or commercial bankers.

Sales:
Achieve Financial, Production and Relationship results as defined by the role specific metrics and goals for the Sales Scorecards. The results may include a requirement for individual contribution as well as team performance.
Develops and implements an individual sales & service activities plan that aligns with the team plan.
Proactively looks for way to enhance sales performance by seeking coaching, supporting Bank initiatives and leveraging tools to enhance activities.
Ensures sales activities are aligned to create value for both the customer and the bank. Sales results should align with the needs of the community and ultimately support the organizational commitment to diverse lending.
Effectively engages partners to develop holistic customer relationships.
Uses a relationship selling approach in customer/prospect interactions, ensuring appropriate preparation and planning is completed and probing customer-centric conversations occur.
When appropriate, represents the Bank in the community by attending and participating in civic and community events for purpose of generating additional business and identifying potential CRA opportunities for the Bank.

Service & Sales Support and Referrals:
Demonstrates Bank's service standards of accuracy, responsiveness, courtesy, partnership and responsibility along with other service expectations as established.
Ensures service and referral activities are aligned to create value for both the customer and the bank.
Uses problem-solving, listening, understanding and responding techniques to address a customers' immediate needs and when appropriate, link need to a solution where there is an opportunity to expand or retain a relationship.
Regularly creates value added conversations with customers to uncover opportunities to make quality referrals to branch or other business partners.
Prepares sales support materials for prospect and customer calling efforts. Schedules prospect and client appointments.
Proactively looks for ways to enhance service and referral performance by seeking coaching, supporting Bank initiatives, and leveraging tools to enhance activities.

Operations and Administration:
Associates in roles defined to take deposits are accountable to accuracy, efficiency, and workload results as defined by the Operational Scorecard. The results may include a requirement for individual contribution as well as team performance.
Adheres to all regulations, compliance and Bank policies, procedures and delegated authorities.
Manages risk related to credit, operational, reputational, regulatory and legal aspects of personal interactions.
Performs general office management duties as assigned.
Completes required training by established deadlines.

Position Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor degree with a minimum of 2 years experience in a sales, financial services, or lending role.
-Or-
High school diploma or GED with a minimum of 6 years experience in a sales, financial services, or lending role.

Additional Requirements:
Must possess a valid driver's license. Position requires frequent driving to other offices, bank customers, etc. Bank car not provided.

Must complete federal registration and annual renewal as required by the SAFE Act.
Sales, referral and service skills to effectively sell the Banks products and make qualified referrals to Bank partners.

Other Preferred Requirements:
Advanced knowledge of features and benefits of various bank deposit products, and related policies and procedures.
Considerable knowledge of retail lending products and services and related policies and procedures.

Position Description:
The Sales & Service Representative II handles customer service transactions, branch administrative activities and processes traditional teller transactions. This associate assists with branch sales activities, generating sales referrals for new customers and from existing customers through execution of the branch's marketing and business development plan. This associate is responsible for providing customers and prospects with information about products and services offer by the Bank, and providing high quality customer service for all customers.

Principal Accountabilities
30% - Sales Support: Identify sales referrals while handling customer service and transaction needs. Maintain basic product knowledge to ensure that customer needs may be identified. Participate in branch sales huddles and campaigns as directed by management. Promote the Bank's products and services through customer and prospect outreach, maintain an active prospect list for referrals, and/or any other sales support as defined by the branch's marketing and business development plan.
30% - Teller Operations: Perform basic teller transactions such as paying and receiving , verifying deposit amounts, examining checks for endorsement and negotiability, operating within established operational authority limit and engaging branch management, Branch Central or Branch Operations Management for support as needed. Count cash drawer, research and locate outages.
20% - Service: Answer questions, provide account maintenance and resolve problems for customers concerning products and services provided by the Bank; identify the problem, collect data, secure answers and communicate updates and resolutions to the customer as appropriate. Work with the Operations Services Supervisor (or Operations Services Lead) or other associates as necessary. Perform customer service activities (e.g. check orders, account maintenance, address change). Provide excellent service at all times following the Banks Service Excellence guidelines.
10% - Teamwork: Foster teamwork with fellow associates in the branch as a whole. Maintain helpful and courteous interactions with others and keep communication lines open.
10% -Risk Mitigation/Compliance: Adhere to all federal regulations and bank policies; keep current on bank procedures via the Banks resources and required training. Maintain all internal controls.

Position Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
High school diploma or GED with a minimum of 9 months experience in a cash handling, sales or customer service role.
-Or-
High school diploma or GED with a minimum of 6 months experience as Sales & Service Representative I at First Citizens Bank.

Manage sales and branch associates. Oversee branch operations with support from an OSS. Outbound calling on business customers and prospects. Business product and services sales. Bachelor degree with a minimum of 4 years experience in a sales, customer service role and/or in a lending role to include a minimum of 1 year lead or supervisory experience.

Ability to reach predetermined deposit products and services goals.

Trustpilot is an online community helping consumers choose with confidence, enabling companies to grow their business. A new review is written through Trustpilot every five seconds, and each month reviews are displayed over 1 billion times with our widgets and website. Our mission is to ensure that consumers around the world make informed buying choices by learning from each other’s experiences.
Overview:
Trustpilot is looking for a motivated, energetic and dynamic leader to join its management team. The Sales Manager will be responsible for managing a team of Account Executives to support them in achieving and exceeding their individual targets that contribute to an overall goal.  This is a highly visible role that gives you the opportunity to exercise situational leadership, develop a team of reps and be an integral part in the growth and success of Trustpilot. As a sales manager, it’s your responsibility to define, measure and reinforce best sales practices by researching trends, staying up to date with competition and anticipating the company’s needs. With a team of 8-10 sales reps, you will set the tone for competitive nature, resilience and an emphasis on customer success.
Responsibilities:
Play an integral part in growing Trustpilot by being actively involved in hiring practices
Motivate, coach and develop a team of 8-10 inside sales reps
Have a hand in running demos, navigating objections and closing deals
Define, measure and reinforce sales metrics, goals and best practices
Collaborate with other managers in order to develop and evolve sales tactics
Ideal Fit:
4-7 years sales experience with 2+ years management experience
Expertise in the digital/SaaS space in a subscription model strongly preferred (particularly online marketing)
Experience in managing a sales team in a fast-paced, high- volume, outbound selling environment
The ability to create, set and manage a strategic plan for your sales team and how it works with all supporting teams
Knowledge of how to use metrics and data as a way to support effective sales behavior as well as the health of the sales performance of your team
Passion for improving global standards for customer satisfaction; desire to maintain a customer focus
Proven success managing a team comprised of varying levels of professionalism and experience; Proven models for coaching and development of your team
Ability to help support and direct the overall sales plan and strategy
We Offer:
Ongoing training for a career in technology sales
The opportunity to be a key player at a rapidly expanding global technology company
Full benefits & 401k
Paid family leave
Commuter benefits
Free lunch Friday and bagel Mondays
Social clubs and sponsored activities
Snacks, ping pong, foosball, darts, etc.
Uncapped commission
Chance to win a spot at President’s Club vacation
Check out our office on The Muse!
Trustpilot is an online review-driven community and platform that builds relationships between consumers and businesses. Launched in 2007, Trustpilot has seen demand for its service rapidly increase, now providing over 140,000 businesses with TrustScores based on more than 22 million reviews. Trustpilot operates in 65 countries, with offices in the UK, US, Denmark, Germany, Australia and Lithuania. Enabling businesses to engage with customers directly, Trustpilot invites shoppers to provide reviews of their experiences, allowing for a more open conversation about business improvements based on personal feedback.
Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Founded in 2012, Peloton is an innovative tech company that brings members the best workouts possible, all from the convenience of their own homes via the Bike, Tread and iOS App platforms. Peloton uses technology and design to connect the world through fitness, empowering people to be the best version of themselves anywhere, anytime.
Peloton believes in taking risks and challenging the status quo by continuously innovating and improving.  We put our users, members, and customers first and we obsess over every touch point of the member experience – be it the studio, product or showroom.  We like to hire the best and encourage all our associates to be Peloton’s brand ambassadors.  Most importantly, we know that together we go far.
  THE ROLE:
Energetic, enthusiastic and results driven, our Sales Specialists are the front line business drivers in Peloton's retail showrooms.  They exhibit a keen knowledge of our product, services, and company.  Above all, our Sales Specialists are strong communicators who are able to understand the needs of their clients, build long lasting relationships with these clients and build a solid network for sales.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND REQUIREMENTS:
Focus on achieving and exceeding individual sales goals
Maximize sales through excellent customer service, product knowledge, and merchandise presentation
Proactively utilize Salesforce to record and maintain client information and preferences to drive your business
Develop a deep knowledge and understanding of Peloton's products and brand image
Phone and email outreach to both established and developing clients to communicate updates, events, and follow-up
Provide outstanding customer service at all times
Work professionally with fellow sales specialists in a team environment
Help to maintain visual/physical standards of store
  EXPERIENCE/ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED:
Prior sales experience - preferably in a customer focused environment
Entrepreneurial spirit; desire to exceed sales goals
Enthusiastic, energetic and personable professional demeanor
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ambitious, hardworking and team oriented
An appreciation of fitness and a healthy lifestyle
High school graduate or equivalent
Must be able to work nights, weekends, and holidays
Proficiency with MS applications (Word, Excel, etc), Apple Products and Salesforce a plus
At Peloton, the health and well-being of our employees is of the utmost importance to us. In addition to a competitive base salary with generous bonus potential, we are proud to offer a comprehensive benefits plan and paid time off to all full-time employees. Peloton is an equal opportunity employer and hires only on the basis of skills and experience.

Identifies new significant business prospects to establish business partner opportunities.

Qualified plan experience strongly desired.

Meet and or exceed annual quota assignments, build a pipeline, effectively forecast and meet quarterly quota assignments.
Excellent time manager, qualifier and negotiator.

Ability to travel to client sites, up to 30% of the time.
