If you've got a passion for people and the desire to succeed, a position as a CarMax Sales Consultant may be for you! CarMax is a growing company that is built on the fundamental principles of integrity and treating people with respect. Here are more reasons why our Associates love working for America's #1 used car retailer:

A Great Place to Work

CarMax has been named one of the FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® since 2005. Our Associates work in a supportive, diverse, and fun environment that fosters a work/life balance. This positive work environment leads to a positive customer experience, and is a big part of why 95% of our customers would refer us to their friends.

Top-Notch Training

Don't have automotive sales experience? CarMax is ranked as one of the best training companies in America. You'll enjoy world-class, training with your own personal sales mentor who is dedicated to your success. We provide ongoing training, support self-development, and we learn as a team.

Career Growth and Recognition

With more than 180 stores nationwide and growing, CarMax Associates have fantastic career opportunities. Our incentive programs provide the potential for additional earnings, recognition, and perks!

CarMax Sales Consultant responsibilities include:

- Providing exceptional service throughout the customer's experience.

- Communicating effectively both in-person and over the phone to discover the customer's wants and needs.

- Serving as an advocate for CarMax by sharing what makes us the smart choice.

- Navigating and using various provided computer programs as selling tools.

- Consulting and guiding your customers to the appropriate next step based on their situation.

- Facilitating steps of the sale, such as the vehicle appraisal process, taking test drives, and submitting finance applications.

- Maintaining a working knowledge of CarMax products and appropriately recommending them to customers.

- Reading, collecting, and transcribing data in order to complete accurate paperwork.

- Seeking out opportunities for self-development, participating in training, and welcoming performance feedback.

- Building and maintaining strong relationships and demonstrating excellent teamwork.

- Maintaining the sales area so our vehicles and products are neatly and accurately displayed.

This position may require other duties as assigned. For store positions, the responsibilities may vary by store.

Manager- Inside Sales

HomeAdvisor, a subsidiary of ANGI Home Services (Nasdaq ANGI), is an innovative internet company that helps homeowners improve their homes and contractors grow their businesses. A vibrant online marketplace offering an array of resources to its customers, HomeAdvisor is one of the biggest internet success stories in Colorado.

If you are competitive in nature, have an outgoing personality, a stellar sales record in B2B sales as well as a proven track record in leading a team to success, HomeAdvisor is looking for you! HomeAdvisor is growing our Sales force and has an opening for a dynamic Sales Manager to coach, motivate and lead a team of Inside Sales Consultants to meet and exceed daily, weekly and monthly quotas. Your success is defined by the success and performance of your team! Sales play a vital role not only with regard to revenue generation, but also with HomeAdvisor’s reputation in the marketplace. Our success lies with our sales team’s ability to show the value of HomeAdvisor’s brand and product to service professionals in need of a full enterprise solution for their business.

How we’ll keep you busy:

Manage and provide leadership to an Inside Sales team

Identify/manage to individual strengths and opportunities of Inside Sales Consultants

Monitor calls and provide written/verbal coaching and mentoring on a daily/weekly basis

Collect data, analyze information, and provide feedback to Inside Sales Consultants to increase performance, skill sets, and overall productivity

Motivate at both the team and individual level to increase performance

Plan and facilitate team meetings to provide feedback and disseminate information, as well as activities at a team level to motivate and maintain energy

Effectively communicate, coach, and model effective sales tactics, strategies, and closing skills

Build and maintain accurate employee records including: system notes, coaching, attendance, payroll, and any documentation that supports the organizational code of conduct

Achieve or exceed sales metrics and revenue targets on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis

Manage/create sales pipelines to meet/achieve sales quotas

Ensure that Sales pipelines are properly assigned and actively worked

Organize and manage sales campaigns at the Consultant level and report progress to upper management

What does it take to be successful?

Strong management and sales skills- someone who can lead a sales team to meet and exceed sales goals

Great energy, a positive personality, and a great people manager who can inspire and motivate a team

Strong, effective, and professional communication skills- you may be required to have difficult conversations with your sales consultants, collaborate with other managers/directors as well as with folks in different departments, and when needed, jump on the phones to help close a customer

Strong attention to detail, self-starter who can adapt quickly to change and manage multiple priorities, and a tenacious desire to win

Requirements

Minimum of 3 years sales management experience, and 5 years total sales experience.

Must possess, strong verbal, written, presentation, and interpersonal skills and possess characteristics that demonstrate ethical professionalism

Proven sales ability- Applicants will be asked to complete new hire training and hit sales minimums before being assigned a team. There will then be a 90 day probationary period to evaluate skills and fit for the role

Solid computer skills: internet (for prospecting/research), Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel

* Bachelors Degree preferred.

In addition, you'll need to be able to:
Work in a fast-paced, high-energy sales center environment without being distracted (music played throughout the day).
Sit or stand for an 8-hour shift.
Hear and talk on a phone head/handset for up to 8 hours per day.
Successfully pass a criminal background check.

Perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodations.

Overall Purpose: As a direct sales position, this role generates sales to further penetrate business accounts.

Key Roles and Responsibilities: Generates existing and or new sales for delivery of solutions. In partnership with the Business team, identifies sales opportunities. Initiates customer contacts with existing and prospective customers, within Business to further penetrate existing accounts. Develops new accounts, maintains and grows existing accounts. Develops responses to Request for Proposals. Owns the Mobility account relationship and is responsible for account management and meeting revenue objectives.

Meeting with customers and engaging in sales activities at the customers site; communicating with customers via phone, teleconference, e-mail, etc. related to proposed solutions/sales, etc.; traveling to and from the customers premise for the purpose of engaging in sales activities; providing subject matter expertise regarding technical issues relating to sales; advising customers on suitability of products based on technical needs; preparing proposals, presentations, or bids, including developing pricing, developing strategic plans related to the customer and the proposed solutions/sales; researching and developing customer solutions with AT&T external partners, including design and engineering; and researching customer business and industry to identify new sales opportunities .

THIS IS A DRIVING ROLE...CURRENT MVR WILL BE

CHECKED AS PART OF THE JOB OFFER.

Education: Bachelors Degree preferred.

Experience: 3 - 5 Years Direct Sales Experience preferred.

Supervisory: No.

Advance your Sales career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company!

Are you seeking a career at a Fortune 100 company where you work as part of a dynamic team and get to help people protect what matters most? Responsibilities:
Utilize consultative sales techniques to prospect and initiate new business sales.
Assists in the processing of new business, including contacting customers to finalize sales and service transactions.
Identifies cross selling opportunities for Lead Sales Representative.
Contributes to and executes a marketing plan with the Lead Sales Representative.
Identifies mass marketing prospects through existing book of business and community prospecting opportunities.
Meet monthly goals for new business sales.
Completes follow-ups on new policies in order to keep retention level high and capitalize cross-selling opportunities.
Coordinates activities with other departments to ensure quality customer service
Acts as initial contact in addressing customer concerns regarding establishment of policies and new account status.

Bachelor's degree or equivalent training; 1-3 years of relevant work experience.
Excellent presentation, verbal and written communication, and analytical skills.
Ability to work independently to plan, set priorities and effectively organize work.
Ability to handle multiple tasks with varying time constraints.

Demonstrated track record of meeting sales goals and/or quotas a plus.
Must attain and maintain current state insurance license in property, casualty and life, accident and health.


Benefits:

At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We're dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Job: Sales
Primary Location: United States-Colorado-Broomfield
Schedule: Full-time
Salary: $43,900-$47,000

Overview:
The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is a position that provides training on the fundamentals of Software Sales and ideally looks to promote our employees into full closing roles as Account Executives. We are looking for competitive, energetic and most of all motivated people who want to jump start their sales career by building the foundation of what it takes to be a top sales performer.
Sales Development Representative’s are driven and competitive individuals who focus on generating and qualifying new business opportunities for our sales team. We are looking for hardworking people to discover and pique the interest of C Level executives of the eCommerce businesses we sell to and who will benefit from our product.
Successful candidates must have a strong work ethic, passion to be part of Trustpilot, and the drive to not only meet but exceed sales targets. Working closely with our Management team and our Senior Sales people will give you the opportunity to develop and continue to develop your career in sales. You will learn from the best by working alongside the top performers on the sales team along with sales leadership. Self- motivated individuals looking to build a solid foundation in software sales are an ideal fit for this position.
Responsibilities:
Prospect and identify clients to contact via cold calling and email outreach
Research prospects and identify stakeholders in order to generate interest and create rapport
Manage expectations and overcome objections
Maintain an organized pipeline and activity records using Salesforce.com
Reach and exceed key performance indicators including calls scheduled, calls completed, qualified opportunities and deals won from your meetings.
Develop skills necessary for promotion into a full, closing role
Ideal Fit:
Entry level to 1 year of sales or professional experience
4-year college degree required
A strong interest in building a career in sales
Entrepreneurial mindset - eager to advance through clearly defined learning and earning paths
Self disciplined, organized and ambitious. Able to consistently hit daily and monthly objectives
Go-getter attitude that displays initiative and persistence, all with a competitive drive
Positive and energetic attitude with exceptional communication skills
Resilience, perseverance, and the ability to overcome objections a must
Ability to work in a high-energy, sales-team environment
Cold calling, sales training and Salesforce.com experience is a plus but not required
We Offer:
Ongoing training, development and support for a career in technology sales
The opportunity to be a key player at a rapidly expanding global technology company
Full benefits & 401k
Paid family leave
Commuter Benefits
Free lunch Fridays and bagel Mondays
Social clubs and sponsored activities
Snacks, ping pong, foosball, darts, etc.
Read a real life ADR promotion success story in Denver Here and a NYC success story Here. Also check out our office on The Muse!
Founded in 2007 by CEO Peter Holten Mühlmann, Trustpilot is a global, multi-language review community that builds trust and transparency between consumers and businesses. Currently boasting more than 14 million consumer reviews of 115,000 businesses, Trustpilot produces a TrustScore for businesses based on recent reviews. Every day, more than 10,000 consumers sign up on Trustpilot, and every month, 500,000 new reviews are posted on the community.
Trustpilot has customers in 65 countries and has developed strong positions in Denmark, Sweden, the U.K., France, Italy, Germany and the Netherlands, as well as the U.S. The company is located in New York, London, Copenhagen and Melbourne, and its employee base has increased from 168 people in 2013 to its current count of more than 450 employees representing 40 nationalities.
Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.
#LI

The Sliding Door Company is seeking a hungry, driven, and self-motivated Regional Sales Manager with a keen eye for detail. We need someone that's upbeat, positive, and able roll with the punches.
TSDC is the leader in custom built, high-end interior glass installations and we're expanding rapidly. This company works as a team and treats employees as family. When fires break out, everybody grabs a bucket, from the dog to the CEO!
We'll provide you with the proper training to become a glass installation whiz. Your success will be dependent on YOU; the power is all yours! Business development and effective management of your team's pipeline will fast track you to exceeding your sales goals for an optimal payout. Come show your talents to the most dynamic company in the industry!
Position Overview:
The primary function of this position will involve managing and providing clear leadership direction to the Account Executives and Business Development Representatives, while building business relationships in the designated region.
What You'll Do :
50-60% travel - Consistent travel to showrooms in the territory will allow you to have that "roll up your sleeves and jump in" approach
Come equipped with exceptional knowledge of the A & D industry and dealing with all levels of the industry is an absolute must
Develop and generate new business with Architects, Designers, Contractors, Builders, and Developers. Basically, get out there and tell everyone how awesome our product is.
Working closely with Director of Sales and Operations, we are a team after all
Ongoing product knowledge support and sales support. Our R & D department is the bomb! Meaning we have new products and features to showcase often.
Maintaining showroom integrity – making sure the showrooms are presentable with up-to-date equipment and smiling faces
Motivating Sales Team. The better they do, the better you do, period.
Act as an example for Sales Reps by delivering strong results. This one is self-explanatory
Help each Account Executive and Business Development Representative create quarterly, monthly, weekly and daily goals, schedules and/or plans
Training Reps on time management skills. Time is money after all!
Reviewing sales scenarios and finding solutions or reasons for lost sales opportunities. Always teaching, always learning.
Reviewing monthly and quarterly sales goals versus actuals with Director of Sales
Promoting and developing a proactive sales strategy
Working with Sales team to create "events" at each showroom to draw in potential proactive leads
Become a Jedi master with our CRM, Operations Process, and other programs
What you Have :
3-5+ years of field sales management experience in the Architectural & Design Industry
Proven track record of success in sales; personnel management a plus, not required
Impeccable presentation and communication skills both verbally and written
Measurable and effective managerial and leadership behaviors
High level of proficiency in Microsoft Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word)
Patience and adaptability to challenging situations
Ability to work with a wide variety of personalities and within a team
Strong negotiation skills
Passion for interior design is a plus
As Part of our Team You'll Enjoy:
Base salary + bonus structure
Medical Insurance
Dental and Vision coverage
Paid Time Off (PTO) and Paid Holidays
401k
Product training
Travel Opportunities
Upward mobility and opportunity for those that are successful
The best coworkers around!

If this job is available in multiple locations, by applying to this position you may be considered for the additional locations in your area

Our business sales professionals are elite self-starters with a drive to transform the way our customers do business through technology. Wireless solutions? We have them. Cloud solutions? We deliver them. As a member of our team, you'll bring the full array of AT&T solutions to businesses - and feel great about the impact you're having on their bottom line.

As part of the B2B Sales Program, you'll learn directly from a company that's leading the way for innovation. This 16-week paid program offers instructor-led, web-based and hands-on training - all designed to help you gain new experiences and transform your skills. You'll kick off your adventure in Dallas, and after honing your skills, you can anticipate relocation to one of AT&T's nationwide markets with a demand for your talent. It's just the opportunity you need to hit the ground running.

You'll also work with our advanced technology, learn how to prospect for new business, solve problems, provide excellent customer service and meet sales goals. With your passion for sales and technology combined with our training, you'll be on your way to becoming a top sales performer.

If you're a leader with a focus in sales, the world-class training you'll receive in our B2B Sales Program can give you the tools and connections you need to build an amazing career. From securing new business to managing our existing customers, you'll take on a variety of challenges. You must be able to relocate within the U.S., have a valid driver's license (This position may require a Motor Vehicle Record), and have a Bachelor's Degree.

Sound like you?

Our Employees Say It Best. Watch Now >>

AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position.

Qualifications
Sales passion and a drive for accelerated growth in professional B2B sales
Related experience with cold calling and sales major/certificate is a plus
Strong academic performance and demonstrated leadership skills
Effective communication and presentation skills
Passion for technology
Valid and clean driver's license, current auto insurance and a reliable vehicle
Bilingual skills a plus
AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position

Position Description:
Partner with business and commercial bankers to sell business deposits and services into a relationship. Identify prospects for business deposits and services sales. Loan products sold are credit card and checkline reserve. Partners with a minimum of 2-3 business or commercial bankers.

Sales:
Achieve Financial, Production and Relationship results as defined by the role specific metrics and goals for the Sales Scorecards. The results may include a requirement for individual contribution as well as team performance.
Develops and implements an individual sales & service activities plan that aligns with the team plan.
Proactively looks for way to enhance sales performance by seeking coaching, supporting Bank initiatives and leveraging tools to enhance activities.
Ensures sales activities are aligned to create value for both the customer and the bank. Sales results should align with the needs of the community and ultimately support the organizational commitment to diverse lending.
Effectively engages partners to develop holistic customer relationships.
Uses a relationship selling approach in customer/prospect interactions, ensuring appropriate preparation and planning is completed and probing customer-centric conversations occur.
When appropriate, represents the Bank in the community by attending and participating in civic and community events for purpose of generating additional business and identifying potential CRA opportunities for the Bank.

Service & Sales Support and Referrals:
Demonstrates Bank's service standards of accuracy, responsiveness, courtesy, partnership and responsibility along with other service expectations as established.
Ensures service and referral activities are aligned to create value for both the customer and the bank.
Uses problem-solving, listening, understanding and responding techniques to address a customers' immediate needs and when appropriate, link need to a solution where there is an opportunity to expand or retain a relationship.
Regularly creates value added conversations with customers to uncover opportunities to make quality referrals to branch or other business partners.
Prepares sales support materials for prospect and customer calling efforts. Schedules prospect and client appointments.
Proactively looks for ways to enhance service and referral performance by seeking coaching, supporting Bank initiatives, and leveraging tools to enhance activities.

Operations and Administration:
Associates in roles defined to take deposits are accountable to accuracy, efficiency, and workload results as defined by the Operational Scorecard. The results may include a requirement for individual contribution as well as team performance.
Adheres to all regulations, compliance and Bank policies, procedures and delegated authorities.
Manages risk related to credit, operational, reputational, regulatory and legal aspects of personal interactions.
Performs general office management duties as assigned.
Completes required training by established deadlines.

Position Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor degree with a minimum of 2 years experience in a sales, financial services, or lending role.
-Or-
High school diploma or GED with a minimum of 6 years experience in a sales, financial services, or lending role.

Additional Requirements:
Must possess a valid driver's license. Position requires frequent driving to other offices, bank customers, etc. Bank car not provided.

Must complete federal registration and annual renewal as required by the SAFE Act.
Sales, referral and service skills to effectively sell the Banks products and make qualified referrals to Bank partners.

Other Preferred Requirements:
Advanced knowledge of features and benefits of various bank deposit products, and related policies and procedures.
Considerable knowledge of retail lending products and services and related policies and procedures.

Regularly creates value added conversations with customers to uncover opportunities to make quality referrals to branch or other business partners.
Prepares sales support materials for prospect and customer calling efforts. Schedules prospect and client appointments.
Proactively looks for ways to enhance service and referral performance by seeking coaching, supporting Bank initiatives, and leveraging tools to enhance activities.

Operations and Administration:
Associates in roles defined to take deposits are accountable to accuracy, efficiency, and workload results as defined by the Operational Scorecard. The results may include a requirement for individual contribution as well as team performance.
Adheres to all regulations, compliance and Bank policies, procedures and delegated authorities.
Manages risk related to credit, operational, reputational, regulatory and legal aspects of personal interactions.
Performs general office management duties as assigned.
Completes required training by established deadlines.

Position Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor degree with a minimum of 2 years experience in a sales, financial services, or lending role.
-Or-
High school diploma or GED with a minimum of 6 years experience in a sales, financial services, or lending role.

Additional Requirements:
Must possess a valid driver's license. Position requires frequent driving to other offices, bank customers, etc. Bank car not provided.

Must complete federal registration and annual renewal as required by the SAFE Act.
Sales, referral and service skills to effectively sell the Banks products and make qualified referrals to Bank partners.

Other Preferred Requirements:
Advanced knowledge of features and benefits of various bank deposit products, and related policies and procedures.
Considerable knowledge of retail lending products and services and related policies and procedures.

ZestFinance is looking for a highly strategic and hungry Sales leader to play a key role as we scale a game-changing business within a profitable mid-stage startup. This involves execution of sales strategy and working closely with Zest’s VP, Sales to drive revenue growth.
We are looking for an individual who is passionate about prospecting and cultivating a strong sales pipeline. This person must be experienced with a consultative, insights-based sales approach within the Financial Services sector, with a track record of growing sales, exceeding annual quotas, and strong writing and polished presentation skills. The Sales professional must demonstrate skills associated with a high-performance sales culture, especially pipeline management, lead generation, contact network development, and delivering results against a quota.
In this role you will:
Identify and drive territory/account sales plans for assigned geographic territory and then meet and exceed sales goals through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities
Work collaboratively cross-functionally, ensuring that territory and opportunity strategy is communicated and easily understood by all support staff
Ability to challenge a prospective client or industry’s perception of the status quo
Leading the entire sales cycle while building consensus within an account to facilitate a net new sale
Execute -- and lead others to execute -- flawlessly in conditions of uncertainty as Zaml grows
We are looking for: 
8-10+ years of over quota achievement selling enterprise software / SaaS solutions for technical buyers to the C-suite
Experience and track record of success selling into Fortune 1000 companies
Demonstrated experience forming and managing C-level relationships and closing sales in large complex organizations.
Strategic – goal oriented, organizes thinking within analytical frameworks
An BS or Graduate Degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or MBA is preferred
Perks and benefits:
People – the best part of Zest
Robust healthcare plans, matching 401K and unlimited vacation time
Dog friendly office with lounge areas, video games and gigantic jigsaw puzzles
On-site gym with yoga, salsa, and other employee run fitness classes
Generous family leave policy (6 month maternity leave/3 month paternity leave)
Tuition reimbursement, conference allowance and Zest talks
Complimentary massages, manicures, pedicures and more
Daily catered lunches from LA’s best restaurants and fully stocked kitchen
About ZestFinance:
ZestFinance, Inc. applies its unique credit-decisioning technology platform — based on data science and machine learning — to help lenders effectively predict credit risk so they can increase revenues, reduce risk and ensure compliance. ZestFinance was founded in 2009 by Douglas Merrill and a team of former Google employees with the mission of making fair and transparent credit available to everyone.
We are committed to diversity in hiring, professional development, and everyday discussion.  Zest is determined to hire crazy smart people who are different from each other to create broad thinking, lots of different ideas, and by extension, the best team possible.

At Bluebeam, our purpose is clear:  We empower people to advance the way our world is built. 
In other words, everything at Bluebeam starts with people! And our approach to selling is no different - it begins with people.
Our sales philosophy is focused on the creation of a long-term partnership with our customers, acting as trusted advisors that collaborate with them to help achieve their most business critical objectives and solve their most complex problems.  As such, we are looking to add members to our sales team that are cut from the same cloth; people that value partnerships with their customers and desire to make a positive impact for years to come!
Sound like somewhere you’d like to call home?
Here’s what to expect as a member of our Sales Team:
Take full ownership of the entire sales cycle from initial customer engagement to enterprise-level buy-in and adoption
Constantly deliver exceptional results
See challenges and change as opportunities for growth and development
Improve sales productivity by removing roadblocks and barriers for yourself and for your team
Work and communicate effectively across teams and departments
Hold yourself and team accountable
Have the ability to engage in healthy debate and conflict
Focus on results rather than just activity
Adapt and change with evolving priorities and business initiative 
So, what does it take to be part of the Bluebeam Sales team?
Here’s what we’d like you to bring to the table…
5+ years working in a professional customer facing sales role (anything from Representative to Sr. Manager). 
Refined talent in establishing successful customer relationships and contributing to successful sales goals.
Demonstrated collaboration experience with Marketing, Enterprise and Channel Sales teams, and other key internal stakeholders.
Knowledge of how to guide a customer to see value and ability to deliver results in a global and matrixed organization.
If you have management experience, we want to see your ability to positively build, motivate, and lead a team, promote high standards and quickly establish team’s focus in the face challenges or competing priorities.
Demonstrated ability to grasp the technical aspects of the business (i.e. fully understanding the products and services in order to achieve and maximize sales results).
Previous experience with CRM tools for managing customer prospects and forecasting/reporting sales opportunities
Exceptional computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
Must be extremely comfortable learning new technology. After all, we are a software company
Ability and willingness to travel (up to 50%)
BA/BS degree required. MBA is a plus
Experience in the AEC industry is preferred, but not required.  (It’ll give you better insight into our customers and how they work!)
Here’s more about what we’d like you to value:
You are someone who finds tremendous fulfillment in long-term relationship building. You are a fantastic communicator who enjoys leading and facilitating conversations, especially at the business-level. You naturally ask questions in order to understand and uncover what’s most important. You’re able to balance the big picture with shorter-term goals and you thrive in environments where you’re able to bridge gaps and recommend solutions. You believe that negotiation isn’t a power play, but rather an opportunity for organizations to be able to work together to create, communicate, and increase mutual value.
We want to hear more about you! 
Send us the following:
Resume
A cover letter that reflects your personality and specifically addresses your interest in Bluebeam and this role.  Tell us about how you believe a Sales Team can effectively build strong relationships with customers. 
 This is a salary + incentive-based compensation role
Bluebeam is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.
    #LI-MS1

For more than 35 years, Bexel has delivered unparalleled production services. Bexel has supported major broadcasters in bringing the most important events to a global audience. Our team of technicians and engineers build custom, scalable broadcast solutions for a range of services including production equipment rentals, RF audio, 4K technology, fiber optic solutions, virtual production, systems integration, product sales, and auction services.

Bexel is supported by the strength and resources of the NEP Worldwide Network. We have the proven experience and industry-leading technology to cover your live sporting events, entertainment productions, studio facilities, venue, or house of worship, and government broadcasts.

Position Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of professional and academic experience
• Travel coordination and project management experience
• Demonstrated skills in interpersonal and professional communication and an ability to interact with a wide range of personnel

• Must be organized and possess the ability to multi-task and work against deadlines

If you've got a passion for people and the desire to succeed, a position as a CarMax Sales Consultant may be for you! CarMax is a growing company that is built on the fundamental principles of integrity and treating people with respect. Here are more reasons why our Associates love working for America's #1 used car retailer:

A Great Place to Work

CarMax has been named one of the FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® since 2005. Our Associates work in a supportive, diverse, and fun environment that fosters a work/life balance. This positive work environment leads to a positive customer experience, and is a big part of why 95% of our customers would refer us to their friends.

Top-Notch Training

Don't have automotive sales experience? CarMax is ranked as one of the best training companies in America. You'll enjoy world-class, training with your own personal sales mentor who is dedicated to your success. We provide ongoing training, support self-development, and we learn as a team.

Career Growth and Recognition

With more than 180 stores nationwide and growing, CarMax Associates have fantastic career opportunities. Our incentive programs provide the potential for additional earnings, recognition, and perks!

CarMax Sales Consultant responsibilities include:

- Providing exceptional service throughout the customer's experience.

- Communicating effectively both in-person and over the phone to discover the customer's wants and needs.

- Serving as an advocate for CarMax by sharing what makes us the smart choice.

- Navigating and using various provided computer programs as selling tools.

- Consulting and guiding your customers to the appropriate next step based on their situation.

- Facilitating steps of the sale, such as the vehicle appraisal process, taking test drives, and submitting finance applications.

- Maintaining a working knowledge of CarMax products and appropriately recommending them to customers.

- Reading, collecting, and transcribing data in order to complete accurate paperwork.

- Seeking out opportunities for self-development, participating in training, and welcoming performance feedback.

- Building and maintaining strong relationships and demonstrating excellent teamwork.

- Maintaining the sales area so our vehicles and products are neatly and accurately displayed.

This position may require other duties as assigned. For store positions, the responsibilities may vary by store.

OVERVIEW
VICE is seeking a Director of Sales to acquire and develop new accounts for our digital, linear and social properties, reaching over 70M+ million young people a month in digital and 66.5M+ in linear. Sales duties are focused primarily online media but also can include event sponsorships, creative services, production deals and 360 integrations across digital, social and linear. The selected candidate would be expected to understand integrated media, custom content and have a range of relevant experience.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Maintain existing lines of business and effectively obtain new business
Cultivate and manage existing relationships across TV, Digital, Print, Custom Content, Experiential and Social at the agency and brand levels.
Effectively build rapport among peers and department heads supporting sales
Calling on a set list of clients and agencies in or around LA and PAC NW
Provide marketplace feedback to help better craft ad products, marketing and media plans to increase IC and Company wide goals
Entrepreneurial spirited individuals who enjoy autonomy around crafting custom programs
Meet monthly, quarterly and yearly revenue budgets
Experience and Qualifications:
6+ years of sales experience within a media industry
Warm client relationships
Strong rolodex across West Coast clients specifically LA/SF/PACNW
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Knowledgeable and passionate about all facets of VICE
Creative problem-solving skills and a commitment to execution of task
Computer literate with Macintosh Apple systems and other digital marketing systems
Prefer experience at a range of publishing, platform and/or agency experience

Factual's mission is to make data accessible to everyone. We believe that high quality, accurate data should be accessible to every developer, entrepreneur, business, and organization. To make this goal a reality, we end up taking on unusual problems with small, focused teams made up of highly motivated people.
We are looking for a Sales Operations Manager to join us. We have a growing Sales and Account Management team and require an experienced professional to support the growth of our business. If you are passionate about Sales Operations, managing incentive plans, supporting sales initiatives and supporting revenue growth, we want to speak to you.
This position is based in our Los Angeles headquarters.
Responsibilities:
Manage incentive compensation plan. Ensure timely exchange of monthly data among business partners, calculate eligibility, reviews and distributes reports, fields inquiries from sales colleagues, and initiates data investigation and communicates resolution.
Identify, track and report on key operating metrics across a variety of teams and internal stakeholders.
Primary liaison in the Revenue Organization on sales force automation projects/trends.
Maintain existing sales reports and designs new reports as needed.
Develop sales operations policies and procedures.
Work in the field with sales representatives to identify opportunities for improvement and attend weekly, monthly and quarterly planning and review meetings.
Requirements:
4-6 years of experience in a Sales Operations, analytics and management of sales operations plans, preferably in a digital marketing or SaaS business.
Stand-out communication skills paired with strong business insight.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experienced with project management.
Technically proficient in the use of tools and solutions, as well as understanding the underlying business you support.
A bias towards action and the ability to work well in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial start-up environment.

About Entertainment One
Entertainment One Ltd. (LSE:ETO) is a global independent studio that specialises in the development, acquisition, production, financing, distribution and sales of entertainment content. The Company’s diversified expertise spans across film, television and music production and sales, family programming, merchandising and licensing, and digital content. Through its global reach and expansive scale, powered by deep local market knowledge, the Company delivers the best content to the world.
 Entertainment One’s robust network includes film and television studio The Mark Gordon Company; content creation venture Amblin Partners with Steven Spielberg, DreamWorks Studios, Participant Media, and Reliance Entertainment; leading feature film production and global sales company Sierra Pictures; unscripted television production companies Renegade 83, Paperny Entertainment and Force Four Entertainment; world-class music labels Dualtone Music Group and Last Gang; and award-winning digital agency Secret Location.
 The Company’s rights library is exploited across all media formats and includes more than 100,000 hours of film and television content and approximately 40,000 music tracks.
Position Summary
Global Sales is the distribution arm of Entertainment One Limited. This newly formed division will focus on monetizing both TV and Film content across PayTV, FreeTV, and SVOD platforms.
 Given the evolving customer landscape, this is a critical role in the EOne Global Sales Division. In this role, you will assist the licensing of content to broadcast clients across the USTerritory evaluating market-by-market sales strategies. Tasked with proactively building strategic relationships with clients, you will play a critical role in supporting the US Sales team in effectively capitalizing on the high growth of all content sales activity.
 In addition to working closely with Executive Vice President Sales AMERICAS to develop these relationships you will work closely with Marketing, Business and Legal Affairs and Operations to ensure that local deals are fully leveraged.
 You will manage a small Sales Team based in the USA who are fully-dedicated to eOne content and are sales experts. Building relationships and revenue within the territory you will also support the EVP Sales AMERICAS source and develop new business relationships and clients across US.
Key Responsibilities
Deliver growth of the annual sales budget year over year
Maximize all potential paths for content from terrestrial syndication to OTT services by applying sales strategies
Catalogues include, but are not limited to: TV International, family and film when requested.
Responsible for sales results on new content, library titles from the eOne catalogues as well as presales when required
Work with head of global production on US presales of eOne produced scripted and factual content
Attend weekly sales meetings for Film, TV, and Digital
Liaise with regional sales directors to ensure maximum exploitation of eOne content in the territory and across regions
Provide guidance to eOne development team on what kind of content various television outlets have an appetite for
Work with acquisition departments in Canada, UK, US and other territories, introducing new leads and participating in the evaluation process by providing sales projections and market intelligence
Negotiate short/long term agreements working closely with business affairs and delivery personnel
Liaise regularly with the Finance and Acquisitions departments on budget projections for programming deals
Help to maintain producer relations when needed, i.e. calls with producers or sales efforts in the territory
Travel around US on a regular basis, in order to develop and build relationships with new and existing clients working within the travel budget
Maximize all media opportunities on all titles
Secure the best platform for the individual genre of program
Exploit the programming portfolio to maximize its potential individually and as a whole
Establish and maintain ‘best in industry’ reputation with broadcasters
Provide input into overall distribution strategies including offering reliable market feedback on titles and viable commercial targets
Attention to client needs a must
Seek out new revenue channels with regard to eOne products and seek to exploit them to the maximum
Provide reporting on deal negotiations, weekly and monthly reports on sales deals, target clients and market developments
Work on annual budget and reforecasts when required
Place eOne titles with 3rd party DVD/HE companies as needed
Continuously monitor competitor releases and prepare commercial opinions to share at a company level and update as needed
Propose new business opportunities to direct manager
Work with Global Digital team and Canadian team to Negotiate and oversee the digital overall agreements in the territory
Negotiate TV/digital windows in a way that allows eOne to exploit content in numerous ancillary windows
  Key Competencies
Dynamic and energetic approach to work
Extensive experience in US TV sales, including demonstrable evidence of sound sales techniques and excellent results
Extensive understanding in the TV acquisition process and ability to consistently find and bring in new programming for international sales.
Comprehensive knowledge of the broadcasting environment including specific market knowledge regarding genres and territories.
Excellent Customer Service skills
Numerate and able to provide clear financial reports
Strong presentation and direct negotiation skills
Excellent organization skills
Highly motivated and driven to exceed targets
Willing to travel and work flexibly
A strong team-work ethic
Knowledge of other languages beneficial
Excellent communication skills imperative
Additional languages an asset
 We thank everyone for their interest but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 We are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Job Summary

The Commercial Sales Manager is responsible for partnering with other Sales Managers to enable the store to exceed targeted revenue and profit budgets while maintaining the highest levels of guest satisfaction as measured by guest surveys. The primary focus of this position will be to build a book of business with commercial clients. The Commercial Sales Manager will be a fully functioning member of the Sales Leadership Team, with one primary difference. Instead of leading a sales team through Department Leads, this position will focus on commercial revenue generated through the store.
The position will report directly to the General Manager, but also work in close partnership with the Commercial Business Manager. This position will also provide training and support for the application of Foundational Excellence (SOP, Talent, and Leadership) to the Sales Team.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Commercial Sales
Generate store revenue primary through the following revenue streams:
Commercial and designer databases, including interior designers, commercial designers, residential builders, and business-to-business accounts
Gift card program
Attract new clients through activities, such as
Attend networking events
Conduct on-site consultations
Deliver formal sales presentations
Make cold calls
Host in-store promotional events for designers
Manage accounts and maintain client relationships, including Living Spaces "influencers"
Training - Ensure that the entire store team, with a special focus on Design Specialists, has completed training to effectively support the store's commercial initiative
Brand Experience - Ensure that every client involved in the commercial sales program has a positive experience with the Living Spaces brand
Guest Experience - Ensure that every client, whether external or internal, receives excellent service from initial contact, to the purchase, and through delivery. A key indicator of success will be guest loyalty.
Sales Floor Leadership - Take complete ownership of the sales floor and of financial outcomes (measured by SPV) through execution of the SFL SOP. Actively engage both team members and guests to assess execution of Living Spaces Guest Engagement Model.
Assessment - Able to identify current reality by completing accurate monthly assessments of the commercial sales program.
Performance Management - Able to change current reality through gap management and by creating business plans for: Process - able to tell a story of how the commercial sales SOP and process inconsistency and/or opportunity has shown improvement.
Role Responsibility and Business Rhythm - The percentages are approximate and can change over time. Because the rhythm below requires workdays on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and one weekend day, a typical work week will either be Tuesday through Saturday or Sunday through Thursday.
In-store support - 40%
Conduct Sales Floor Leader shifts as scheduled
Participate in Wednesday leadership activities
Provide in-store sales support one weekend day per week
Commercial sales - 60%
Conduct in-field and/or in-store commercial related sales activities
Participate in the Tuesday commercial conference call
Partnerships - Able to build productive working relationships with:
Commercial Business Manager
Regional Directors
General Manager and Sales Managers of home store
Operations Manager and Brand Manager of home store
Design Specialists of home store
Retail Support Team
Other external commercial partners
SOP - Adhere to all company standard operating policies and procedures.
Complete other duties assigned at the discretion of management.


Education and Experience

Commercial sales and/or sales management experience, preferably in the home furnishings industry.
A strong "eye for design," preferably with designer certification and/or experience
Demonstrable experience executing sales plans, creating new partnerships, building new business contacts, and performing formal sales presentations.
Associate's degree or Bachelor's degree preferred, but not required.


Living Spaces Retail Values

We expect all retail team members to understand and live the following values while on the job. We believe these are critical in creating an environment and culture where a team of world class leaders, regardless of title or position, create the best possible team member, guest, and financial outcomes for Living Spaces Furniture.
Show integrity, objectivity, and adaptability
Do things for people, not to people
Work in unity to deliver greatness while building for the future
Lead in service to others


What we offer:

Living Spaces offers a professional working environment that promotes teamwork, creativity, and supports individual growth and development.
Living Spaces provides a team oriented retail environment. Living Spaces offers a competitive benefit package including medical, dental, and vision insurances, 401K, employee discount, company annual holiday party and picnic.

Living Spaces is an E-Verify employer.

Position Overview:

The Regional Sales Development Manager (RSDM) is a seasoned sales person or sales leader who can use their talents to run sales contests and projects that help drive incremental revenue at the local and regional level. The RSDM works closely with local sales management and cross-functionally with the sales force, service teams, marketing, specialties, and knowledge management to improve sales effectiveness at all levels in the assigned territory. The Regional Sales Development Manager also provides individual and group coaching, develops and conducts workshops and webinars, and attends local and regional sales leader calls.

The RSDM is a highly autonomous "internal consultant" who reports to the VP, Sales Force Development.

Responsibilities:
Trains producers and other members of the sales force on sales skills
Coaches producers and account managers at the deal-level and at the skill-level
With the VP of Sales Force Development, runs projects designed to help the sales force improve organic growth, cross-sell, and account rounding
Performs other related duties as assigned or required
Frequent travel (up to 75%)

Undergrad degree required
Actively licensed Commercial Lines Insurance Producer or Employee Benefits Producer
Dual-licensed CL & EB preferred
A combination of experience in selling Commercial Lines Insurance and/or Employee Benefits adding up to at least 6 years
Professional consulting experience highly desired
Exposure to Microsoft Dynamics CRM or similar CRM system
Exposure to Broker Management System (EPIC preferred)
Performance management and coaching skills experience
Strong self-starter
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong impact and ability to influence successfully in a matrix organization

Location: United States, California, Los Angeles

Required Education: Bachelor's degree (4-year degree)

Required Experience: 7-10 years

Required Travel: Up to 75%

About Shift
We believe car buying should be fun, fair, and accessible to everyone. We’ve set out to transform an industry, using technology to bring transparency and convenience to the car buying process. 

And we aren’t stopping there. We aim to bring that same transparency and convenience to car ownership too, with payments, maintenance, and insurance in one easy app. At Shift, we’re building the tools that empower people to buy, own, and sell the cars that make life go.

We’re looking for a strong team leader, with a positive attitude and ability to manage a strong and fast­-growing team. As the Buyer Inside Sales Manager you will help build, develop, and oversee a large, multi-dimensional team of Inside Sales Specialists as well as be responsible for driving sales results.

Your role will be to support every aspect of building the team; including hiring, developing and coaching Inside Sales Representatives in all areas from qualification to closing a sale. This will be accomplished while maintaining a culture focused on prioritizing customer service to create a delightful customer experience.

In short, you’re an energetic and inspiring coach and manager that builds high-performing teams.
Responsibilities:
Develop and oversee the Inside Sales team
Exceed monthly sales targets ensuring continual aggressive growth across all markets
Coach your team on effective sales strategies, pipeline management, and opportunity management
Continuously increase effectiveness of team, identifying opportunities for processes and tools improvement, and collaborate in their roll-out
Create a culture of focus, teamwork and outstanding performanceImplement strategic planning and forecasting of sales
Attract and hire a Sales team to consistently execute against and exceed business goals while creating a culture of accountability within the team
Handle customer service escalations
Requirements:
4+ years of relevant experience in Sales and/or Sales Development
2+ years experience managing a large service/sales team with the ability to deal with ambiguity and constant change
High-level problem solving abilities
Experience in sales forecasting
Exceptional customer service instincts
Ability to effectively participate in cross-departmental projects
Success in process development and implementation
Project management proficiency
Background in both sales and customer experience
Street smarts with the ability to execute and problem-solve
Ready and willing to roll up your sleeves to drive team toward success
Bachelor’s degree
Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.
On diversity
Our company depends on balance and equality — between buyers and sellers, among employees, and in our relationships with customers.

Our mission to evolve car ownership and transform an industry is a challenging one. It can only be achieved by a team of diverse problem-solvers — engineers, designers, business people — from the same broad demographics as our customers.

Why join now?
We’ve built a small but highly talented team backed by $120 million in funding from investors like DFJ, Goldman Sachs, and BMW iVentures. We’ve got product-market fit, but there’s still a ton of room to innovate and make your mark on the product and on the company. 

Shift is the Bay Area’s #1 seller of used cars with $100 million in cars sold per year. We’re serving most of California and are gearing up to scale to new markets. With a solid business model and no clear winner in our space yet, this is a hugely exciting time to join the team.

Who You Are:
 Are you a dynamic salesperson who loves talking to clients, discovering new revenue opportunities and closing deals? Does the opportunity to sell award-winning content and services you can be proud of and believe in really excite you? Do you love being on the phone, engaging with clients, and building rapport quickly?

If so, consider a career at Getty Images in our sales organization! Submit an application here for one of our future openings as a Customer Service Associate, Sales Executive, Account Executive, or Sales Manager. If a role opens that is a fit one of our recruiters will reach out!
 Your Next Challenge:
 When you join the sales organization at Getty Images, you’ll help clients do their best work by introducing them to our inspiring content and innovative technology. You’ll be responsible for achieving revenue targets, with the following opportunities at your fingertips:
 Uncapped Commissions – potential to double your salary with a hunter mindset that delivers results
 Promotion Track for Success – company goal to promote talent from within
 In-depth Training Program – Getty Images is committed to investing in our team and each individual’s success
 Additional Incentives throughout the year
 What You'll Do:
 Customer Support Associate:

Position yourself as the industry expert and consultant to your partners and prospects by understanding their unique needs and providing strategies to maximize their potential and grow their business.

 Sales Managers:

Manage, coach and inspire sales teams.
 Everyone:

Use CRM to track and analyze metrics.
 Who We Are:
 Getty Images is the most trusted and esteemed source of visual content in the world, with over 200 million assets available through its industry-leading sites www.gettyimages.com and www.istock.com. The Getty Images website serves creative, business and media customers in almost 200 countries and is the first place people turn to discover, purchase and share powerful content from the world's best photographers and videographers. Getty Images works with over 200,000 contributors and hundreds of image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 130,000 news, sport and entertainment events, impactful creative imagery to communicate any commercial concept and the world's deepest digital archive of historic photography. 
 Visit Getty Images at www.gettyimages.com to learn more about how the company is advancing the unique role of still and moving imagery in communication and business, and enabling creative ideas to come to life.  For company news and announcements, visit our Press Room, and for the stories and inspiration behind our content, visit Stories & Trends. About Entertainment One
Entertainment One (“eOne”) is a publicly-traded global entertainment company.  eOne’s diversified expertise spans across film, television and music production and sales, family programming, merchandising and licensing, and digital content. Through its global reach and expansive scale, powered by deep local market knowledge, the Company delivers the best content to the world.
 Based in Toronto, Canada, eOne was founded in 1973 as retail music distributor Records on Wheels. By 2003 the company had expanded into film, television and family content production and distribution. The company became a constituent of the London Stock Exchange’s FTSE 250 Index in 2013.
 Entertainment One’s robust network now includes the film and television studio The Mark Gordon Company; content creation venture Amblin Partners with Steven Spielberg, DreamWorks Studios, Participant Media, Reliance Entertainment, Alibaba Pictures and Universal Filmed Entertainment; the newly-launched MAKEREADY with Brad Weston; leading feature film production and global sales company, Sierra Pictures; unscripted television production company Renegade 83; world-class music labels Dualtone Music Group and Last Gang; and award-winning digital agency, Secret Location.
 With offices across North America, Latin America, the U.K., Europe, Asia and Australia, the company has an expansive global footprint of original development, acquisition, production, financing, distribution and sales of must-have entertainment content.

You get better every day.  You welcome the gift of feedback. You never settle for your quest to grow and develop. By being here, you make our company stronger.
WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:
You’ll hear a lot about culture and perks from other companies, but we like to think of it as the XO way of life. From unlimited vacation and generous parental leave benefits to free snacks and Thirsty Thursdays, we believe in happiness above all else—in and out of the office.

Who we are
At Justworks, you’ll enjoy a welcoming and casual environment, great benefits, wellness program offerings, company retreats, and the ability to interact with and learn from leaders in the startup community. We work hard and care about our most prized asset - our people.

We’re helping businesses get off the ground by enabling them to focus on running their business. We solve HR issues. We’re data driven and never stop iterating. If you’d like to work in a supportive, entrepreneurial environment, are interested in building something meaningful and having fun while doing it, we’d love to hear from you.

The job

This is an opportunity for a Sales Manager to directly impact and move Justworks forward in our success as we expand our user-base and continue to grow the business. As a Sales Manager you are a natural leader who knows how to motivate and maintain a high performing team while being positive and enthusiastic. You have a strong track record of exceeding results and iterating to improve. It truly excites you to grow a business and solve real problems.

What you'll do


Collaborate with sales leadership to create and train sales qualification process

Hire and train high-performing salespeople according to company values and methodology

Manage day-to-day performance of all sales team members and deliver reviews

Lead and schedule weekly and/or monthly team meetings with sales team and leadership

Track sales team metrics and report data to leadership on a regular basis

Coach and develop direct reports

Implement performance plans according to company procedure

Embody company culture and maintain high sales employee engagement

Meet pre-determined revenue goals through the activities of direct reports

Ensure correct usage of CRM and other sales applications

Work with sales leadership to generate ideas for sales contests and motivational initiatives


Who you are


Bachelor’s degree; business, economics, or marketing major preferred

3-5 year in a sales representative role; within the Human Capital Management (HCM) industry is required

2+ years or more of prior management experience; prior management consulting experience is a plus

You love data - you only make decisions that are backed up by the numbers

You have strong interpersonal skills

Exceptional written and oral communication skill

Familiarity with data analysts and reporting - you know Excel forward and back

Hardworking, persistent, and dependable


Visa sponsorship for this role is currently not available.

Diversity at Justworks
Justworks’ vision is for all identities, backgrounds and expressions to be represented in the workplace. We're building the foundation for long-term success and intend to cultivate a safe, collaborative and inclusive space and company culture.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Sales Engineer - based NYC, NY

Outbrain is seeking a Sales Engineer to play a key role in expanding our business. The Sales Engineer will be a key technical resource and advisor during the sales cycle and will provide technical suggestions and advise the sales team on the most suitable implementation/deployment options for a particular client need. The ideal candidate will assist the client and will provide technical know-hows and best practices to ensure the proper implementation of Outbrain solutions in addition to providing technical information and training to clients as needed. This candidate will also work with both internal and external parties to ensure that technical issues are handled quickly and appropriately.

This position will form a close partnership with Global Technical Operations, Account Management, Product Management, Engineering and Sales Teams and will contribute to successful implementation and use of Outbrain products. The Sales Engineer will be challenged by complex technical problems and detailed customer configuration questions.

Responsibilities
Participate and advise our sales team during sales cycle.
Assist and educate the client in choosing suitable solutions for their needs
Provide technical know-how and best practices to ensure a proper implementation of Outbrain solutions
Facilitate integration process by providing technical assistance to both Account Managers and clients (first-time and repeat alike)
Provide product education and advice both internally and externally
Diligently troubleshoot product issues
Make technical presentations and demonstrate product features
Apply fundamental troubleshooting skills to issues before escalating to the appropriate group

Qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent
3-5 years of experience in a technical client services environment
3-5 years of experience with HTML, CSS, Scripting, server-side technologies and JavaScript
3-5 years of experience with implementing product SDK/API solutions
Proficiency in XPath(ing)/Regex(ing) content
Strong knowledge of Internet technologies and a demonstrated capacity to learn
Ability to actively drive problems to resolution
Strong decision-making and critical thinking skills
Exceptional organization and prioritization skills
Exceptional client facing skills
Ability to interact with management and peers in an appropriate, professional manner
Effective cross-department communication
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills (verbal and written), a team player
Insightful, innovative and adapts well to a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience troubleshooting technical issues for external clients
Bonus: Experience using CRM products
Bonus: Expert knowledge of XML and RSS Feeds

Yotpo is looking for an experienced Sales Engineer who will work with the Mid-Enterprise Sales Team throughout the sales cycle. His/her technical expertise and deep eCommerce knowledge will help to drive revenue by building confidence with our sales prospects.  Working closely with our sales team in NYC, the Sales Engineer will ensure our prospective clients see the full value of the Yotpo Platform and how it can best integrate and suit the technical business needs of their organization. To achieve these goals, the Sales Engineer will work to scope out an ideal integration path, evaluate technical deliverables and determine all necessary technical resources prior to a client’s deployment. This will involve numerous meetings at different stages to fully understand the problem the prospect is looking to solve, including recommending and demonstrating the appropriate creative solution by building and delivering business cases and telling the story in a compelling narrative.  

The Role:
Work with the Yotpo Sales Team to provide both technical product and relative business expertise internally and directly to prospects.
Prepare and present both standard and custom technical demonstrations of the Yotpo platform to prospective clients.
Ensure potential customers understand the solution (technical & services) and resource requirements.
Collaborate with the Mid-Market Account Executives on planning, certifying and delivering the business case to a prospect.
Ownership of a potential RFP process by working to define internal timelines, recruiting and coordinating necessary team members, creating uniformity of the product and a quick delivery.
Capture and document client requirements to provide a scope of work and recommended solution.
Collaborate with the Engineering and Project Management teams to provide the scope of a Statement of Work (SoW).
Develop a mastery of the Yotpo Platform to provide ownership of pre-sales support materials, preparation of standardized demos and the potential training of other team members as well as the Sales team.
Provide feedback to product and engineering teams on market requirements and potential enhancements.
  Requirements:
Significant experience in a pre-sales engineering and/or consulting role with at least 3 years working directly with customers.
Experience working with web technologies. For example: Restful API / HTTP / familiarity with Javascript
Excellent presentation skills and confidence in front of larger audiences.
Engaging persona with ability to build relationships with business and technical contacts at all levels of a client’s organization.
Ability to articulate and document both product-specific as well as high-level technical solutions to solve customers’ business problems.
Experience in eCommerce and/or business software (SaaS) preferred.
Understanding of sales methodologies and experience in solution selling.
Digital marketing experience preferred.
Must be prepared to travel when necessary.
Work well in a team environment.
  Why Yotpo?
Yotpo is in the enviable position of working with the coolest, fastest-growing, and most innovative brands in commerce. Many of our customers launch with us, and many more grow with us. We’re pioneers in the most exhilarating area of the retail industry!
Titles are just that. Everyone in the office has equal respect for each other and we genuinely enjoy spending time with one another, inside and outside the office.
The opportunity to learn from and work closely with our VP Sales, Senior Director of Sales and entire sales organization 
We offer a competitive salary, uncapped commission and benefits.
About Yotpo:

Yotpo is the leading customer content marketing platform for commerce brands. With Yotpo, businesses can collect every type of user-generated content and use it to build a stronger brand and better customer experience.

Yotpo’s integrated solution lets brands collect, curate, manage, and respond to user-generated content from a single platform. Through a combination of technology, integrations, and partnerships, Yotpo makes it easy to effectively leverage customer content throughout the buyer journey to increase trust, social proof, and sales.

Yotpo’s robust platform makes enterprise-level technology available to businesses of all sizes. That’s why the world’s leading commerce brands, like Away Travel, MVMT Watches, UnTUCKit, and Esurance, choose to grow with Yotpo. An official partner of Google, Facebook, and Shopify, Yotpo has raised $101 million in funding and has over 300 employees globally.

Stack Overflow is the largest, most trusted online community for developers to learn, share knowledge, and build their careers. More than 50 million professional and aspiring programmers visit Stack Overflow each month to help solve coding problems, develop new skills, and find job opportunities.

We partner with businesses to help them understand, hire, engage, and enable the world's developers. Our products and services are focused on developer marketing, technical recruiting, market research, and enterprise knowledge sharing.

The Sales Coordinator at Stack Overflow will have an impact on the daily operations of the Revenue Department of Stack Overflow. The Sales Coordinator will work directly with the Managing and Sales Directors of the 3 business units: Engagement, Enterprise, and Talent to ensure that each team is properly supported.  They are troubleshooters, translators, help desk attendants, diplomats, human databases, travel consultants, amateur psychologists, and ambassadors to the inside and outside world.

What you'll do:
Source and execute sales teams quarterly events
Assist with tracking of Sales Contests and coordinating Sales Performance Incentive Funds (SPIFs).
Drive the communication from the sales team to the rest of the company via monthly status reports and providing numbers to upper management
Organize and coordinate all Sales training sessions including all new hire on-boarding, manager, and team training  
Coordinate travel for New Hires traveling between our 3 main offices for training
Calendar Management for Directors, as requested

What you'll need to have:
BA/BS degree
1 - 2 years experience as a coordinator or administrative assistant, experience in sales or tech organizations
Strong organizational skills  
Strong written and oral communication skills
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple stakeholders & projects

It'd be nice if you had:
Experience with and/or knowledge of Guru, Slack, Trello, Salesforce, Looker, Expensify, & Google Suite   
Project management experience

What you'll get in return:
Competitive salary
20 days paid vacation
Flexible hours
Stock options
Completely free health insurance (no copay, no premiums)
Great office w/ espresso bar, games, and free daily lunches
Gym membership reimbursement
Transportation reimbursement
Employees will never be poked with a sharp stick

Diverse teams build better products.

Legally, we need you to know this:

Stack Exchange, Inc. does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. We support workplace diversity.

But we want to add this:

We strongly believe that diversity of experience contributes to a broader collective perspective that will consistently lead to a better company and better products. We are working hard to increase the diversity of our team wherever we can and we actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of it.

DESCRIPTION
Think any shirt can look good untucked? Think again. We are currently looking for energetic, goals-driven retail Sales Associates to show our New York City customers what UNTUCKit is all about! A successful candidate will focus on customer service; assisting the customer with fits and providing an amazing shopping experience.
  Responsibilities
Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction through excellent sales service
Assess customers needs and provide assistance and information on product features
Create a fun, relaxed environment for customers to feel comfortable shopping
Maintain stock room
Actively maintain a tidy sales floor
Remain knowledgeable on products offered and discuss available options
Cross sell products
Team up with co-workers to ensure proper customer service
Be a vital part of brand decisions with customer feedback and observations
   Requirements
Proven work experience as a sales associate
Basic understanding of sales principles and customer service practices
Proficiency in English
Proficiency utilizing iPad technology
Solid communication and interpersonal skills
Customer service focus
High school degree; BA/BS degree would be a plus
Part Time: 10-30 hours per week
