Job Description:

Sr Analyst, Payment Operations

Payment Operations is critical to our business at T-Mobile and is a strategic business unit responsible for the successful collection of payments across multiple channels. As a Sr. Payments Operations Analyst, you will be joining our expanding Payment Strategy and Operations Team where everything we do is to create an exceptional customer payment experience while protecting the financial integrity of every transaction. In this role, you will provide daily operational support and oversight of the end to end payments process.


Responsibilities:

Responsible for being a subject matter expert (SME) in one or more payment subject areas: ACH, Credit Card, Debit Card, Lockbox, Cash over Counter.
Develop and implement best practices to ensure successful processing of payments and exceptions.
Consult with payment processors, banks, and credit card companies to handle various ad hoc operational challenges while looking for ways to optimize performance.
Provide tactical ownership of payment policies, procedures, and strategies to support the rollout of new payment products / service offerings.
Accountable for achieving payment performance KPI's across multiple platforms, channels, products, and lines of business.
Assist in creating a strategic vision to transform the payments experience and exceptions processes.
Identify and drive improvements to payments and exceptions to reduce payment processing expense.
POC for customer and operational escalations/issues. Advocate for and help build trusting and loyal relationships with our customers.
Help improve the operational systems, processes, and policies in support of the department's goals and KPIs.


Qualifications:

5+ years' experience optimizing the performance of payments portfolio (ACH, CC, DC, Check, Lockbox). 7+ years experience payment performance preferred.
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Supply Chain Management; Master's degree preferred.
Have a detailed understanding of the payments ecosystem, credit/debit card, ACH, Lockbox.
Experience partnering with cross functional business partners/stakeholders and third-party payment/industry partners.
SME in Microsoft Suite (PPT, Excel, Word, Visio, Outlook)
Strong experience in documenting processes, controls, risks, and business process modeling.
Demonstrated technical and business acumen with genuine interest in applying creative solutions to address challenges and opportunities within the payments space.
Complete understanding of payments and the levers that drive processing costs.
Be high energy team player who is extremely inquisitive and willing to jump in and get it done!


#LI-KS1


Company Profile:

As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile US, Inc. (NASDAQ: TMUS) is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile US provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and MetroPCS. Discrimination or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with our Company values and will not be tolerated. Furthermore, such discrimination or harassment may violate federal, state, or local law.

Qualifications
15+ years of industry and/or consulting experience that includes a progressive career trajectory
Outstanding professional achievement and distinctive impact
Led at least one large scale Lean Transformation across functions at the enterprise level; ideally across service functions and/or in service industry
Best in class continuous improvement experience; e.g., Toyota Production System, Shingo Prize, Master Black Belt, etc.
Demonstrated track record developing and building a Lean/continuous improvement program
Deep expertise in developing, coaching and mentoring leaders at all levels (from board room to shop floor)
Experience leading a Lean program in service industries such as banking, insurance, etc.
Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills
Proven ability to influence others
Effectively able to collaborate and work in teams
Resourceful, responsible, tenacious, independent and self-confident
Willingness to travel up to 80%
Who You'll Work With
At McKinsey, you can build a career out of making things happen! You'll work in one of our North America offices as part of the Operations practice. As a member of McKinsey's global Operations Practice you will be responsible for blending strategic thinking with hands-on implementation, advising on developing and defining operational strategies to help our clients in solving the world's toughest problems.
Service Operations is a rapidly growing service line with deep expertise in operations within service industries and service functions such as sales, business support functions and customer care. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our team of consultants and experts work to develop and implement strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems on a global scale. Our team acts as the trusted advisor to senior leaders and help change mindsets and model behaviors while guiding an organization and its leaders through change and implementation to achieve sustainability of their programs.
What You'll Do
You will work in teams to collaborate as thought leaders in the application of continuous improvement and Lean techniques across service industries and functions at an enterprise level.
You will guide organizations through a lean journey by applying your expertise to ensure successful implementation and sustainability of our client's Lean Transformations including creating short and long-term capability-building plans for all relevant levels of client leadership, with anticipated deliverables, outcomes, and required resources. You'll apply your experience leading Lean transformations and capability-building in the context of the overall wave/project/continuous improvement effort and you'll introduce new frameworks, tools, or ways of using existing material.
You will make a meaningful, hands-on contribution and have the opportunity to identify clients for beta testing along with participating in codifying and disseminating new knowledge in articles and white papers. You'll also contribute regularly to curriculum and leadership of multi-client programs and you'll focus on developing full-time McKinsey team members and clients to be effective problem solvers and front-line coaches.
In this exciting collaborative culture, not only will you have the opportunity to work directly with clients, you will also share your expertise and insights with colleagues globally, thereby expanding our knowledge and refining our approaches in the field of service operations.

Uber Overview
We're changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we're a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it's a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.
For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.
And that's just what we're doing today. We're thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we're in for the long haul. We're reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.
Job Description
Uber is looking for a sharp, highly motivated individual to join our operations team as a compliance operations manager. If you love setting a vision and solving problems from 30,000 feet as well as dive deep into the details, we might have the opportunity you've been looking for.
As one of the world's fastest growing companies, we're generating vast amounts of data in every one of our cities every day. We use this data to inform everything we do: build robust quality and controls processes, constructively engage with regulators and policymakers, ensure balance in the marketplace and more.
This role is looking for a manager to be based out of our Seattle office.
What You'll Do / What You'll Need / Bonus Points / About the Team
WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Drive analysis on important strategic decisions that informs key business initiatives, including licensing, certification process, city level audits and regulatory review
Develop analytical frameworks, build models, and present findings to support the company in decision-making
Identify operational weaknesses and help improve or innovate new processes
Build, maintain, communicate, and present detailed reporting at city-level, regional, and mega-regional levels
Collaborate with other city and central operations teams, as well as marketing and product teams, to ensure that insights inform broader strategic initiatives
EXAMPLE PROJECTS:
Get into the heart of the Uber PNW market by analyzing business processes and further strengthening the local regulatory operations programWork closely with central compliance teams to scale local best practices and land global/national programs.Collaborate with Policy and legal teams and engage with external stakeholders to drive an exceptional customer experience in one of Uber's most heavily regulated markets.Direct the efforts of technical and non-technical specialists to drive completion of key course-of-business work streams and automation of key business processes.
WHAT YOU'LL NEED:
Minimum of one year of experience
Bachelor's degree required
Excellent Excel and data analysis skills, SQL is a plus, Python is a major plus
Demonstrated leadership on projects and initiatives at your organization
Attention to detail and comfort with ambiguity in an ever-changing environment

Job Description:


The Director, Payment Strategy and Operations is responsible for providing strategic leadership over the end to end payment process. The Director will drive rich analytics and insights into all areas of ownership to improve the customer experience, drive costs out of the business and execute on noiseless processes. Work closely with aligned businesses including Care, Marketing, Fraud, and others to balance a great customer experience with financial controls over payment processes and operations. Lead and further develop an already best in class Payment Strategy & Operations team. Oversee five key functional areas: Payments Strategy, Operations, Risks & Controls, Project Support, and Reporting & Analytics.



Responsibilities:


Optimize the customer experience through evaluation of current business rule sets, process improvements and system enhancements in partnership with Care, Retail, Marketing, and others.

Minimize payment acceptance costs via negotiations with card companies and others and drive the implementation of best in class toolsets.

Create a robust data strategy to include a full suite of reporting and analytical tools to drive the business forward. Provide a holistic view into the health of payments and execute strategies that deliver innovative payment experiences

Effectively partner with leaders who own aspects of customer payment flow, such as Care, Retail, DTD, Accounting, Marketing, and Legal.

Reduce the volume of payment exceptions including subscriber refunds, missing payments, chargebacks, returns, and defaults.

Reduce operational costs and drive efficiencies and via automation, elimination and transfer of processes.

Drive ownership and accountability across the organization to strengthen controls throughout the payments ecosystem, and ensure the department's SOX and key controls have a 100% pass rate.

Ensure compliance with payment industry rules and regulations.

Ensure the department has a strong voice on enterprise projects that will impact payments, from a variety of vantage points: customer, financial, controls and compliance, and process.

Evaluate the department's technical infrastructure and leverage DTD to bring it to best in class.

Develop and maintain a strong relationship with out-source partner and other vendors. Tap into them for insights and opportunities to improve the business.

Hire, train, coach and lead a high caliber and diverse team. Ensure all levels of leadership are highly engaged with employees.


Qualifications:


Experience leading a large team with different functional disciplines.

Experience in payment products and services, including credit and debit cards, Automated Clearing House, NACHA, and other payments related rules and regulations.

Progressive leadership roles in omnichannel performance, payment operations and payment systems.

Proven track record of driving or partnering with IT on complex projects.

Strong business acumen able to identify and work with key business partners to maximize business results.

Strong systems and software technical aptitude, including proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.

Job Description:

This role is responsible for providing strategic planning support by organizing, directing and assisting in the implementation of programs to ensure growth, revenue and/or customer experience objectives are met. Drive strategies and performance improvement with Executive Vice President, Vice Presidents, Directors and cross-functional teams that support a best in class organization and make T-Mobile the carrier of choice. Critical liaison to enterprise-wide business initiatives focused on enhancing sales and operational efficiencies through program support including data collection, analysis, problem and solutions identification, root cause remediation, communications, change management and presentation to upper management. Identify opportunities and influence leaders to take action to shape the strategic direction of T-Mobile's Branded Retail channel.

Responsibilities:

Essential Functions
Responsible for supporting the Executive Vice President and interacting with the Vice President/Director leadership teams to drive strategic program direction and overall success as defined by the business case or leader's expectations
Provide strategic guidance by identifying, evaluating and analyzing critical priorities by partnering with teams to gather program information
Advise the Executive Vice President of opportunities on specific programs based on individual involvement and observations, and be a catalyst for action by identifying necessary changes and driving next steps until issue is resolved
Identify and propose solutions regarding obstacles or issues while understanding their financial impact on the business and experience for our customers and/or employees
Find innovative approaches and solutions to problems; Simplify and communicate complex problems through clear communication, useful tools and precise metrics that the field can execute, take action on or drive changes in behavior
Perform a leading role on diverse projects and support the implementation of programs which ensure attainment of business objectives such as growth, revenue and customer experience
Identify and participate in the development of sales programs and procedural improvements such as new labor standards and scheduling enhancements
Develop standardization and best practices for field sales impacting programs such as quota setting, workforce management and operational practices
Serve as a consulting and subject matter expert on enterprise-wide projects by adding value and identifying gaps to drive a better outcome through knowledge and experiences
Act as a conduit of current information and feedback between Senior Vice President and department leaders by planning, organizing, motivating, and controlling resources to achieve specific goals from beginning to end
Construct executive-level (SLT) presentations and present complex information from multiple departments and reporting sources in a clear, concise and decision-impacting manner
Analyze multifaceted data from retail reporting or provided from finance, and interpret in a way that is precise, methodical and accurate so that Senior Vice President can understand key takeaways
Facilitate productive strategic discussions, leadership meetings and planning sessions to ensure the purpose and objectives are met
Create content to be presented by Executive Vice President to the entire Field Sales & Operations organization
Foster professional growth and mentoring in others through best practice sharing, development or feedback such as challenging others to think strategically and drive results
Also, responsible for other Duties/Projects as assigned by business management as needed.

4+ years' Experience in a Sales and Operations role
Excellent PowerPoint and presentation skills (advanced)

Strong business acumen and analysis skills

Experience in strategic consulting OR corporate communication OR corporate strategy strongly preferred
Retail Store Operations experience

Job Description:

Specialist, Service Operations

The T-Mobile Service Operations team is on the cusp of leaping into the next generation of development taking their effectiveness and efficiency to a whole new level and we are seeking a self-starting, motivated team player to join our team.

This Specialist is responsible for supporting the various business units, systems, and vendors within the T-Mobile U.S., MetroPCS brand, Billing, OSS application layer and an assortment of peripheral systems through basic remote network surveillance and first tier trouble shooting. The qualified candidate will understand how organizations function to accomplish their goals, driving daily objectives of application support and providing the best possible service to the group's dependent thereof. The qualified candidate will facilitate interdepartmental communication to provide overall clarity, gain alignment, and achieve successful resolution as a part of the ITIL Service Delivery model.

Requires competency in customer focus, change & innovation, strategic thinking, relationship building & influencing, talent management, results focus and inspirational leadership.


Responsibilities:

Essential Functions

Works as part of a cross-functional team in a 24x7x365 environment to conduct routine remote surveillance and Tier 1 maintenance activities for all network nodes in his/her area of responsibility. Provides support to other technicians and engineers. Performs fault isolation tests related to network trouble. Monitors network alarms, and performs fault isolation testing on radio and switching networks and peripherals. Creates and responds to work orders and trouble tickets by either conducting restoration efforts or dispatching the appropriate technician for resolution. Escalates trouble tickets with third party vendors as well as second tier organizations within T-Mobile.

Enrolls in and completes training requirements to stay current on existing and new systems and products, to grow skills, and to maintain proficiency on company values and organizational requirements. Identifies, researches, and develops process improvements and recommends them to management for implementation.
Works with more senior-level technicians to gain working knowledge of how to complete more complex troubleshooting and repair functions. Uses resource documentation for reference and troubleshooting network problems.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills; effectively able to communicate with all employee levels.
Experience with identifying and resolving internal and external customer problems.

Help verify the quality of sponsored content. 

As an Operations Manager, you will be responsible for analyzing and reviewing videos, and text-based content and/or investigating, escalating and/or resolving issues that are reported by users or flagged by the system. 

Day-to-day responsibilities may include, but are not limited to: 

Serve as an advocate for sponsors.

Verify, investigate and resolve issues regarding content that is reported for account support and/or safety; flag for action, and resolve within agreed-upon turnaround times and standards of quality

Respond to inquiries with high quality, speed, and accuracy

Understand and remain up-to-date with policies and guidelines; resolve inquires according to defined policies and procedures

Fulfill base productivity and quality requirements

In the context of this role, individuals may be exposed to potentially disturbing content, and will need a level of resilience and maturity.  

This is  a virtual/remote role; 

Hours / Shifts

The role requires incumbents to work 5 out of 7 days a week on an as needed bases depending on the queue, and two consecutive days off per week.  Depending on team supported, location, and business needs, hours, shifts, and rotation frequency are subject to change.  Team Leads will try to accommodate individual schedules, but guarantees cannot be made. Given the nature of our business being 24/7, 365 days a year,  incumbents will need to bring a degree of flexibility, and remain open to working different hours, including holidays and weekends.

Be a part of the future of local news with NewsON! This free, ad-supported streaming service provides instant access to live or on-demand broadcasts across the United States on over-the-top platforms and mobile devices. NewsON is working to create an iconic platform that informs and connects people via relevant, professionally produced local news to build stronger communities and drive media innovation.

NewsON is seeking a smart, technically savvy, and driven Video Operations Engineer. We are looking for someone who is collaborative, flexible, resourceful, and has a positive attitude. We need creative problem solvers who have excellent time management skills and are comfortable working in an open office environment. NewsON is the largest streaming service for local TV news broadcasts with US coverage in 126 DMAs covering 90% of the US population. The offering is available today on iOS, Android and Roku, and is in development for new platforms. NewsON's ideal prospective customers will be large traditional network TV agencies that seek to expand their reach across platforms, as well as national consumer brands that purchase video media on a sponsorship or impression basis. NewsON is a division of Sinclair Broadcast Group, the nation's largest local media company.

Responsibilities:
Provide technical support for OTT and mobile platforms, ad technology providers and live/VOD content in a dynamic digital media environment.
Work with multiple vendors to help diagnose, isolate and resolve video ad technology and related issues.
Be a team player in a small, high-performance group to deliver results within a large enterprise, with adaptability and excellent prioritization skills.
Qualifications/Requirements:
Working knowledge of video distribution and advertising capabilities in IPTV or OTT providers
Basic AppleTV/FireTV/RokuTV operations experience (e.g. running a sample app from a vendor for validation)
End-to-end system design, integration and testing of digital video broadcast and delivery systems
Video ad experience including with DFP in an OTT environment, including implementation, monitoring and metrics
Hardware, software and network knowledge
Deep understanding of compression and streaming video technologies - HLS, FMP4, DASH, VAST/VPAID, Client and Server Side DAI.
HTTP traffic and protocols for video delivery and troubleshooting HTTP communication
Understanding of Internet protocols such as FTP, HTTP (XML, HTML), and SSH
Knowledge in TV streaming standards (MPEG2, SCTE-35, SCTE-224)
Strong problem solving, troubleshooting and collaboration skills
Scripting for CLI and automated tasks (e.g. Bash, Python, Java/C#)
Preferred Skills:
Brightscript development experience a plus
Familiar with IPTV set-top boxes and IPTV deployment a plus
Experience with DFP and/or DFP DAI a plus
Experience:
Education: 4-year degree in Communications or Computer Science
Experience: At least 2 years of Ad Tech experience (Display/Video)
At least 1 year of OTT experience (Roku, FireTV, AppleTV)
NewsON is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug Free Workplace!

Position Description:
Responsible for overall operational integrity and operations management of branch. Assists Financial Sales Manager (FSM) and area management with development and execution of branch plan to ensure financial objectives are met, customers are served professionally, and branch staff members are in compliance with all policies/ procedures. Serves in the role of Office Manager and can serve as backup for other non-lending positions in the branch.

Principal Accountabilities:
Teller Operations: Maintain overall knowledge and mastery of teller operations, complete paying & receiving transactions, such as cashing checks, accepting deposits and payments, selling negotiable instruments, & foreign exchange. Lead branch operations and risk mitigation meetings. Meet corporate accuracy, efficiency, charge off and deposit compliance objectives. Varies by size of branch. In larger branches, Customer Service, Management, and Risk Management would increase in % of time while Teller Operations would decrease.

Banking Operations: Research and reconcile outages and operational errors for self and others; secure necessary approvals; supervise teller, vault, branch capture (where utilized) and ATM operations to ensure all team members follow operational policies and procedures. Oversee team to meet corporate accuracy, efficiency, charge off and deposit compliance objectives.

Management: Perform various personnel functions, including interviewing and hiring, scheduling, assigning work tasks, and monitoring work of assigned associates. Serve as Greeter for new hires as needed. Conduct performance reviews, coach for development and provide disciplinary action when necessary.

Risk Management: From an individual and team perspective, recognize teller and branch risk exposures; maintain internal controls; maintain cash drawer limits; maintain optimal branch vault cash levels; properly secure Bank assets; performed cash verifications as required.

Customer Service: Adhere to established customer service standards, and lead branch staff in service delivery. Resolve customer problems through research and engagement of corporate partners as needed. Answer phones and manage lobby traffic.

Inside Sales & Sales Support: Contribute to branch/area sales success by referring customers and prospects to retail, business, commercial, and other bank sales partners; remain current on product knowledge and competition; participate in weekly branch sales huddles, leading sales discussions as assigned by FSM; participate in branch/area campaigns and sales initiatives through activities within the branch; identify cross sell opportunities & refer to platform.

Development: Serve as Teller Coach for Banks online teller training program. Schedule and lead additional in-branch training as needed. Ensure associates complete required classes and follow established training plans.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

Position Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
High school diploma or GED with a minimum 4 years experience in financial services or bank operations.

Additional Requirements:
Considerable knowledge of consumer and business deposit risk management issues. Strong oral and written communication skills.

Other Preferred Qualifications:
At least 1 year supervisory experience.

Because you belong at Twilio
The Who, What, Where and Why
Who?
Twilio is seeking a true “operator” to join the team that runs Twilio’s phone number operations. We are looking for a tech- and process-savvy person who loves to build seamless operations that benefit our customers. You’re empathetic and love working with customers to solve their problems. You know how to use data (including basic SQL) to make metrics-driven decisions. You love learning new technology, and you have experience configuring and operating various systems and software tools. You're thorough, organized, and process-oriented to the extreme, and you’re able to prioritize and execute multiple projects simultaneously.
What?
You’ll work on a small, collaborative team whose primary responsibilities include managing our worldwide phone number inventory and porting (transferring) phone numbers from other carriers to Twilio's platform. We project manage complex requests from our customers to port their existing telephone numbers from their current carriers to the Twilio platform, and we create new processes to port numbers in additional countries around the world as Twilio’s business expands. Additionally, we ensure that our supply of phone numbers meets customer demand without incurring undue inventory carrying costs. Finally, we work closely with Twilio’s Product and Engineering teams to troubleshoot technical problems with our internal tooling and external product offerings.
Why?
On the Phone Numbers Operations team, our primary goal is operating efficiently to ensure our customers have access to purchase and port phone numbers around the globe. We are focused on operational efficiency to deliver an excellent customer experience. We are a key part of Twilio’s Super Network, whose mission is to provide the infrastructure that catalogs, orchestrates, and delivers the world's connectivity.
Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. Come join us.   
Where?
This position will be located in our beautiful office at 375 Beale Street in San Francisco. You should expect the normal perks: catered meals, snacks, game room, ergonomic desks, etc. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, we know this is a marathon not a sprint; that builds an inclusive culture where we want all of our people to be comfortable and thrive. We seek out people who live by our values, who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.
About us:
Twilio's mission is to fuel the future of communications. Developers and businesses use Twilio to make communications relevant and contextual by embedding messaging, voice and video capabilities directly into their software applications. Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 650 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in Bogotá, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Singapore and Tallinn.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. #LI-POST

Operations Manager, San Francisco
Brilliant Earth is one of the fastest growing ecommerce jewelers in the world, and the leader in ethical origin fine jewelry. Founded in 2005, we have been featured in Newsweek, Glamour, the Today Show, and Martha Stewart among many other media outlets. We are a team of dedicated individuals with a common goal of creating a more sustainable, transparent, and compassionate jewelry industry.
We are searching for bright and passionate people who are excited to make an impact from day one and grow with the company to take on greater responsibility over time. We are collaborative, hard-working team players that welcome challenges and rise to any occasion.  Our open workspace in the heart of San Francisco encourages conversation and collaboration.  From cross-departmental meetings to frequent happy hours, Brilliant Earth team members bring a top notch attitude and a willingness to help each other grow. For more insight into our work environment and culture, and to hear from our employees, check out our profile on the Muse! 
Everyone at Brilliant Earth has a voice – we want to hear yours! If you are interested in growing with Brilliant Earth, send us a resume and cover letter letting us know why you are interested in joining our mission and our team. Please include a sentence about your favorite shape of diamond.
Position Overview:
We are seeking a results-driven, innovative and passionate leader to serve in the role of Operations Manager for Brilliant Earth.  Our Operations team is dedicated to delivering excellence from the time a customer places an order to the moment a customer opens their package. You will be responsible for managing the day-to-day product operations, including production, logistics, supply chain, inventory, and fulfillment, while maintaining strong relationships with our partners. The primary objectives of this position are to maximize efficiency, quality, and customer experience critical to Brilliant Earth’s success.
You will also be responsible for scaling our people and processes to meet the ever-growing needs of our business. The Operations Manager will lead, recruit, and motivate a team, and be required to work closely with cross-functional groups, including sales and customer service, finance, and marketing. 
The ideal person for this role thrives in fast-paced, results driven environments and has demonstrated an ability to work effectively with finite resources.  We have a social and environmental mission at the core of our company and are looking for someone who is enthusiastic about helping us achieve our social goals, as well as our business goals.
Join our team of committed problem solvers who are passionate about ensuring that every Brilliant Earth purchase meets the highest standards of quality and craftsmanship.
Key responsibilities include: 
Oversee daily product operations, including order management, production, inventory, logistics, supply chain, and fulfillment.
Ensure scalability, cost effectiveness and overall process efficiency.
Manage operations teams to empower individuals and help solve day to day problems properly allocating tasks and resources to ensure general operations run smoothly.
Promote a culture of high performance and continuous improvement with a commitment to quality.
Work closely with the executive team to contribute to the development and implementation of organizational strategies, policies, and practices.
Develop and track KPIs to measure and manage efficiencies, cost improvements, productivity, and quality.
Identify and implement technology and infrastructure suitable to the scope and size of the business along with disciplines that underlie a supply chain operation.
Analyze, formulate and implement systems, policies and procedures to ensure smooth operation of business. Continually improve and automate systems.
Recruit, hire, and develop a strong team to meet company objectives.
Manage relationships with partners and vendors, including developing new relationships and handling escalations.
Responsible for supply planning, purchasing, and inventory control. Oversee and continually improve purchasing with respect to the company’s quality, delivery and cost objectives.
Ensure all aspects of product supply chain are well developed and maintained to ensure a superior customer experience, timeliness, and a high level of efficiency.
Specific qualifications include:
7-10 years of Operations Management experience with inventory/ supply chain/ production in a product, retail, or ecommerce company preferred
BA degree required (MBA or MS preferred)
Experience managing cross-functional team of direct reports, including hiring
Highly analytical and efficient in presenting data
Highly organized with focus on execution, problem solving, and improving processes
Exceptional time management skills and accountability
Ability to think critically and adapt quickly in a flexible environment
Demonstrated abilities to lead a team within a fast-paced start up environment
Entrepreneurial spirit / self-starter
Strong computer skills, including knowledge of ERP systems
Interest in socially and environmentally responsible organizations and products

Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by improving the understanding of the past. Since graduating Y-Combinator in 2014, Checkr’s product has shifted the on-demand economy and has continued to scale into serving enterprise companies across various industries. As a company that provides modern and compliant background checks for global enterprises and startups, Checkr knows first hand how difficult it may be for individuals with prior criminal history to find employment and we want to help provide fair chances for the formerly convicted. A career with Checkr provides the opportunity to make an impact on the professional lives of millions of people and we encourage all qualified individuals to apply for our roles.
Historically, the background check industry has had an extremely high error rate, causing many people to lose out on jobs or discriminated against. Checkr is looking for an IT Operations Engineer who will help build, scale and manage our infrastructure that supports our growing team. We are looking for someone who as a strong passion for support and loves solving problems. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding on server management and ability to provide exceptional support and continue to protect Checkr’s network infrastructure.
Responsibilities: 
Build, and maintain all corporate applications, tools and services with a strong focus on security
Maintain and scale Checkr’s network infrastructure with Meraki and Aruba
Maintain and scale Checkr’s A/V infrastructure
Implement tools and automation to drive productivity and scale a lean IT team
Document solutions and procedures
Provide hands-on technical support to the Checkr team
Work with vendors to triage and troubleshoot applications and tools
As an IT Operations Engineer you must meet at least one of these requirements:
2+ years of relevant technical experience in system administration
2+ years of hands-on experience with JAMF (Casper)
Fluency in managing Meraki or Aruba networks
Brownie Points: 
Work experience in a startup environment 
Experience with OKTA 
What you get: 
A fast-paced and collaborative environment where we leverage the latest technology 
Hands-on coaching and professional development 
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement – a true meritocracy 
100% medical, dental and vision coverage 
Unlimited PTO policy 
Gym membership, transportation reimbursements 
Catered lunch, dinner, and snacks
Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr
Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.   
Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history (in accordance with San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance as well as state and/or federal laws).

Are you hungry for more than just a career move? Wondering if it’s possible for work-life to be an extension of your own personal and professional passion? Brighton Jones’ unique and inclusive culture enables you to discover your potential and pursue your definition of a richer life.

In this critical role, you will help to fully leverage the ability of the entire team to maximize office growth, development and overall effectiveness.

Assist with the design and review of sales collateral; utilize and customize firm collateral as needed

Master of Procurement and Logistics

Your Experience
Bachelor’s Degree required, two to four years work experience within project management, operations or executive administration is a plus
Unquestioned commitment to confidentiality and integrity in personal and professional activities
Highly motivated with ability to function well in a fast-paced environment with continued growth and development

Able to manage heavy workloads and projects, many on a time sensitive basis, as well as interacting with tight-knit team of firm professionals with a range of financial and tax activities
Our Culture
  As a group of individuals that love what we do and enjoy who we work with, we know that the genuine relationships we build with each other positively affect our clients and their experience of working with us. We’re intentional in cultivating a culture that is inclusive, collaborative, and celebrates individual initiative.
  We are:
Genuine - our unquestioned commitment to integrity is demonstrated in all of our personal and professional activities

Driven -  we possess good judgment, initiative and decision-making skills -  able to anticipate problems,  determine   the appropriate level of response, and act accordingly
  Our Company

We are a company that uses objectivity, creativity and passion to help our clients, colleagues and community members live richer lives. We eliminate the conflicts of interest in the financial industry by not selling products and sitting on the same side of the table as our clients.
  We are a nationally recognized wealth management firm with a strong talent focus. To the right individual, we offer a very competitive compensation and benefits package for our industry.  If you meet the above requirements, please apply online at http://www.brightonjones.com/careers/. In your cover letter, please describe your professional passions and ultimate career objectives.

Job Description
At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. We're looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you'll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Wealth and Investment Management (WIM) businesses build enduring client relationships through sound, thoughtful and objective advice. We help our clients by developing individualized plans for everything from retirement goals to business succession planning, to family legacy intentions. Services include comprehensive planning and advice, investment management, brokerage, private banking, estate planning strategies, trust, insurance and both individual and institutional retirement.
With over $462 billion in client assets, including $70 billion deposits and $40 billion in loans, Wells Fargo's Wealth Management (WM) division is one of the nation's leading providers of financial services to affluent and high-net-worth clients. Investment & Fiduciary Services (IFS) is within WM and works with our clients to build, manage, preserve and transition their wealth. As one of the nation's strongest financial institutions, we bring together a team of experienced professionals to gain insight into each client's unique situation so that we may deliver specialized wealth solutions that best meet their needs and goals. Within IFS, we have 6 Fiduciary Management Services (FMS) offices that support clients and field offices by providing trust administration, investment management, and fiduciary services.
The Securities Operations Service Specialist 4 on the Tax Operations Team performs a variety of operational tasks for highly complex securities or cash related transactions or processes that require expert knowledge of unit functions and systems. Duties may include: differentiating, processing, and reconciling transactions; and performing a variety of balancing tasks; Able to handle critical production or escalation issues; Act as liaison to other internal departments, including technology groups and external sources; Provides department level reporting using multiple sources; May create and/or maintain databases; May define user requirements and contribute to production and workflow improvements; and create or revise departmental procedures; Provides training or work direction for staff; Provides back-up for numerous department functions; May lead and/or participate in department projects; May address compliance and corporate governance issues for the department; May have extensive customer contact; Works under minimal supervision with some degree of independence.
Other Duties may include, but are not limited to:
Cash processing of tax payments requests
Reconcile non-resident tax withholding and prepare required deposits
eview, process and reconcile withholding tax payments
Complete quarterly and year-end reconciliation and reporting of non-resident withholding
Review and Respond to time sensitive tax authority notices and inquiries
Work closely with Trust Administration, Tax Liaisons and other internal clients with their concerns and questions

Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Effective organizational, multi tasking, and prioritizing skills

Solid problem solving skills


Other Desired Qualifications
5+ years securities operations and/or tax information reporting experience
Ability to provide strong customer service while listening, eliciting information efficiently, comprehending, and resolving complex customer issues
Experience in reviewing, analyzing, and interpreting federal and states withholding tax rules
Knowledge and understanding of various money movement processing (Wire Transfer, Check, ACH, etc.)
bility to identify risk factors and provide alternatives to mitigate
Customer service focus with the ability to respond to requests in a timely manner

Experience with documenting, updating and creating departmental procedures
Strong collaboration and teamwork skills
Flexible and adaptable to change
bility to lead, train, coach and mentor team members

bility to navigate multiple computer system windows, applications, and utilize search tools to find information

trong attention to detail and accuracy skills

ABOUT THIS ROLE
Do you love working with incredibly smart people who inspire you to be better and work harder every day? Do you thrive in highly cross-functional roles that work across engineering, product, and sales? Are you excited to work with clients and use your technical skills to come up with real-world business solutions that drive substantial revenue and scale? Consider joining us. This role will be based out of our San Francisco office.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Execute and automate data processes both custom and standard for clients on a daily basis, bridging the gap between LiveRamp products and client use cases.  
Work closely with clients and partners to solve technical challenges while aligning expectations across partners and clients.
Identify, design, and build product improvements and help drive efficiency.  
Act as a Technical Consultant externally and internally. You will work with many of the world's largest and most well-known brands, advertisers and agencies, financial institutions, and data providers, while collaborating with LiveRamp sales, product, and business development teams.
Act as a Product Manager for LiveRamp’s integrations (i.e. the pipes flowing out of LiveRamp to partners). You own the roadmap for the integration, you gather requirements from clients and the partner, and you are accountable for the success of the integration.
Project manage workflows, provide technical guidance, and advocate for implementing new product features in an effort to delight your clients.
Own operational and product success of clients as a LiveRamp product generalist.
Contribute towards building a great company.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors and/or Masters degree in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics, Cognitive Science) or other quantitative field.
Resourcefulness. We don't have all the answers, but you'll need to find them.
Basic programming skills or the brains and brawn to learn.
Great communication skills. Prompt response and action when needed. People rarely need to follow up with you.
Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, cross-functional, hardworking and proactive.
A desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
3-7 years in an external client-facing role is preferred (e.g. consulting, finance, etc.).
Ability to make and communicate decisions when there isn't a predefined course of action.
Technical experience with analytical tools, methodologies, and design.
Willingness and desire to learn and adopt new skills in order to craft and deliver the best solutions.
SQL or Ruby Experience. Experience interacting with APIs.

Uber Overview
About Uber
We're changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we're a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it's a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.
For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.
And that's just what we're doing today. We're thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we're in for the long haul. We're reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.
Job Description
About the Role
We're looking for an excellent Marketing Operations Manager to join our growing AdTech team.
What You'll Do / What You'll Need / Bonus Points / About the Team
What You'll Do
Develop a deep understanding of the Ad data flow and process of daily campaign data operations across all paid channels.
Lead and Scale data quality strategy and implementation for global AdTech team.
Collaborate with Marketing Stakeholders, PM and Eng to deliver on data quality KPIs.
Access quality of data in terms of accuracy completeness to the most granular level. Provide recommendations for system level improvements.
Own all aspects of data quality services- from evaluation, design processes, trend analysis, identification of common operational defects.
Identify opportunities to fix or improve processes, provide long-term solutions for marketers to build trust on data.
Lead adhoc analysis in specialized areas like fraud analysis, campaign automation, remarketing and segmentation.
Find opportunities to contribute to the breadth of Uber's marketing stack- data operations, tools in order to make operations efficient.
Collaborate with external ad partners, Tracking, Data Operations and BI team to ensure that marketing stakeholders have access to data that is reliable for attribution and visualization.
What You'll Need
3-5 years' experience in a marketing tech or data analysis, data operations or marketing tech
Demonstrates a high degree of attention to detail and validates assumptions about data correctness
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills with an attention to detail
3-5 years of SQL skills.
Plus: Hands-on with Hive and Presto.
Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to fluently communicate with engineering, product and marketing teams
Minimum 2 years of data analysis, data operations or technical operations experience
Comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment

We're changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we're a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it's a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.

Job Description
About the Role
Safety is a critical issue that resonates everywhere Uber operates. It's crucial for our users, our business, and our brand. In this role, you will lead our global Safety Operations efforts to ensure that Uber's regional processes and products set the global standard for transport safety and transparency.
As the Head of Global Safety Operations, you will build strong relationships with Product and Operations leadership around the world. You and your organization will work with these two key orgs and will be accountable for driving safety incident reduction, guiding business priorities to create safer experiences for our users, and building public trust in the safety of our platform. With your leadership, Safety Operations will drive key strategic programs including Safety Experience and Building Trust.
What You'll Do / What You'll Need / Bonus Points / About the Team
What You'll Do
Forge deep connections with Operations teams by partnering closely with RGMs, Heads of Regional Operations, as well as Heads of Regional Marketing, Safety Comms, Policy, Comm Ops and Compliance
Advocate for global Safety needs while being the voice of Safety in cross-functional strategy discussions between Operations, Product, Design, Engineering and Data Science
Leverage local insights and global best practices to create Uber's safety roadmap across the company and guide various teams through its implementation
Drive centralization across Safety systems, processes, and tech in order to drive efficiency and effectiveness of safety programs
Establish a culture of "safety first" and "doing the right thing" within Uber Operations, even when not popular, by setting the right tone from the top
What You'll Need
Minimum 8 years of experience excelling in a Product and/or Operations role
Experience managing cross-functional teams across multiple regions
Ability to transition from big picture thinking/planning to implementation/speed
Ability to set and communicate an inspiring vision AND get things done
Exceptional stakeholder management and relationship building skills
Experience working on global initiatives
Experience addressing safety-related issues
About the Team
As Uber continues expanding to hundreds of cities around the world, our safety team is striving to make Uber the safest transportation alternative on the road. Join us in making this critical mission a reality.

Experience working with creative and/or technology populations

Ability to build partnerships and work collaboratively cross-functionally
Creativity and entrepreneurial spirit a must
Proven skills in planning and budgeting

Uber Overview
About Uber
We're changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we're a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it's a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.

Job Description
About the Role
Network Optimization - The candidate will work closely with the Data Science team, to create systems analysis tools to forecast throughput potential on the Uber Elevate network and support operational decisions associated with skyport design, fleet size, process variability, contingency coverage, airspace constraints and aircraft performance. The candidate will be a primary user of the Data Science team's Flux tool and leverage the system's capabilities to conduct analysis of different network layouts, test sensitivities and make operational process decisions to optimize network throughput. He or She will be responsible for creating professional briefing materials to communicate these results to stakeholders across the ecosystem.
Simulation and Flight Test Support - The candidate will work closely with Elevate's Flight Operations, Airspace Systems and Data Science teams to ensure that all operational requirements and concepts are accurately represented in airspace simulations and flight tests, provide all required inputs/assumptions, conduct secondary analysis of outputs and organize results into impactful metrics to demonstrate the safety, reliability, predictability of operational procedures proposed for high-density eVTOL ops on the Uber Elevate network by 2023.
Operations Strategy - The candidate will work closely with our Operations and Business Development leads to identify and analyze operating system constraints and develop strategies to prevent limitations to scale. He or She will lead market research, regulation reviews, modeling efforts and expert engagements to identify barriers and map out a path to implementation of innovative solutions.

What You'll Do
The Operations Planning Associate, Aviation will focus primarily on the Uber Elevate initiative within Jeff Holden's Advanced Programs org and report to Stan Swaintek, Head of Operations Planning, Aviation. Uber Elevate is our urban aviation initiative to fast forward to ridesharing in the sky. The candidate will touch all levels of the Elevate operation and work closely with subject matter experts to support network planning, airspace simulations, and launch market coordination. He or She will also manage operational strategies to address critical system constraints and commercial opportunities in the emerging ecosystem. Primary duties include:
What You'll Need
Customer obsession
The candidate has experience in a consumer business and is customer-obsessed. He or She uses Uber's position as a thought leader and market maker to serve our riders, cities, and technology partners in innovative ways and grounds every operational decision with safety and customer experience in mind.
Vision, task organization and structured analysis
The candidate has participated in end-to-end operational planning and launch operations: starting from a large, multi-year mission with areas of ambiguity, defining the operational requirements and implementation plan. Strong collaborator and communicator

The candidate should be able to assemble documents and analysis reports that can be easily understood, even when complex design requirements and topics are being described to others who are less familiar with the topic areas. Analytical Rigor

Uber Overview
About Uber
We're changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we're a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it's a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.
For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.
And that's just what we're doing today. We're thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we're in for the long haul. We're reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.
Job Description
Uber is looking for an experienced business leader to build and lead our US & Canada Compliance Operations team. If you love setting a vision, building a team, managing cross-functional stakeholders, pushing projects forward to deliver measurable and strategically meaningful results, and solving problems from both 30,000 feet as well as deep in the details, this might be the role for you.
Operational compliance is a top strategic priority at Uber that is continuously growing in importance as we mature as a company and approach an IPO. You will build the team to centralize compliance operations at Uber, partner with our tech teams to scope, build, and roll-out the technology needed to make full compliance across myriad market requirements easy for the organization. As the business lead for compliance, you will define the operational strategy and work within your team and with others to implement it. If you're looking to shape the future of one of the most critical functions within the company now, we have the opportunity for you.
SCOPE
You will be a critical, strategic leader on the US & Canada Central Operations team. This team is focused on solving the hardest problems facing the business that impact the rider and driver experience. You will lead Compliance Operations, one of seven teams that make up the US & Canada Central Operations team, and one of the only with scope across all aspects of operations.
This is not a legal function. The Central Operations team owns the business, and your team will be responsible for monitoring, correcting, and executing business processes to maintain full compliance. The Compliance Operations team mission is to reduce business risk by ensuring we operate in accordance with all internal and external legal and business standards. This team is particularly focused on solving compliance problems by building systems; identifying product and process gaps and solving them; executing scaleable compliance processes; and providing subject matter expertise to all other cross-functional teams within the US+CAN.
The Compliance Operations team works closely with each of the other Central Ops teams, the Global Compliance legal team, and compliance leads within each subregion team. Given the cross-functional nature of Compliance and its growing strategic priority, the Compliance Operations team works with key leaders in operations; product; legal; trust, safety and insurance; and marketing.
What You'll Do / What You'll Need / Bonus Points / About the Team
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Set strategy and vision for Compliance Operations in the US+CAN; design Compliance Ops org and lead hiring to build the team
Manage the team of operators to design and operationalize compliance measures
Oversee analysis of key compliance risks to effectively prioritize business initiatives, including regulatory launches, gap closures, and product needs
Project manage initiatives and stakeholders, including legal, product, and ops to accomplish objectives
Communicate strategy, project updates, challenges, and opportunities to senior Regional Operations, US+CAN, and company executive leadership
Build, maintain, communicate, and present detailed reporting at market-, subregional-, and country-wide levels
Lead global compliance operations initiative to share best practices, identify similar global compliance challenges, and influence technology development
Collaborate across market teams, central operations, global compliance, and HQ functions (legal, product, safety, etc) to ensure that insights inform strategic initiatives and priorities; update and adjust with new information
Coach, develop, and motivate team members to achieve personal and professional goals while achieving business priorities
WHAT YOU'LL NEED
10+ years of proven people management ability, with experience managing managers
Strong people management skills. You can set the tone for your team and drive towards results, while being empathetic to your teams' challenges. EQ is a must
Experience setting team strategy and plans and bringing them to bear with cross-functional team members outside of your direct control
Deep analytical and critical-thinking ability; data-driven decision maker; skilled in coaching others in this area
Creative solutions mindset with a get it done attitude
History of influencing your organization beyond the immediate scope of your role
Stellar networking and communication skills; able to easily adjust communication style from individual contributors to senior executive leadership
MBA strongly preferred

Uber Overview
About Uber
We're changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we're a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it's a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.
For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.
And that's just what we're doing today. We're thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we're in for the long haul. We're re-imagining how people and things move from one place to the next.
Job Description
About the Role
As a part of the Uber Freight Operations team, you will work on defining and improving our operational workflow across our Sales and Account Management organization. You will work cross functionally with teams across Uber Freight, solving some of our largest operational problems, building processes, and providing analytical insights to the team. You should have strong project management skills, excellent time-management and organizational habits, and the ability to analyze and clearly communicate information to cross functional stakeholders.
What You'll Do / What You'll Need / Bonus Points / About the Team
What You'll Do
Problem solve. We're faced with new and interesting problems that need solved every single day.
Identify and implement short-term solutions in a timely manner, while helping define the long-term solution
Identify operational weaknesses and help improve or innovate new processes to keep our teams as efficient as possible
Project Management: You'll have projects that span across all teams within Uber Freight and will have the opportunity to own these projects from end to end
Analytics: Utilize data to understand our operational performance and areas for improvement. Know how to use the data and turn that into action
Work closely across our team to measure the impact and efficiency of new products and business processes
Ability to function in an ambiguous environment. You'll be the go to person for many key operational initiatives
What you'll need
Minimum 2 years experience in a data driven/consulting role; some high-growth operations or startup experience is preferred.
Balance of attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly, and we need to do them well. Balancing those can be challenging, and this should be a strength.
Explorer at heart - the ability to self-serve, investigate and problem solve. You're a self-starter, and a growth mindset attitude is a must!
Comfortable with ambiguity; the ability to structure ideas into actionable plans.
Clear communicator. You are a clear and concise communicator with the ability to synthesize a lot of information quickly, highlight the key takeaways, and disseminate actionable insights.
Strong Excel / data management skills. SQL Proficiency preferred.
Bachelor's Degree strongly preferred
An excitement for reinventing one of the largest industries in the world and helping to build an incredibly impactful marketplace from the ground up.
About the Team
Uber Freight connect shippers with truckers, much like the way that Uber connects riders and drivers. We are a team of sharp, entrepreneurial individuals who are redefining the movement of things around the world. On the Uber Freight team, we fiercely believe that our dedication to transportation technologies will bring more harmonious, highly efficient, and increasingly safer transportation logistics to our roads.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math, quantitative social sciences, or related field
Experience in predictive analytics, machine learning, and/or optimization
Fluent in one or more programming languages (R, Python, C++, etc.)
Demonstrated analytic and quantitative skills
Strong intrinsic problem solving skills, ability to structure and solve problems and conduct and interpret analysis independently
Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively
Willingness to travel up to 80%
Who You'll Work With
You'll be working with McKinsey's Operations practice in one of our North American offices. Our Operations practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems.
As part of our Operations practice, our Analytics team combines deep strategic and business insight with world-class technological and operational capabilities. Operations Analytics helps solve problems in optimization, forecasting, and simulation - not only to improve the design of physical systems, but also to address management infrastructures and employees' attitudes and behaviors, so that clients are able to lead change independently.
What You'll Do
You will shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, drive processes for extracting and using that data in innovative ways, and create new lines of thinking within an infinite number of clients and situations.
You will apply your methodological skills across our operational service areas (Supply Chain, Product Development, Manufacturing, etc.) to devise creative approaches for our clients in areas such as inventory management, predictive maintenance, or logistics network design. You will apply and advise on state-of-the-art quantitative tools and modeling techniques in order to derive business insights, solve complex problems and improve decisions. You will review, support, and inform the day-to-day analytics requirements of clients' key operational procedures while continually improving the impact of these processes.

Uber Overview
About Uber
We're changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we're a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it's a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.
For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.
And that's just what we're doing today. We're thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we're in for the long haul. We're reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.
Job Description
Uber is looking for sharp, highly motivated individuals to join our US & Canada Rides Central Operations team. If you love setting a vision, managing cross-functional stakeholders, pushing projects forward to deliver measurable and strategically meaningful results, and solving problems from both 30,000 feet as well as deep in the details, this is the role for you.
As one of the world's fastest growing companies, we're generating vast amounts of data every day. We use this data to inform everything we do: ensure balance in the marketplace, identify ways to continually make the Uber experience better for drivers and riders, deploy incentives and promotions, understand customer behavior, develop and launch new product offerings, and more.
Central Operations Managers make decisions and create processes using this data every day, and are critical to developing and owning our US & Canada business strategy.
What You'll Do / What You'll Need / Bonus Points / About the Team
What You'll Do
Drive analysis on important decisions that inform key business initiatives, including marketplace balancing efforts, promotion targeting decisions, customer engagement programs, and more.
Identify operational weaknesses and help improve or innovate new processes
Work with other Central Operations managers to solve the hardest problems impacting the customer experience and the overall business
Build, maintain, communicate, and present detailed reporting at city, regional, and mega-regional levels
Present models, findings and insights to senior management to drive business decisions
Collaborate with local and other Central Operations teams, as well as marketing, product and other central functions, to ensure that insights inform broader strategic initiatives
This role demands excellent stakeholder and project management skills
The Central Operations team owns the business, and your team will be responsible for monitoring, correcting, and executing business processes in functional areas
Some team focus areas include:
Compliance
Business Standards
Safety Operations
Airports Strategy
What You'll Need
3+ years experience of investment banking / consulting / business intelligence / strategy or related experience; some high-growth operations or startup experience is strongly preferred.
Exceptional communication and organization skills
A "driver" personality - biased toward action - constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery
Exceptional Excel / data management skills.
Self-motivated, works independently and possesses strong organization and time management skills
BA/BS from top university.
SQL Proficiency strongly preferred

About Us:
Braintree builds products that make payments easier—so easy that they fade into the background, making entirely new kinds of interactions possible. Interactions like seamlessly paying for your ride share—or the condo you rented this weekend—without presenting a card or pressing a button, or buying a lamp on Pinterest...right from Pinterest. The Braintree full-stack payment platform lets companies build their own experiences and then scale their businesses around the globe. We're known for our technology but we're also known for our support, with internal risk and underwriting, account management and technical support teams who ensure a frictionless payments experience.
Acquired by PayPal in 2013, Braintree is now in an even greater position to change the way people pay. Headquartered in Chicago, Braintree has offices in San Francisco, New York, Sydney, London with employees stationed around the world.

Community Operations' focus is on improving the health of our products and helping people understand how to use them through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving peopleâ€™s issues, and are strong advocates for the Facebook community. We are looking for a passionate problem solver to develop both a deep and broad understanding of Facebookâ€™s review policies and processes and understand where our people, processes, and systems need to improve in order to give help to the people who need it most.

In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional partners, subject matter experts, operations managers and our Engineering, Reporting, and Outsourcing teams.

Travel overnight internationally when needed (

Job Description
Build software. Reach 500 million users. Change lives.That's what we're doing at Lithium, and you can do it too! If you want to put your stamp on the digital customer experience space and enjoy yourself along the way, come join the team. We're looking for seriously passionate, fun, collaborative & innovative thinkers to help us change the world.

Description

The Director of PS Operations plays a pivotal role in the operational success of Lithium's Global PS Team. This role is responsible for policies, processes, and operations to support the Global PS organization. The Director of PS Operations collaborates with PS leadership ensuring that our operations support the needs of the various lines of business and plays a key role in representing PS in cross functional projects and initiatives, working with Sales Ops, Finance, IT, Legal and other parts of the Lithium organization.

The PS Operations Director needs to be a change agent who is an authority at scaling processes in a fast-growing technology industry.

Responsibilities
Build processes within the Professional Services organization based on industry best practices, including:
Consulting services sales cycle
Project scoping
Resource management and scheduling
Financial and legal controls
Bookings and revenue forecasting
Time tracking
Invoicing
Model the professional services business to optimize utilization and achieve financial targets.
Ownership of project staffing processes and procedures
Business owner of the professional services automation (PSA) tool that is used globally to support operations
Drive operational reporting needs of the PS team
Ownership of operational business metrics, utilization, and time entry, project completion, etc.
Act as liaison with the finance organization forecasting, budgeting, billings, accruals, and third-party expenses.
Drive tactical day-to-day operations of professional services organization including staffing optimization, reporting of project finance and resource planning and utilization.
Lead a remote Professional Services operations team.

Qualifications
5+ years of experience working in a Professional Services and/or Consulting organization
3+ years of services operations experience
Deep understanding of services financials at technology companies
Experience with Professional Services Automation (PSA)
Excellent written and spoken communication skills
Excellent analytical skills
Comfortable presenting to large internal groups and leadership team members
A can-do attitude to resolve problems and deliver results
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, ever changing environment.
Ability to understand and learn new technologies

About Lithium:

Lithium's software helps companies reinvent how they connect with their customers. We work with more than 300 of the world's best brands- including Google, T-Mobile, Sony, Sephora, Fitbit and Telstra - enabling them to respond on social networks and to build trusted content on a community they own. Lithium reaches more than 500 million consumers across 10,000 specific interest areas to establish trust and reputation. We represent one of the biggest collections of data on consumer attitudes, preferences and digital activities. Our 100% SaaS-based Lithium Social Customer Experience™ platform enables brands to build and engage vibrant customer communities to drive sales, reduce service costs, accelerate innovation and grow brand advocacy. We are experiencing rapid growth and are recognized as a leader by top analyst firms, including Gartner and Forrester. And because our culture is as exciting as our products, we've been ranked as one of Glassdoor's Best Places to Work. Come check us out!

At Lithium we encourage our employees to be real. In keeping with this philosophy, we appreciate diversity and welcome all qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, genetic information or criminal history.

Lithium offers a great working environment and competitive compensation and benefits packages. We're looking for fast-thinking, innovative, passionate team players who enjoy brainstorming new ideas, working with the best and brightest in the social media software industry.
